Title: Braised Moroccan Chicken (D'jej Mhamar)
Ingredients: ['1 (6.75 ounce) package rice vermicelli', '2 tablespoons raisins', '4 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro, divided', '3 cloves garlic, grated, divided', '1 teaspoon finely chopped preserved lemon rind', '¾ teaspoon ground ginger, divided', '1 dash ground turmeric', '1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 (2 1/2 to 3 pound) whole chicken', '¼ preserved lemon', '¼ cup vegetable oil', '1 onion, grated', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '¼ teaspoon ground turmeric', '4 cups water, or as needed', '4 threads saffron threads, or more to taste', '1 cup large pitted green olives, rinsed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Soak vermicelli noodles in hot water until softened, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Drain and add raisins, 1 tablespoon cilantro, 1 clove grated garlic, 1 teaspoon chopped preserved lemon, 1/4 teaspoon ginger, 1 dash turmeric, salt, and pepper.
', 'Step 3: Clean the chicken, keeping the skin intact.
', 'Step 4: Stuff with the prepared vermicelli.
', 'Step 5: Tie legs closed with kitchen string.
', 'Step 6: Remove seeds from preserved lemon and cut into 2 or 3 pieces.
', 'Step 7: Heat oil in a stock pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 8: Add grated onion, preserved lemon, remaining 3 tablespoons cilantro, remaining 3 cloves garlic, 1 teaspoon salt, 1/2 teaspoon black pepper, remaining 1/2 teaspoon ginger, cinnamon, and 1/4 teaspoon turmeric.
', 'Step 9: Stir together over medium heat.
', "Step 10: Add chicken and fry, being sure it doesn't stick and break the skin, about 2 minutes on each side.
", 'Step 11: Add enough water that the chicken is about half immersed.
', 'Step 12: Add saffron.
', 'Step 13: Cook until chicken is no longer pink in the center, 30 to 40 minutes, checking water level occasionally.
', 'Step 14: Add olives about 15 minutes before the chicken is finished.
', 'Step 15: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the thigh, near the bone, should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 16: Remove the chicken to a plate and reduce the sauce until it is thick, 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Pat the chicken dry and remove kitchen string; place in a baking dish.
', "Step 18: Set an oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 19: Broil chicken in the preheated oven, turning as needed, until skin is darkened and crisp, about 5 minutes total.
', 'Step 20: Spread the sauce on a platter and place chicken on top.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '386.1 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '23.7 g', 'cholesterolContent': '66.2 mg', 'fatContent': '21.1 g', 'fiberContent': '1.8 g', 'proteinContent': '24.7 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '4.7 g', 'sodiumContent': '1219.1 mg', 'sugarContent': '3.5 g'}

Title: Dersa (Algerian Chile Paste)
Ingredients: ['4 cloves garlic - peeled, halved, and germ (green sprout) removed', '½ small red chile pepper, seeded and coarsely chopped', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon paprika', '½ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '2 tablespoons olive oil']
Cooking Instructions: ['Step 1: Place garlic, chile pepper, cumin, paprika, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper in a mortar; grind into a paste using a pestle.\n', 'Step 2: Pour in olive oil and mix well.\n']

Title: Moroccan-Spiced Roasted Carrots
Ingredients: ['2 pounds carrots, cut into thick slices', '¼ cup olive oil', '2 tablespoons lemon juice', '2 teaspoons white sugar', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '⅛ teaspoon cayenne pepper, or to taste', 'aluminum foil']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Toss carrots in a bowl with olive oil, lemon juice, sugar, cumin, cinnamon, garlic powder, and cayenne pepper.
', 'Step 3: Transfer to a large roasting pan and arrange in a single layer.
', 'Step 4: Roast in the preheated oven, turning often, 20 to 30 minutes.
']

Title: Instant Pot® Lamb Tagine with Lentils
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons ghee (clarified butter)', '1 onion', '1 pound cubed lamb stew meat', '2 large tomatoes, diced', '1 ½ cups diced potatoes', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon ground coriander', '½ teaspoon ground turmeric', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '½ teaspoon ground ginger', '½ teaspoon paprika', '1 teaspoon chili flakes', '2 tablespoons tomato paste', '2 cups chicken broth', '1 cup dry lentils', '⅓ cup raisins, or more to taste', '2 tablespoons honey', '1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) and select Saute function.
', 'Step 2: Add ghee.
', 'Step 3: Add onions and cubed lamb to the melted ghee; cook and stir until lamb is browned and onion is soft and translucent, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Stir in tomatoes, potatoes, and garlic.
', 'Step 5: Cook for 2 more minutes.
', 'Step 6: Mix in salt, pepper, cumin, coriander, turmeric, cinnamon, ginger, paprika, and chili flakes.
', 'Step 7: Stir in tomato paste.
', 'Step 8: Add chicken broth, lentils, raisins, and honey; stir until all ingredients are well combined.
', 'Step 9: Turn Saute mode off.
', 'Step 10: Close and lock the lid.
', "Step 11: Set vent to 'Sealing' and select Meat/Stew mode according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 30 minutes.
", 'Step 12: Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
', "Step 13: Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, for 10 minutes.
", "Step 14: Turn vent and release remaining pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions.
", 'Step 15: Season with salt and pepper, if needed.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '400.8 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '46.7 g', 'cholesterolContent': '56.3 mg', 'fatContent': '14.6 g', 'fiberContent': '13.2 g', 'proteinContent': '22.3 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '6.7 g', 'sodiumContent': '849.2 mg', 'sugarContent': '15.7 g'}

Title: Mommy Bart-Williams' Spinach Leaves
Ingredients: ['2 onions, chopped', '1 green bell pepper, cut into chunks', '¼ habanero pepper, or more to taste', '3 tablespoons light virgin palm oil', '½ cup water', '1 tablespoon peanut butter, or more to taste', '2 cubes chicken bouillon', '1 teaspoon salt', '2 bunches fresh spinach, cut into thin strips']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Blend onions, green bell pepper, habanero pepper, and oil in a blender until creamy.
', 'Step 2: Transfer the onion mixture to a stock pot.
', 'Step 3: Add water, peanut butter, bouillon cubes, and salt to the onion mixture.
', 'Step 4: Place a cover on the stock pot and bring the mixture to a boil; cook at a boil for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Stir the spinach into the boiling mixture; replace the cover on the stock pot and cook until the water has evaporated a bit and the sauce has the consistency of gravy, about 30 minutes more.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '139.6 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '13 g', 'cholesterolContent': '0.2 mg', 'fatContent': '8.8 g', 'fiberContent': '4.3 g', 'proteinContent': '5.2 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '3.8 g', 'sodiumContent': '877.8 mg', 'sugarContent': '4.4 g'}

Title: Lamb Merguez Sausage Patties
Ingredients: ['1 teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon fennel seeds', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '½ teaspoon ground coriander', '¼ teaspoon ground turmeric', '3 cloves garlic, peeled', '2 tablespoons harissa, or to taste (see Ingredient note)', '1 tablespoon tomato paste', '1 pound lean ground lamb', '1 tablespoon olive oil']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine salt and fennel seeds in a mortar and pestle and pound until fine.
', 'Step 2: Stir cumin, cinnamon, coriander, turmeric, and garlic cloves into the salt mixture and continue grinding to form a thick paste.
', 'Step 3: Stir in harissa sauce and tomato paste until combined.
', 'Step 4: Combine ground lamb and the spice paste together with a fork in a large bowl.
', 'Step 5: Cover and refrigerate overnight.
', 'Step 6: Form sausage into patties.
', 'Step 7: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 8: Cook patties until no longer pink inside, 5 to 8 minutes per side, depending on the size of the patties.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '267.7 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '2.8 g', 'cholesterolContent': '75.9 mg', 'fatContent': '19.2 g', 'fiberContent': '0.6 g', 'proteinContent': '19.9 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '6.8 g', 'sodiumContent': '718.4 mg', 'sugarContent': '0.5 g'}

Title: Moroccan Couscous with Rhubarb
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 medium onion, chopped', '½ cup chopped dried apricots', '½ cup finely chopped rhubarb', '1 cup couscous', '1 ¼ cups chicken stock', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon ground ginger', '¼ teaspoon ground cardamom', '¼ teaspoon ground allspice', '¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '⅛ teaspoon ground cayenne pepper', '1 pinch ground cloves']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Add onion and cook until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Stir in apricots and rhubarb.
', 'Step 4: Cook for 2 more minutes.
', 'Step 5: Mix in couscous, chicken stock, salt, cumin, ginger, cardamom, allspice, cinnamon, cayenne, and cloves - mixture will be thick.
', 'Step 6: Stir and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 7: Cover and remove from heat.
', 'Step 8: Let sit for 10 minutes until all the liquid is absorbed.
']

Title: Fried Cauliflower (Egyptian Style)
Ingredients: ['2 teaspoons ground cumin', '1 head cauliflower, cut into florets', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '1 egg', '2 cloves garlic', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 tablespoon tomato paste', 'salt to taste', '¼ cup milk, or as needed', '2 cups vegetable oil, or as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil; add 2 teaspoons cumin to boiling water.
', 'Step 2: Cook cauliflower florets, working in batches, in the boiling water until cooked but still crisp, 1 to 2 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Remove with a slotted spoon and cool on a plate.
', 'Step 4: Blend flour, egg, garlic, 1 teaspoon cumin, tomato paste, and salt in a blender or food processor until smooth; thin with milk as needed.
', 'Step 5: Heat oil in a deep skillet to about 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 6: Dip cauliflower florets in the batter; fry battered cauliflower in the hot oil, working in batches, until cauliflower is golden and crispy, 6 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on a paper towel-lined plate.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '283.9 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '34.2 g', 'cholesterolContent': '47.7 mg', 'fatContent': '13.4 g', 'fiberContent': '4.8 g', 'proteinContent': '8.7 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '2.1 g', 'sodiumContent': '102.5 mg', 'sugarContent': '4.9 g'}

Title: Vegan Moroccan-Style Tagine with Seitan
Ingredients: ['1 (10 ounce) package seitan', '2 tablespoons vegan butter', '2 tablespoons ras el hanout', '1 teaspoon olive oil, or as needed', '1 medium onion, chopped', '4 cloves garlic, minced', '1 large sweet potato, cut into 1/4-inch cubes', '1 (15 ounce) can chickpeas', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '⅓ cup pitted green olives, chopped', '¼ cup golden raisins', '¼ cup chopped dried apricots', '1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste', '1 pinch ground cumin, or to taste', '1 pinch ground coriander, or to taste', '1 pinch ground cinnamon, or to taste', '3 cups vegetable broth, or more as needed', '½ medium lemon, zested and juiced', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Break seitan apart into pieces.
', 'Step 2: Rub pieces in vegan margarine and then in ras el hanout.
', 'Step 3: Heat olive oil in a Dutch oven over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 4: Add the seasoned seitan and saute until browned and crusty bits form on the bottom of the pan, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add onion and saute over medium heat until softened, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Add garlic and cook and stir for 1 to 2 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Stir in sweet potato, chickpeas, tomatoes, olives, raisins, apricots, cayenne, cumin, coriander, and cinnamon.
', 'Step 8: Pour in enough vegetable broth to cover the mixture; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 9: Reduce heat and simmer until sweet potatoes are soft, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Stir in lemon zest and juice.
', 'Step 11: Top with parsley and serve.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '319.5 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '48.4 g', 'fatContent': '7.6 g', 'fiberContent': '7.8 g', 'proteinContent': '16.6 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '1.6 g', 'sodiumContent': '876.9 mg', 'sugarContent': '14.1 g'}

Title: Vegan Moroccan Couscous with Raisins and Vegetables
Ingredients: ['3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', '2 large onions, chopped', '4 cloves garlic, chopped, divided', '4 teaspoons ground cumin', '1 teaspoon chile powder', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '½ teaspoon ground turmeric', '½ teaspoon ground cloves', '½ teaspoon ground coriander', '½ teaspoon ground ginger', '6 cups vegetable stock', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '½ pound pumpkin, cut into chunks', '1 small sweet potato, cut into chunks', '2 stalks celery, sliced', '1 carrot, cut into chunks', '1 turnip, cut into chunks', '3 ½ ounces fresh green beans, cut into 1/2 inch pieces', 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste', '1 zucchini, cut into chunks', '1 (14 ounce) can garbanzo beans, drained', '10 ½ ounces couscous', '1 cup raisins', '1 cup boiling water', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '1 tablespoon lemon juice', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '2 teaspoons hot chile sauce', '1 tablespoon orange flower water, or more to taste', '1 pinch ground cinnamon']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat olive oil in a large stockpot over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Add onions and 1/2 of the garlic and cook until slightly softened, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Stir in cumin, chile powder, cinnamon, turmeric, cloves, coriander, and ginger and cook for a few seconds.
', 'Step 4: Add vegetable stock, tomatoes with their juice, pumpkin, sweet potato, celery, carrot, turnip, and green beans.
', 'Step 5: Season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 6: Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer until vegetables are just tender, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Stir in remaining garlic, zucchini, and garbanzo beans.
', 'Step 8: Cook until vegetables are very tender, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Meanwhile, combine couscous and raisins in a large bowl and cover with boiling water.
', 'Step 10: Mix well to moisten the couscous.
', 'Step 11: Set aside to soak for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Ladle 2 cups of cooking liquid from the vegetable stew over the couscous mixture.
', 'Step 13: Cover and set aside to soak for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Cover stew to keep warm.
', 'Step 15: Ladle 1 1/4 cups hot cooking liquid from the vegetables into a bowl.
', 'Step 16: Stir in cilantro, lemon juice, and cumin.
', 'Step 17: Add chile sauce.
', 'Step 18: Reheat stew if necessary.
', 'Step 19: Fluff up couscous with a fork and mound on a platter or large bowl.
', 'Step 20: Sprinkle with orange flower water and cinnamon.
', 'Step 21: Ladle some of the vegetable stew over the couscous and serve the rest separately.
', 'Step 22: Serve with the chile sauce mixture on the side.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '394.8 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '75 g', 'fatContent': '6.9 g', 'fiberContent': '8.8 g', 'proteinContent': '10.9 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '0.9 g', 'sodiumContent': '590.7 mg', 'sugarContent': '19.7 g'}

Title: El Mestouk
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 tablespoon minced onion', '2 teaspoons ground cinnamon', 'salt and pepper to taste', '½ cup golden raisins', '¼ cup dried apricots, cut in half', '2 teaspoons lemon zest', '2 tablespoons lemon juice', '4 cups water', '2 apples - peeled, cored and sliced', '½ roasted, shredded rotisserie chicken']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat the vegetable oil in a large saucepan over medium-low heat.
', 'Step 2: Cook the onion in the oil until it has softened and turned translucent, about 4 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Stir in the raisins, apricots, lemon zest, lemon juice, and water.
', 'Step 4: Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add the apples, and cook about 5 minutes longer until the apples soften.
', 'Step 6: Season with additional cinnamon, salt, and pepper if desired.
', 'Step 7: Stir in the shredded chicken before serving.
']

Title: South African Murg Poeding ("Marrow" Pudding)
Ingredients: ['1 egg', '½ cup white sugar', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '2 tablespoons white vinegar', '1 ½ tablespoons apricot jam', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '1 teaspoon baking soda', '1 pinch salt', '1 cup milk', '½ cup white sugar', '½ cup boiling water', '1 cup evaporated milk', '3 tablespoons butter, melted', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease an 8-inch baking pan.
', 'Step 3: Beat egg and 1/2 cup sugar together in a bowl.
', 'Step 4: Mix in flour, vinegar, apricot jam, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
', 'Step 5: Add milk gradually, mixing well.
', 'Step 6: Pour into the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 7: Bake in the preheated oven until set, about 45 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Dissolve 1/2 cup sugar in boiling water.
', 'Step 9: Add evaporated milk, melted butter, and vanilla extract.
', 'Step 10: Mix well; pour over baked pudding.
', 'Step 11: Wait until sauce is absorbed before serving, about 5 minutes.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '268.1 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '44.2 g', 'cholesterolContent': '43.5 mg', 'fatContent': '8 g', 'fiberContent': '0.4 g', 'proteinContent': '5.5 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '4.8 g', 'sodiumContent': '324.2 mg', 'sugarContent': '31.4 g'}

Title: Moroccan Squash, Chickpea, and Spinach Stew
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 medium onion, chopped', '1 (3/4 inch thick) slice fresh ginger, peeled and grated', '2 teaspoons ground sweet paprika', '2 teaspoons ground cinnamon', '1 teaspoon ground turmeric', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '¼ teaspoon red pepper flakes', '1 (1 1/2) pound butternut squash - peeled, seeded, and cut into 1/2-inch cubes', '1 (15 ounce) can chickpeas, drained and rinsed', '1 (14.5 ounce) can chopped tomatoes', '2 cups vegetable stock', '¾ cup sultana raisins', '3 teaspoons honey', '1 (8 ounce) package fresh spinach', '½ cup flaked almonds', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat; stir in onion.
', 'Step 2: Cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Add ginger, paprika, cinnamon, turmeric, pepper, and red pepper flakes.
', "Step 4: Cook, stirring well to ensure the spices don't stick and burn, for 2 minutes.
", 'Step 5: Add butternut squash, chickpeas, tomatoes, vegetable stock, raisins, and honey.
', 'Step 6: Simmer until squash starts to break down, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 7: While the soup is cooking, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 8: Spread flaked almonds onto a baking sheet.
', 'Step 9: Toast nuts in the preheated oven, shaking the pan frequently, until they start to turn golden brown and become fragrant, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Stir spinach and cilantro into the soup; cook until spinach is wilted, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Ladle into bowls and garnish with toasted almonds.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '338.6 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '54.9 g', 'fatContent': '12.1 g', 'fiberContent': '10.8 g', 'proteinContent': '10.1 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '1.2 g', 'sodiumContent': '553.7 mg', 'sugarContent': '27.4 g'}

Title: Spicy Beef Stew with Moroccan Spice Rub
Ingredients: ['1 pound beef stew meat, cut into 2-inch pieces', '1 tablespoon ras el hanout, or more to taste', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 leek, halved lengthwise and thinly sliced crosswise', '1 small onion, cut in half and thinly sliced', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 tomato, diced', '1 cup diced pumpkin', '2 tablespoons tomato paste, or more to taste', '1 cup rose wine', '2 cups beef stock', '2 sprigs fresh rosemary', '1 sprig fresh mint', '1 bay leaf', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 parsnip, halved lengthwise and thickly sliced', '1 carrot, halved lengthwise and thickly sliced', '2 teaspoons lemon juice, or to taste', '2 teaspoons white sugar, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place beef in a large bowl.
', 'Step 2: Add ras el hanout and rub until beef is completely coated.
', 'Step 3: Let sit for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Heat oil in a stew pot over high heat until shimmering.
', "Step 5: Add meat, making sure it's not overcrowded, and sear to seal in the juices, stirring occasionally, until browned on all sides, about 5 minutes.
", 'Step 6: Transfer meat to a plate.
', 'Step 7: Reduce heat to medium and add leek and onion to the pot.
', 'Step 8: Saute until leeks turn golden and translucent, 3 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 10: Add tomatoes and saute until they begin to soften, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Add cooked meat back to the pot, along with diced pumpkin and tomato paste.
', 'Step 12: Cook and stir for 2 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Pour wine into the pot and bring to a boil while scraping the browned bits off the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon.
', 'Step 14: Cook until wine reduces by half, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Add beef stock, rosemary, mint, bay leaf, salt, and pepper and return to a boil.
', 'Step 16: Reduce heat, cover, and simmer for 40 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Add parsnip and carrot, cover, and simmer until beef is tender, about 40 minutes longer.
', 'Step 18: Taste sauce and add lemon juice and sugar, if needed.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '430 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '24 g', 'cholesterolContent': '62.5 mg', 'fatContent': '23.2 g', 'fiberContent': '4.7 g', 'proteinContent': '23 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '7.3 g', 'sodiumContent': '218.1 mg', 'sugarContent': '10.1 g'}

Title: Moroccan Beef and Lentil Soup
Ingredients: ['½ cup dry chickpeas (garbanzo beans)', '¼ cup vegetable oil', '8 ounces celery with leaves, chopped', '1 ½ onions, diced', '3 tomatoes, peeled and coarsely chopped', '8 ½ cups water, divided', '1 pound beef chuck, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', '1 (1 pound) beef marrow bone', '½ cup uncooked green lentils', '¼ cup all-purpose flour', '1 cup chopped fresh parsley', '1 cup chopped fresh cilantro', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice', '4 ounces vermicelli, broken into 1/2-inch pieces']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place chickpeas into a large container and cover with several inches of cool water; let soak, 8 hours to overnight.
', 'Step 2: Drain.
', 'Step 3: Heat vegetable oil in a large pot over medium-high heat; stir in celery and onions.
', 'Step 4: Saute until vegetables have softened and turned translucent, 6 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add tomatoes and simmer for another 6 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Add 8 cups water, beef, drained chickpeas, lentils, and marrow bone; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 7: Reduce heat to low, cover, and cook for 2 1/2 hours.
', 'Step 8: Combine remaining 1/2 cup water and flour in a small bowl; whisk until paste-like.
', 'Step 9: Pour into the soup with parsley and cilantro.
', 'Step 10: Season with salt and pepper and cook for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Add lemon juice and cook for an additional 20 minutes, adding vermicelli during the last 5 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Remove marrow bone and serve.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '475.6 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '33 g', 'cholesterolContent': '144.2 mg', 'fatContent': '28.1 g', 'fiberContent': '6.2 g', 'proteinContent': '23.5 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '10.5 g', 'sodiumContent': '112.6 mg', 'sugarContent': '4.7 g'}

Title: Ejja
Ingredients: ['4 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 ½ teaspoons caraway seeds', '1 pinch salt', '¼ cup vegetable oil', '2 large tomatoes, seeded and chopped', '1 large green bell pepper, seeded and chopped', '1 green chile pepper, seeded and chopped', '1 tablespoon tomato sauce', '1 tablespoon harissa (red pepper paste)', '1 ½ teaspoons ground red chile pepper', '1 cup water', '4 eggs', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place garlic, caraway seeds, and salt in a mortar; mash into a paste with a pestle.
', 'Step 2: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Add tomatoes, green bell pepper, green chile pepper, tomato sauce, and harissa.
', 'Step 4: Stir in garlic paste and red chile pepper.
', 'Step 5: Pour in water; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 6: Reduce heat, cover, and cook until tomatoes are soft, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Uncover skillet and crack eggs into the tomato mixture.
', 'Step 8: Cook and stir until eggs are set, 4 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Spoon onto a serving platter; season with salt and pepper.
']

Title: Tunisian Grilled Salad (Selata Mishwiya)
Ingredients: ['¼ cup olive oil', '2 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 ½ teaspoons harissa (North African red pepper paste)', '1 ½ teaspoons ras el hanout (North African spice mix)', '1 ½ teaspoons ground red chile pepper', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '3 large tomatoes', '2 green bell peppers', '1 large onion', '2 green chile peppers', '1 (5 ounce) can tuna packed in olive oil', '2 hard-boiled eggs, halved', '½ cup whole black olives', '1 small lemon, cut into wedges']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine olive oil, garlic, harissa, ras el hanout, ground chile pepper, salt, and pepper in a mortar; mash into a paste with a pestle.
', "Step 2: Set oven rack about 6 inches from the heat source and preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 3: Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 4: Place tomatoes, green bell peppers, onion, and green chile peppers on the baking sheet.
', 'Step 5: Cook under the preheated broiler, turning occasionally, until skins have blackened and insides are soft, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Cool until easily handled, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Peel, seed, and chop into small pieces.
', 'Step 8: Place tomato mixture in a large bowl.
', 'Step 9: Stir in garlic paste mixture slowly with a wooden spoon.
', 'Step 10: Spoon onto a serving platter.
', 'Step 11: Garnish with tuna, eggs, and olives.
', 'Step 12: Squeeze 1 lemon wedge over platter.
', 'Step 13: Arrange remaining wedges on the sides.
']

Title: Christina's Harira
Ingredients: ['1 cup dry garbanzo beans', '½ cup dry yellow lentils', '1 chicken bouillon cube', '1 cup hot water', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 large onion, chopped', '1 pinch saffron threads', '1 teaspoon ground ginger', '½ pound cubed beef stew meat, or more to taste', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '7 cups water', '3 stalks celery, chopped', '3 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley', '3 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '5 tomatoes, peeled and chopped', '½ cup uncooked orzo pasta', '¾ cup all-purpose flour', '½ (6 ounce) can tomato paste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the dry garbanzo beans into a large bowl, and fill with water.
', 'Step 2: In a separate bowl, cover the yellow lentils with water; allow the beans and lentils to soak overnight.
', 'Step 3: The next day, drain the water.
', 'Step 4: With your thumb and forefinger, pick up and pinch off the husk from each garbanzo bean; discard husks.
', 'Step 5: Place chicken bouillon cube into a small bowl, and dissolve in 1 cup of hot water.
', 'Step 6: Heat olive oil in a large soup pot over medium heat, and cook the onion in the oil until translucent, about 5 minutes; stir in the saffron and ginger until combined.
', 'Step 7: Add the beef to the skillet, and cook until browned, about 15 minutes, stirring the meat and sprinkling it with salt and black pepper as it cooks.
', 'Step 8: Mix in the chicken bouillon and prepared garbanzo beans, and bring the mixture to a boil.
', 'Step 9: Pour in 7 more cups of water, and mix in the celery, parsley, and cilantro; simmer until the celery is tender, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Mix in the soaked lentils, and cook an additional 20 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Mix in the tomatoes, cover the pot, and cook until tomatoes are tender, about 20 more minutes.
', 'Step 12: Stir in the orzo, and simmer until tender, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 13: In a bowl, whisk the flour and tomato paste together; if mixture is too stiff, add about 1/2 cup of water, a tablespoon at a time, or as desired.
', 'Step 14: Stir the tomato paste mixture into the soup, and bring to a boil, stirring often.
', 'Step 15: Cook until thickened and the flavors have blended, about 15 more minutes.
']

Title: Spicy Fish Kebobs
Ingredients: ['¼ cup olive oil', '1 lemon, juiced', '6 cloves garlic', '2 tablespoons harissa (red pepper paste)', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', 'salt to taste', '1 ⅓ pounds 1-inch-thick tuna, skin removed and flesh cut into 30 cubes', '1 red bell pepper - seeds and ribs removed and pepper cut into 15 squares', '1 yellow bell pepper - seeds and ribs removed and pepper cut into 15 squares', '1 large red onion, cut into wedges and layers separated', '6 skewers']

['Step 1: Blend olive oil, lemon juice, garlic, harissa, cumin, black pepper, and salt together in a blender or food processor until marinade is smooth.
', 'Step 2: Place tuna in a bowl and pour marinade over tuna; toss to coat.
', 'Step 3: Marinate in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour.
', 'Step 4: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 5: Thread 1 piece tuna, 1 piece red bell pepper, 1 piece yellow bell pepper, and 1 piece onion onto 1 skewer; repeat 4 times.
', 'Step 6: Repeat with remaining ingredients using the remaining 5 skewers.
', 'Step 7: Cook skewers on grill until fish flakes easily with a fork, about 10 minutes.
']

Title: Chickpeas with Yassa Sauce
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon vegetable oil, or as needed', '4 medium onions, finely chopped', '1 habanero chile, seeded and minced', '6 cloves garlic, chopped', '½ head cabbage, chopped', '1 (29 ounce) can chickpeas, rinsed and drained', '¼ pound carrots, chopped', '1 cup pitted green olives', '¼ cup red wine vinegar', '3 medium lemons, juiced', '2 tablespoons Dijon mustard', '1 teaspoon all-purpose vegetable seasoning', '¾ teaspoon ground black pepper', '2 large bay leaves']

', 'Step 2: Saute onions, habanero, and garlic in the hot oil until soft, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Add cabbage and cook until softened.
', 'Step 4: Stir in chickpeas, carrots, olives, vinegar, lemon juice, Dijon, vegetable seasoning, pepper, and bay leaves.
', 'Step 5: Reduce heat and let simmer until flavors have melded, 1 hour or more.
']

Title: African Stew
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon vegetable oil, or as needed', '4 cups vegetable stock, divided', '1 onion, finely chopped', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '2 cups peeled and diced sweet potatoes', '1 cup chickpeas, drained', '1 cup uncooked brown rice', '¼ teaspoon salt', '¼ cup peanut butter', '2 cups chopped kale, stems removed', '2 tablespoons lemon juice', '1 tablespoon soy sauce', '1 teaspoon hot pepper sauce, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Add 2 tablespoons vegetable stock, onion, and garlic.
', 'Step 3: Cook and stir until onion is soft, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Add remaining stock, sweet potatoes, chickpeas, brown rice, and salt.
', 'Step 5: Bring to a boil.
', 'Step 6: Reduce heat and cover the stew.
', 'Step 7: Simmer until sweet potatoes and rice are tender, about 45 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Combine peanut butter with 1/2 cup of the liquid from the stew.
', 'Step 9: Stir into a smooth paste.
', 'Step 10: Add the peanut butter mixture and kale to the stew.
', 'Step 11: Cook until kale is wilted, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Stir in lemon juice, soy sauce, and hot pepper sauce.
']

Title: Moroccan Lamb, Lentil, and Chickpea Soup
Ingredients: ['1 pound ground lamb', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon kosher salt', '½ teaspoon ground ginger', '¼ teaspoon ground cloves', '¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg', '¼ teaspoon ground turmeric', '⅛ teaspoon curry powder', '1 tablespoon butter', '1 sweet onion, chopped', '2 (10.5 ounce) cans beef consomme', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes with juice', '1 (14 ounce) can organic beef broth', '1 (14 ounce) can organic chicken broth', '1 tablespoon honey', '3 large carrots, halved lengthwise and thinly sliced', '2 sweet potatoes, peeled and diced', '1 (15 ounce) can garbanzo beans, rinsed and drained', '1 cup lentils, rinsed and drained', '½ cup chopped dried apricots', '⅛ teaspoon cayenne pepper, or to taste', '1 pinch ground black pepper to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix ground lamb, cinnamon, cumin, salt, ginger, cloves, nutmeg, turmeric, and curry powder together in a bowl.
', 'Step 2: Cover and put in the refrigerator for 2 hours to overnight.
', 'Step 3: Melt butter in a soup pot over medium-high heat; stir in onion.
', 'Step 4: Cook, stirring frequently, until the onion has softened and turned translucent, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Reduce heat to medium and add spiced lamb mixture.
', 'Step 6: Cook and stir until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Add consomme, diced tomatoes, beef broth, chicken broth, and honey.
', 'Step 8: Stir in carrots, sweet potatoes, garbanzo beans, lentils, apricots, cayenne pepper, and black pepper.
', 'Step 9: Bring soup just to a boil over medium-high heat, then reduce heat to low, and simmer until lentils and vegetables are tender, 15 to 20 minutes.
']

Title: Saharan West African Peanut and Pineapple Soup
Ingredients: ['1 cup dried pineapple pieces', '1 tablespoon canola oil', '½ sweet onion, chopped', '1 stalk celery, chopped', '1 leek, chopped', '1 teaspoon curry powder', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '¼ teaspoon salt', '¾ cup peanut butter', '1 (14 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '3 cups water', '¼ cup heavy whipping cream', '¼ cup minced green onion', '1 teaspoon minced garlic']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Soak dried pineapple in a bowl of water until softened, at least 30 minutes; drain.
', 'Step 2: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Cook and stir sweet onion, celery, and leek in hot oil until tender, about 4 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Sprinkle curry powder, cumin, cayenne pepper, and salt over the vegetables; stir to coat.
', 'Step 5: Cook and stir until strongly fragrant, about 4 minutes more.
', 'Step 6: Add peanut butter to the pot.
', 'Step 7: Drain about half the juice from the tomatoes and discard; pour remaining tomatoes and juice into the pot.
', 'Step 8: Cook until the tomatoes soften, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Pour 3 cups water into the pot; add drained pineapple.
', 'Step 10: Bring the mixture to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer soup for 1 hour.
', 'Step 11: Stir cream, green onion, and garlic into the soup.
']

Title: South African Pumpkin Soup with Banana and Curry
Ingredients: ['1 ½ pounds pumpkin, peeled and cubed', '4 tablespoons olive oil, divided', '2 tablespoons brown sugar', '2 tablespoons honey', '1 ripe banana', '1 small onion, finely chopped', '1 carrot, chopped', '1 stalk celery, chopped', '1 clove garlic, finely chopped', '1 teaspoon medium curry powder', '½ teaspoon ground coriander', '¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg', '¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 cup coconut milk', '1 cup chicken stock', 'salt to taste', 'freshly ground black pepper', '1 lime, juiced, or as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Combine pumpkin, 2 tablespoons olive oil, sugar, and honey in a bowl.
', 'Step 3: Pour into a baking dish.
', 'Step 4: Place unpeeled banana in a second smaller baking dish.
', 'Step 5: Bake both pumpkin and banana in the preheated oven until pumpkin has softened and is lightly brown, 20 to 30 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Meanwhile, heat remaining olive oil in a large pot over medium-low heat and cook onion, carrot, and celery until soft, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Add garlic, curry powder, coriander, nutmeg, and cinnamon; mix to combine.
', 'Step 8: Cook for another 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Peel banana.
', 'Step 10: Add banana flesh, pumpkin, coconut milk, and chicken stock to the pot and simmer 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Puree soup using a stick blender until smooth.
', 'Step 12: If desired, thin soup with more stock or hot water.
', 'Step 13: Season with salt, pepper, and lime juice.
']

Title: Vegan Moroccan Stew
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon cumin seeds', '1 tablespoon coriander seeds', '3 tablespoons olive oil', '1 cup chopped onion', '3 cloves garlic, thinly sliced', '3 tablespoons matchstick-sliced ginger', '1 lemon, zested and juiced, divided', '2 teaspoons salt', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon ground turmeric', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '½ teaspoon ground allspice', '2 cups vegetable broth', '1 (28 ounce) can whole peeled tomatoes, lightly crushed by hand', '2 cups cubed peeled carrots', '1 large butternut squash, peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes', '1 large sweet potato, peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Toast cumin and coriander seeds in a dry frying pan over medium heat until fragrant, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 2: Transfer to a mortar and crush with a pestle to break some seeds but leave many whole.
', 'Step 3: Set aside.
', 'Step 4: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 5: Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Add garlic, ginger, and lemon zest; cook and stir for 1 minute.
', 'Step 7: Add salt, pepper, turmeric, cinnamon, allspice, and toasted spice mixture.
', 'Step 8: Stir until evenly coated, being careful not to burn spices, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 9: Pour broth into the pot and bring to a simmer, about 5 minutes, scraping the bottom of the pot.
', 'Step 10: Add tomatoes and lemon juice.
', 'Step 11: Add carrots, butternut squash, and sweet potato.
', 'Step 12: Mix to combine and reduce heat to medium-low.
', 'Step 13: Cover and simmer until vegetables are tender, about 45 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Taste stew and season with more salt, if desired.
']

Title: Moroccan-Spiced Rack of Lamb
Ingredients: ['¼ cup chopped fresh mint', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley', '1 ½ teaspoons ground ginger', '½ teaspoon ground allspice', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon ground paprika', '½ teaspoon ground coriander', '½ teaspoon salt', '1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste', '1 pinch ground cloves, or to taste', '1 (8 bone) rack Lamb, domestic, rib, separable lean and fat, trimmed to 1/8" fat, choice, raw']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine mint, olive oil, parsley, ginger, allspice, cinnamon, pepper, paprika, coriander, salt, cayenne, and cloves in a small bowl until paste-like.
', 'Step 2: Place rack into a large glass or ceramic dish; rub herb paste all over the meat.
', 'Step 3: Cover with plastic wrap and marinate in the refrigerator for 30 to 60 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
', 'Step 5: Remove rack from the refrigerator and place in a heavy, oven-proof skillet with the meat side facing up.
', 'Step 6: Roast in the preheated oven until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center reads 125 degrees F (51 degrees C) for rare or 130 degrees F (54 degrees C) for medium-rare, 20 to 25 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove from the oven and cover loosely with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 8: Let stand for 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 9: To serve, carve by cutting down between the ribs.
']

Title: Peppermint Liqueur

', 'Step 2: Bring to a boil and stir to dissolve the sugar, making a thick syrup.

Title: Spicy West African Sweet Potato Soup
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 medium onion, chopped', '4 cloves garlic, minced', '1 (1/2 inch) piece fresh ginger, minced', '½ teaspoon ground cumin, or more to taste', '½ teaspoon ground turmeric', '¼ teaspoon smoked paprika', '¼ teaspoon red pepper flakes', '5 medium sweet potatoes, peeled and diced', '1 (14.5 ounce) can petite diced tomatoes', '1 medium jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', '2 cups vegetable broth, or as needed', '1 (14 ounce) can coconut milk', '½ cup peanut butter, or more to taste', '1 (10 ounce) package fresh spinach', '1 teaspoon lime juice, or more to taste']

Title: Doro Wat (Ethiopian Chicken Stew)
Ingredients: ['3 skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cut into 1 1/2-inch pieces', '1 cup lemon juice', '4 eggs', '1 stick butter', '1 medium yellow onion, chopped', '1 tablespoon diced fresh ginger', '2 teaspoons diced garlic', '2 cups water', '1 cup basmati rice', '8 teaspoons paprika', '8 teaspoons berbere spice blend, or to taste', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced fire-roasted tomatoes, or more to taste', '2 cups chicken broth, or more as needed', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine chicken and lemon juice in a bowl and marinate until flavors meld, at least 15 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Place eggs in a saucepan and cover with water.
', 'Step 3: Bring to a boil, remove from heat, and let eggs stand in hot water for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Remove eggs from hot water, cool under cold running water, and peel.
', 'Step 5: Melt butter over medium heat in a pot.
', 'Step 6: Add onion, ginger, and garlic to the hot butter and cook until onion is soft, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Bring water and rice to a boil in a saucepan.
', 'Step 8: Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer until rice is tender and water has been absorbed, 25 to 30 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Keep warm.
', 'Step 10: While rice cooks, stir paprika and berbere seasoning into the onion mixture, adjusting to taste.
', 'Step 11: Add chicken to the pot and brown, 5 to 7 minutes per side.
', 'Step 12: Pour in tomatoes and stir to combine.
', 'Step 13: Pour in enough chicken broth to thin mixture out to stew consistency.
', 'Step 14: Reduce heat and let simmer until chicken is no longer pink in the center, 20 to 30 minutes, adding hard-boiled eggs when stew has about 10 minutes of cooking time left.
', 'Step 15: Pierce eggs using a fork to allow sauce to seep in.
', 'Step 16: Continue to simmer 10 minutes more.
', 'Step 17: Season with salt and pepper and serve over cooked basmati rice.
']

Title: Mushroom and Chickpea Tagine
Ingredients: ['2 teaspoons cumin seeds', '2 teaspoons coriander seeds', '1 teaspoon sesame seeds', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 red onion, chopped', '1 clove garlic, crushed', '3 ½ cups quartered chestnut mushrooms', '1 (14 ounce) can chopped tomatoes', '1 (14 ounce) can chickpeas, drained', '1 (10.5 ounce) can vegetable stock', '⅓ cup halved dried apricots', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley', '1 tablespoon honey', '1 tablespoon tomato puree', '1 tablespoon lemon juice', '1 cinnamon stick', '2 dried bay leaves', '1 pinch white sugar, or to taste', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '¾ cup plain yogurt']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Toast cumin seeds, coriander seeds, and sesame seeds in a dry skillet over medium heat until fragrant, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Transfer dukka mixture to a spice grinder; grind into a smooth powder.
', 'Step 3: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 4: Add onion and garlic; cover and cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add 1 teaspoon dukka and mushrooms; cover and cook for 3 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Uncover and cook, stirring frequently, until mushrooms release most of their moisture, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Stir chopped tomatoes, chickpeas, vegetable stock, apricots, parsley, honey, tomato puree, lemon juice, cinnamon stick, bay leaves, sugar, salt, and pepper into the pot.
', 'Step 8: Cover and simmer until flavors combine, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Add 1 teaspoon dukka.
', 'Step 10: Cook, stirring frequently, until tagine thickens, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Discard cinnamon stick and bay leaves.
', 'Step 12: Mix 1 tablespoon dukka into the yogurt; serve alongside tagine.
']

Title: North African Beef Stew

Title: Turkey Tagine bin Youssef

Title: Chicken Tagine with Dried Cranberries
Ingredients: ['4 tablespoons lemon juice', '½ cup extra-virgin olive oil, divided, or as needed', '1 ¼ teaspoons salt', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 teaspoon ground ginger', '½ teaspoon black pepper', '1 (3 1/2) pound whole chicken, cut into pieces', '1 cup thinly sliced carrots', '1 large onion, halved lengthwise, then cut crosswise into 1/4-inch-thick slices', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '4 medium red potatoes, cut into thin slices', '2 medium tomatoes, peeled and chopped', '1 medium yellow bell pepper, cut into chunks', '½ cup dried cranberries', '¼ cup chopped fresh parsley', '1 tablespoon chicken bouillon granules', '¼ cup dry white wine']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix lemon juice, 2 tablespoons olive oil, salt, cinnamon, ginger, and pepper together in a large glass or ceramic bowl.
', 'Step 2: Add chicken pieces and toss to coat.
', 'Step 3: Cover and let sit in a refrigerator for 2 hours, up to overnight.
', 'Step 4: When ready to start, line a tagine with sliced carrots.
', 'Step 5: Heat another 2 tablespoons olive oil in a heavy skillet over medium heat until hot, but not smoking.
', 'Step 6: Brown 1/2 of the chicken pieces, skin-side down, turning over once, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 7: You are just browning it, not cooking it through.
', 'Step 8: Take out of the skillet and place on top of the carrots, then brown the remaining pieces of chicken.
', 'Step 9: Once those are browned, but not cooked through, arrange on top of the carrots also.
', 'Step 10: The idea is that the chicken does not touch the bottom of the tagine, only the carrots.
', 'Step 11: Add onion to the same skillet and saute over medium-high heat until soft, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Reduce heat to medium.
', 'Step 13: Add garlic; saute for 30 seconds.
', 'Step 14: Stir in potatoes and saute, 1 to 2 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Add tomatoes, bell pepper, cranberries, and parsley; stir well and keep sauteing over medium heat until hot and bubbly.
', 'Step 16: Sprinkle the chicken bouillon granules over the mixture while it cooks.
', 'Step 17: Pour the mixture over the chicken and carrots.
', 'Step 18: Place the tagine over low heat, making sure any open flames do not touch the bottom of the pot.
', 'Step 19: Drizzle remaining olive oil over top.
', 'Step 20: Pour wine over top and cover.
', 'Step 21: Cook over low heat until potatoes are soft and chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 22: Turn off the heat and let sit for 10 minutes before serving.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '630.5 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '40.6 g', 'cholesterolContent': '132.6 mg', 'fatContent': '30.3 g', 'fiberContent': '5.1 g', 'proteinContent': '47.2 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '5.8 g', 'sodiumContent': '829.6 mg', 'sugarContent': '12.2 g'}

Title: Tunisian-Style Catfish Nuggets
Ingredients: ['vegetable oil for frying', '1 pound catfish, cut into bite-sized pieces', '1 egg', '1 tablespoon water', '2 cups dry bread crumbs', '¼ cup olive oil', '1 onion, halved and sliced', '½ green bell pepper, cut into 1/4 inch strips', '½ teaspoon anise seed', '3 tablespoons tomato paste', '2 roma (plum) tomatoes, chopped', '1 lemon wedge', '1 clove garlic, crushed', '1 cup water', 'salt and pepper to taste', '1 pinch cayenne pepper', '1 teaspoon brown sugar', '½ cup olives', '1 cup water']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Beat the egg into a shallow bowl with a tablespoon of water.
', 'Step 3: Place the bread crumbs in a shallow bowl.
', 'Step 4: Dip the fish pieces into the beaten egg and then into the crumbs until well coated.
', 'Step 5: Fry the catfish nuggets in batches, about 1 minute on each side.
', 'Step 6: Drain on paper towels and set aside.
', 'Step 7: Heat the olive oil in a skillet or Dutch oven over medium heat.
', 'Step 8: Stir in the onion and bell pepper strips; cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Coarsely crush the anise seed.
', 'Step 10: Add the anise seed, tomato paste, and chopped tomatoes to the skillet and cook, stirring frequently, until the tomato paste has darkened and the tomatoes have softened, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Chop the lemon wedge, peel and all, into five pieces.
', 'Step 12: Stir the lemon wedge and crushed garlic into the tomato mixture and cook for 1 minute more.
', 'Step 13: Mix in 1 cup water, salt and pepper, cayenne pepper, brown sugar, and olives.
', 'Step 14: Bring the sauce to a boil and simmer for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Stir in more water if the sauce gets too thick.
', 'Step 16: Gently stir in the catfish nuggets, and simmer for an additional 10 minutes.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '1162.4 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '83.7 g', 'cholesterolContent': '157 mg', 'fatContent': '76.9 g', 'fiberContent': '7.6 g', 'proteinContent': '36.1 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '12.7 g', 'sodiumContent': '1147.9 mg', 'sugarContent': '13.6 g'}

Title: Moroccan Lamb Tagine (Mrouzia)
Ingredients: ['½ cup water', '1 tablespoon paprika', '1 ½ teaspoons ras el hanout', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 teaspoon ground coriander', '½ teaspoon ground cloves', '½ teaspoon ground nutmeg', '½ teaspoon ground cardamom', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper, or more to taste', '¼ teaspoon ground turmeric', 'salt to taste', '¼ teaspoon red pepper flakes', '3 pounds lamb shoulder, trimmed and cut into cubes', '½ cup butter', '2 medium onions, finely chopped', '1 shallot, finely chopped', '2 cloves garlic, finely chopped', '2 cinnamon sticks', '3 cups chicken stock, or more as needed', '2 cups whole blanched almonds', '1 cup diced carrots', '1 cup chopped dried apricots', '½ cup raisins', '½ cup pitted, chopped prunes', '⅓ cup honey', '1 tablespoon lemon juice, or more to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix water, paprika, ras el hanout, black pepper, cinnamon, coriander, cloves, nutmeg, cardamom, cayenne pepper, turmeric, and salt in a small bowl.
', 'Step 2: Add red pepper flakes to the spice paste if you want more of a kick to your dish.
', 'Step 3: Place lamb cubes in a large bowl and rub in the spice paste.
', 'Step 4: Cover and refrigerate 8 hours to overnight.
', 'Step 5: Melt butter in a Dutch oven.
', 'Step 6: Add onions, shallot, garlic, and cinnamon sticks; saute for 6 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Add lamb with the spice paste.
', 'Step 8: Cover with chicken stock and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 9: Reduce heat to low and simmer until tender, 1 to 1 1/2 hours.
', 'Step 10: Add more stock if lamb looks dry.
', 'Step 11: Add almonds, carrots, apricots, raisins, prunes, and honey to the Dutch oven.
', 'Step 12: Simmer until lamb is completely tender, carrots are cooked, and almonds are slightly softened, 15 to 30 minutes more.
', 'Step 13: Add lemon juice.
', 'Step 14: Season with salt.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '493.6 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '34.7 g', 'cholesterolContent': '78.5 mg', 'fatContent': '32.2 g', 'fiberContent': '5.7 g', 'proteinContent': '21.6 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '10.7 g', 'sodiumContent': '294.6 mg', 'sugarContent': '23.5 g'}

Title: Susie's Mocca Cheesecake
Ingredients: ['1 ¼ cups gingersnap cookie crumbs', '3 tablespoons butter, melted', '1 tablespoon unflavored gelatin powder', '¼ cup cold water', '1 cup heavy cream', '1 (16 ounce) package creamed cottage cheese', '2 extra large eggs, yolks and whites separated', '¼ cup brown sugar', '6 tablespoons cold strong brewed coffee', '¼ cup brown sugar', '3 ½ ounces high quality milk chocolate', '3 tablespoons milk', '2 teaspoons butter', '1 tablespoon heavy cream']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Grease the bottom and sides of a 9-inch springform pan with cooking spray or butter.
', 'Step 2: Mix 3 tablespoons of melted butter and the cookie crumbs in a bowl; press the mixture into the bottom of the pan.
', 'Step 3: Refrigerate until needed.
', 'Step 4: Sprinkle the gelatin on top of the cold water in a heat-proof bowl and set aside for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: When all of the water is absorbed and the grains have swelled, gently heat the bowl over a pot of simmering water just until the gelatin melts.
', 'Step 6: Beat 1 cup of cream, cottage cheese, and egg yolks together in a large mixing bowl.
', "Step 7: (See Editor's Notes if you prefer to pasteurize the egg yolks.
", 'Step 8: ) Beat in 1/4 cup of brown sugar.
', 'Step 9: Pour in the melted gelatin and the cooled coffee and mix well.
', 'Step 10: In a bowl, whisk the egg whites until soft peaks form, gradually beating in 1/4 cup of brown sugar (see Notes).
', 'Step 11: Use a rubber spatula or wire whisk to fold 1/3 of the egg white mixture into the cheese mixture.
', 'Step 12: Gently run the spatula through the center of the bowl, then around the sides of the bowl, repeating until fully incorporated.
', 'Step 13: Add the remaining egg white mixture, folding just until incorporated.
', 'Step 14: Transfer the filling to the cake pan, spreading it gently over the cookie crust to smooth the surface.
', 'Step 15: Chill until set, preferably overnight.
', 'Step 16: Combine the milk chocolate, milk, and 2 teaspoons of butter in a small saucepan.
', 'Step 17: Melt the chocolate over medium-low heat, stirring occasionally.
', 'Step 18: Remove from heat and allow the mixture to cool; it should be fluid but not set.
', 'Step 19: Pour the glaze over the cheesecake, spreading it to evenly coat the surface.
', 'Step 20: Drizzle 1 tablespoon of cream in droplets over the glaze; swirl a toothpick through the glaze and cream to get a marbled effect.
', 'Step 21: Chill until set, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 22: Carefully remove the outer ring of the springform pan and transfer the cheesecake onto a serving platter.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '440.3 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '37 g', 'cholesterolContent': '123.1 mg', 'fatContent': '27.9 g', 'fiberContent': '0.6 g', 'proteinContent': '11.4 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '15.6 g', 'sodiumContent': '382.3 mg', 'sugarContent': '26.9 g'}

Title: African Coffee Biscuits
Ingredients: ['1 ¼ cups butter, softened', '1 cup white sugar', '1 ½ teaspoons boiling water', '1 ½ teaspoons instant coffee powder', '½ cup smooth apricot jam', '¼ cup milk', '2 ½ teaspoons baking soda', '½ teaspoon vanilla extract', '4 cups cake flour', '½ teaspoon salt']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Grease 2 baking sheets.
', 'Step 3: Combine butter and sugar in a large bowl; beat with an electric mixer until light and fluffy.
', 'Step 4: Stir boiling water and coffee powder in a small bowl until coffee is dissolved.
', 'Step 5: Stir in apricot jam.
', 'Step 6: Mix into the creamed butter mixture.
', 'Step 7: Stir milk and baking soda in a small bowl until baking soda is dissolved.
', 'Step 8: Add vanilla extract.
', 'Step 9: Stir into the creamed butter mixture.
', 'Step 10: Combine cake flour and salt in a bowl; add to the creamed butter mixture.
', 'Step 11: Stir well until a dough forms.
', 'Step 12: Fill a cookie press with dough.
', 'Step 13: Pipe dough onto the baking sheets.
', 'Step 14: Repeat with remaining dough.
', 'Step 15: Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Transfer to wire racks to cool.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '88.5 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '12.6 g', 'cholesterolContent': '10.2 mg', 'fatContent': '3.9 g', 'fiberContent': '0.2 g', 'proteinContent': '0.9 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '2.5 g', 'sodiumContent': '100.7 mg', 'sugarContent': '4.6 g'}

Title: Doro Wat
Ingredients: ['1 (3 pound) whole chicken, including neck and giblets, cut into 1-inch pieces', '2 cups water', '¼ cup lemon juice', '3 cups chopped Bermuda onion', '3 tablespoons butter', '½ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '1 teaspoon paprika', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '¼ teaspoon ground ginger', '1 cup water, or as needed', '2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '2 tablespoons water', '8 hard-boiled eggs, peeled']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Soak the chicken in 2 cups water and lemon juice in a large bowl for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Drain.
', 'Step 3: Place the onion, with no fat, in a large Dutch oven or heavy pot over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 4: Cook and stir until very dark, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Stir in the butter, cayenne pepper, paprika, black pepper, and ginger, then stir in 1 more cup of water.
', 'Step 6: Add the drained chicken, stirring until well-blended.
', 'Step 7: Cover and reduce heat to low.
', 'Step 8: Simmer until the chicken is tender, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 9: If a thicker stew is desired, whisk flour with 2 tablespoons of water, and stir into the pot; allow to simmer until thickened, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Stir in eggs; cook and stir until heated through, about 10 minutes more.
']

Title: Tunisian Slow-Cooked Turkey Breast
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '1 teaspoon chipotle chili powder', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '½ teaspoon ground coriander', '½ teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 (4 pound) skinless, boneless turkey breast half', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 acorn squash, seeded and cut into quarters', '3 large carrots, peeled and cut into 3 pieces', '2 red onions, quartered', '6 unpeeled garlic cloves']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix flour, chipotle chili powder, garlic powder, cinnamon, coriander, salt, and black pepper in a large resealable plastic bag and shake to combine.
', 'Step 2: Place the turkey breast into the bag, seal, and shake to coat turkey with the spice mix.
', 'Step 3: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat and sear the seasoned turkey breast in the hot oil until browned on both sides, about 5 minutes per side (meat will still be pink inside).
', 'Step 4: Place acorn squash quarters, carrots, red onions, and garlic cloves into the bottom of a large slow cooker.
', 'Step 5: Place the browned turkey breast on top of the vegetables.
', 'Step 6: Cover cooker.
', 'Step 7: Cook turkey breast until meat and vegetables are very tender, 3 1/2 to 4 hours on High or 7 to 8 hours on Low.
', 'Step 8: Transfer turkey breast to a platter and allow to rest for about 10 minutes before slicing.
', 'Step 9: Peel squash and garlic cloves.
', 'Step 10: Arrange the cooked vegetables around the turkey meat and spoon the juices from the slow cooker over the turkey and vegetables to serve.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '455.5 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '19.2 g', 'cholesterolContent': '218.4 mg', 'fatContent': '4.6 g', 'fiberContent': '3.4 g', 'proteinContent': '81.1 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '1 g', 'sodiumContent': '364.7 mg', 'sugarContent': '5.2 g'}

Title: South African Traditional Rusks
Ingredients: ['8 cups self-rising flour', '4 cups ground All-Bran® cereal', '1 ¼ cups white sugar', '1 ¾ cups brown sugar', '1 teaspoon baking powder', '¾ teaspoon salt', '4 ½ sticks unsalted butter', '4 cups heavy cream']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line a high-rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper, letting the paper overhang the sides for easy removal.
', 'Step 3: Combine flour, ground All-Bran®, white sugar, brown sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl.
', 'Step 4: Melt butter in a saucepan over low heat.
', 'Step 5: Remove from the heat and mix in cream.
', 'Step 6: Add flour mixture and mix until well combined.
', 'Step 7: Spread out batter into the prepared baking sheet and use a knife to cut into slices; this will make removing the rusks easier once baked.
', 'Step 8: Bake in the preheated oven for 50 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Reduce heat to 160 degrees F (70 degrees C) and leave rusks in the low temperature oven for 4 hours to dry.
', 'Step 10: Remove from oven and allow to cool.
', 'Step 11: Cut into 80 slices.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '163.3 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '18.2 g', 'cholesterolContent': '30 mg', 'fatContent': '9.8 g', 'fiberContent': '1.2 g', 'proteinContent': '1.9 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '6.1 g', 'sodiumContent': '200.3 mg', 'sugarContent': '6.7 g'}

Title: Olive Chicken I
Ingredients: ['1 (2 to 3 pound) whole chicken, cut into pieces', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '2 onions, chopped', 'salt to taste', 'ground black pepper to taste', '½ teaspoon ground ginger', '½ teaspoon paprika', '1 pound pitted green olives', '1 lemon, juiced', '2 cups water']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat oil in a large saute pan.
', 'Step 2: Add onions, and sprinkle with ginger and paprika.
', 'Step 3: Saute until onions are golden.
', 'Step 4: Place chicken on top of onions.
', 'Step 5: Add about 1 to 2 cups of water, lemon juice, salt, pepper, and olives.
', 'Step 6: Cook about 1 hour, or until the chicken is tender.
']

Title: Makrout (Algerian Semolina Pastries)
Ingredients: ['4 cups semolina flour', '½ cup vegetable oil', '½ cup unsalted butter', '1 pinch salt', '⅓ cup warm water, or as needed', '1 tablespoon orange flower water', '4 tablespoons all-purpose flour', '2 teaspoons vanilla sugar', '4 cups finely ground almonds', '1 ¼ cups white sugar', '1 tablespoon vanilla sugar', '2 pinches ground cinnamon', '1 dash almond extract', '1 (12 ounce) jar honey', '3 tablespoons orange flower water', '2 cups oil for frying, or as needed', '2 tablespoons sesame seeds, for garnish']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine semolina, oil, butter, and salt in a large bowl.
', 'Step 2: Rub the grains of semolina between your fingers, so that all the grains are well coated.
', 'Step 3: Cover with a kitchen towel and set aside.
', 'Step 4: Let it rest like this for at least 2 hours, but ideally overnight.
', 'Step 5: The mixture should be like wet, oily sand in the morning.
', 'Step 6: Combine warm water and orange blossom water when you are ready to make the makrout.
', 'Step 7: Slowly add mixture to the semolina mixture along with flour and vanilla sugar and knead into a soft dough.
', 'Step 8: Add just enough liquid for a soft, smooth dough.
', "Step 9: Don't overwork the dough-- knead it just enough to have a smooth and flexible dough that can easily be shaped into a ball.
", 'Step 10: Set dough aside.
', 'Step 11: Combine ground almonds, sugar, vanilla sugar, cinnamon, and almond extract in a bowl for the filling.
', 'Step 12: Roll mixture into 2 long logs and set aside.
', 'Step 13: Divide semolina dough into 2 balls, then flatten to pat into a rectangle, about 3 times the width of your filling logs.
', 'Step 14: Press down in the center of the rectangle with your fingers to form an indentation.
', 'Step 15: Set filling log into the indentation.
', 'Step 16: Fold dough over the filling and press the edges together to seal.
', 'Step 17: Roll the log back and forth gently to shape the dough around the filling and smooth log into a uniform shape.
', 'Step 18: You can cut the logs in half for easier handling.
', 'Step 19: Cut each log into diagonal pieces, creating diamond-like shapes.
', 'Step 20: Reshape the cut ends to have a nice uniform look.
', 'Step 21: Set the makrout aside to rest, as you heat up a deep, heavy saucepan with oil - about 3 fingers deep.
', 'Step 22: Combine honey and orange flower water in a small saucepan for the syrup.
', 'Step 23: Heat over low heat until just below simmering and keep warm.
', 'Step 24: Once the oil is hot, deep-fry makrout in small batches until golden on all sides, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 25: Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.
', 'Step 26: Continue frying until all the dough pieces are cooked.
', 'Step 27: Dip fried makrout into the hot honey syrup and submerge in the syrup for about 1 minute.
', 'Step 28: Remove and drain on wire racks.
', 'Step 29: Repeat the process, dunking each makrout into the syrup a second time.
', 'Step 30: Remove and drain on wire racks.
', 'Step 31: Sprinkle with sesame seeds, if using.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '259.7 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '33.1 g', 'cholesterolContent': '6.1 mg', 'fatContent': '12.7 g', 'fiberContent': '2.1 g', 'proteinContent': '5.1 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '2.6 g', 'sodiumContent': '5 mg', 'sugarContent': '16.8 g'}

Title: Shelia's Chicken Yassa
Ingredients: ['⅓ cup lemon juice', '¼ cup olive oil', '¼ cup spicy brown mustard', '1 teaspoon minced garlic', '1 tablespoon black pepper', '1 tablespoon cayenne pepper, or to taste', '1 tablespoon lemon-pepper seasoning', '½ teaspoon salt', '3 pounds skinless chicken leg quarters', '2 medium lemons, halved', '¼ cup olive oil', '3 medium onions, thinly sliced', '1 medium red bell pepper, cut into thin strips', '1 medium green bell pepper, cut into thin strips', '1 medium carrot, peeled and sliced diagonally', '1 teaspoon minced garlic', '⅓ cup lemon juice', '½ cup low-sodium chicken broth', '½ cup pitted green olives', '3 cups cooked white rice']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Stir together lemon juice, oil, mustard, and garlic for marinade in a small bowl.
', 'Step 2: Stir together black pepper, cayenne, lemon-pepper seasoning, and salt in another small bowl.
', 'Step 3: Rub spice mixture all over chicken and transfer to a large zip-top plastic bag.
', 'Step 4: Add lemon juice mixture.
', 'Step 5: Seal the bag and turn to coat.
', 'Step 6: Chill up to 8 hours or overnight.
', 'Step 7: Prepare an outdoor grill for indirect grilling, lighting burners on one side only or pushing lit coals to one side.
', 'Step 8: Heat grill to medium heat, 325 to 375 degrees F (165 to 190 degrees C).
', 'Step 9: Lightly oil the grill grate.
', 'Step 10: Transfer chicken to unlit side of grill, discarding marinade.
', 'Step 11: Grill, turning once, until an instant-read thermometer inserted into thickest parts registers 165 degrees F (74 degrees C), 40 to 50 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Meanwhile, grill lemon halves, cut-sides down, over lit side of the grill until grill marks appear, about 8 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Heat 1/4 cup oil in a 12-inch cast iron skillet on the stovetop over medium-high heat until hot.
', 'Step 14: Stir in onions, bell peppers, carrot, garlic, and lemon juice; cook, stirring occasionally, until liquid evaporates and vegetables are tender and starting to brown, 10 to 12 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Add chicken broth; cook and stir for 1 minute.
', 'Step 16: Remove from heat and stir in olives.
', 'Step 17: Meanwhile, preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 18: Arrange grilled chicken over vegetables in the skillet.
', 'Step 19: Cover and bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 20: Serve over cooked rice with grilled lemon halves.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '951.4 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '58.3 g', 'cholesterolContent': '214.8 mg', 'fatContent': '50.5 g', 'fiberContent': '7 g', 'proteinContent': '69.2 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '9.6 g', 'sodiumContent': '1493.9 mg', 'sugarContent': '7.6 g'}

Title: Guinean Peanut Sauce with Butternut Squash
Ingredients: ['1 butternut squash - peeled, seeded, and cut into 2-inch cubes', '½ cup natural peanut butter', '1 small tomato, chopped', '1 cup warm water', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 large yellow onion, thickly sliced lengthwise', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 bay leaf', 'ground black pepper to taste', 'salt, or to taste', '2 teaspoons lemon juice']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the butternut squash in a saucepan with water to cover.
', 'Step 2: Bring to a boil and then simmer, covered, until the squash is tender, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Drain, reserving the cooking liquid.
', 'Step 4: Combine the peanut butter, tomato, and warm water in a bowl.
', 'Step 5: The authentic way to prepare this is to squish it together by hand -- but a food processor works, too.
', 'Step 6: Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 7: When the oil is hot, add the onion slices and cook for 2 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Add the peanut butter mixture, the minced garlic, the bay leaf, black pepper, and about 1/2 teaspoon salt.
', 'Step 9: Stir to combine, then bring to a boil.
', 'Step 10: Reduce the heat to low and simmer the peanut sauce, adding the reserved cooking liquid as needed, for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 11: The consistency should be similar to a thick soup.
', 'Step 12: Stir in the butternut squash and simmer for an additional 15 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Add the lemon juice, and taste to adjust the seasoning.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '395.6 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '42.4 g', 'fatContent': '24 g', 'fiberContent': '8.3 g', 'proteinContent': '11.4 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '3.4 g', 'sodiumContent': '390.8 mg', 'sugarContent': '10.4 g'}

Title: One-Pot Moroccan Chicken
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 medium onion, chopped', '2 cloves garlic', '1 pound skinless, boneless chicken breast, cut into 1-inch cubes', '1 cup crushed tomatoes, with liquid', '2 medium carrots, chopped', '2 stalks celery, sliced', '½ cup water', '¼ cup olives, or to taste', '2 tablespoons raisins, or to taste', '1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger root', '2 teaspoons salt', '1 teaspoon paprika', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon ground turmeric', '½ teaspoon dried oregano', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '1 tablespoon lemon juice', '1 tablespoon finely chopped cilantro, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat olive oil in a large pot over medium heat and cook onion until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
', 'Step 3: Add chicken, tomatoes, carrots, celery, water, olives, raisins, ginger, salt, paprika, cumin, turmeric, oregano, cinnamon, and cayenne pepper; mix to combine.
', 'Step 4: Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer until chicken has cooked through and flavors have mingled, 25 to 35 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Stir in lemon juice and garnish with cilantro.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '152 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '11.7 g', 'cholesterolContent': '39 mg', 'fatContent': '4.8 g', 'fiberContent': '2.6 g', 'proteinContent': '16.3 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '0.9 g', 'sodiumContent': '940.2 mg', 'sugarContent': '4.1 g'}

Title: South African Lamb Sosaties (Kebabs)
Ingredients: ['1 cup plain yogurt', '2 teaspoons curry powder', '1 tablespoon white sugar', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 large onion', '1 cup cubed lamb stew meat', '12 ounces dried apricots', '8 kabob skewers']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Make the sauce by mixing together the yogurt, curry powder, sugar and oil in a small bowl.
', 'Step 2: Taste and adjust seasonings to your liking.
', 'Step 3: Peel and cut the onion into 1 inch cubes.
', 'Step 4: Thread skewers alternating lamb cubes, onion dried apricot halves.
', 'Step 5: Place them into a large resealable bag and pour in the sauce.
', 'Step 6: Make sure the kabobs are evenly well coated.
', 'Step 7: Refrigerate and allow to marinate overnight or for at least 8 hours.
', 'Step 8: Preheat grill to medium heat and lightly oil grate.

Title: Spicy Potato Noodles (Bataka Sev)
Ingredients: ['¼ cup chopped fresh green chile peppers', '1 tablespoon coarsely chopped garlic', '2 tablespoons fresh ginger, peeled and coarsely chopped', '1 teaspoon salt', '⅛ teaspoon ground turmeric', '2 teaspoons vegetable oil', '1 pound potatoes, peeled', '3 cups water', '3 ½ cups chickpea flour', '2 ½ teaspoons salt', '1 teaspoon ground turmeric', '2 tablespoons mustard oil', 'vegetable oil for deep frying']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine the chiles, garlic, ginger, 1 teaspoon salt, 1/8 teaspoon turmeric, and 2 teaspoons vegetable oil in a food processor or mortar and pestle and process into a fine paste.
', 'Step 2: (Add a tablespoon of water if you need more liquid.
', 'Step 3: ) Set aside.
', 'Step 4: Place the potatoes in a saucepan with the water and bring to a boil over high heat.
', "Step 5: Reduce the heat to low, cover the pan, and cook the potatoes until they're soft and easily pierced with a fork, about 15 minutes.
", 'Step 6: Reserve the cooking water.
', "Step 7: Mash the potatoes while they're still warm, using some of the cooking water to get a smooth consistency.
", 'Step 8: Mix in 1 tablespoon green chile paste, chickpea flour, 2 1/2 teaspoons salt, 1 teaspoon turmeric, and mustard oil.
', 'Step 9: Add enough reserved potato-cooking water as needed to make a soft dough.
', 'Step 10: Taste the dough for heat level and seasoning (the dough will taste raw, but should be salty and spicy; the flavors will mellow slightly during cooking).
', 'Step 11: Add more salt and chile paste if desired.
', 'Step 12: Heat the cooking oil in a deep pan over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 13: Use a potato ricer (or sev machine, if you have one) to press noodles into the oil.
', 'Step 14: Fry until golden brown and crisp, about two minutes.
', 'Step 15: Use a skimmer or slotted spoon to transfer the noodles to a paper towel-lined bowl.
', 'Step 16: Repeat until all noodles are fried.
', 'Step 17: Store in an airtight container for up to two weeks.
']

Title: South African Milk Tart
