Ingredients: ['1 beet, cooked', '1 cup all-purpose flour, sifted', '1 cup milk', '1 egg', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 teaspoon white vinegar', '2 teaspoons ground cinnamon', '¼ cup white sugar', '2 oranges, quartered']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a blender or food processor, pulse the cooked beet, flour, milk, egg, vegetable oil, and vinegar until smooth.
', 'Step 2: Pour the batter into a bowl and set aside for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Combine the cinnamon with the sugar and mix well.
', 'Step 4: Heat an oiled non-stick skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 5: Pour in enough batter to cover half of the skillet.
', 'Step 6: Tip and rotate the skillet until the batter covers the entire area.
', 'Step 7: Cook until the batter turns from wet to moist, and the edges begin to curl away from the sides of the skillet.
', 'Step 8: Turn the pancake over, and continue cooking until lightly golden on the other side.
', 'Step 9: Place the pancake onto a plate, and cover with a kitchen towel to keep moist.
', 'Step 10: Repeat with the remaining batter, lightly oiling the skillet as needed to keep the pancakes from sticking.
', 'Step 11: Sprinkle the cinnamon sugar over the pancakes.
', 'Step 12: Roll up the pancakes and serve with the orange quarters.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '291.8 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '52.6 g', 'cholesterolContent': '45.8 mg', 'fatContent': '6.2 g', 'fiberContent': '4 g', 'proteinContent': '7.9 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '1.7 g', 'sodiumContent': '60.4 mg', 'sugarContent': '25.4 g'}

Title: Ethiopian Spiced Cottage Cheese
Ingredients: ['1 (16 ounce) package cottage cheese', '1 clove garlic, minced', '½ teaspoon ground cardamom', '⅛ teaspoon ground cloves', '2 tablespoons butter', '¼ cup finely chopped onion', '1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger root', '1 green chile pepper, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '2 pounds spinach leaves, cut into 2-inch pieces']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix cottage cheese, 1 clove of garlic, cardamom, and cloves thoroughly in a bowl.
', 'Step 2: Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.
', 'Step 3: Heat the butter in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 4: Stir in the onion, ginger, green chile pepper, and 2 cloves of garlic; cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Stir in the spinach and cook until just wilted.
', 'Step 6: Drain any excess liquid, and serve the spinach mixture over the seasoned cottage cheese.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '232.4 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '14.4 g', 'cholesterolContent': '32.1 mg', 'fatContent': '11.8 g', 'fiberContent': '5.5 g', 'proteinContent': '21.1 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '7 g', 'sodiumContent': '675.8 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.3 g'}

Title: Egyptian Rose Leaves
Ingredients: ['⅓ cup shortening', '1 cup white sugar', '2 eggs', '1 teaspoon rosewater', '2 cups all-purpose flour', '¼ teaspoon salt']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix shortening, sugar, eggs and rose fluid until fluffy.
', 'Step 2: Stir flour and salt together, then mix in butter mixture.
', 'Step 3: Dough will be soft.
', 'Step 4: Chill several hours or overnight.
', 'Step 5: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) Light grease or line baking sheets with parchment paper.
', 'Step 6: Using 1/3 of dough at time (keep rest of dough refrigerated) roll into balls about 3/4 inch in diameter.
', 'Step 7: Place on cookie sheets.
', 'Step 8: Flatten with hand until approximately half of their original thickness.
', 'Step 9: Imagine the flattened cookie to be a clock.
', 'Step 10: Make 2 slits, each 1/2 inch long, in cookie at 10:00 and at 2:00.
', 'Step 11: Pinch bottom to form "base" of petal.
', "Step 12: Sprinkle with red or pink decorator's sugar.
", 'Step 13: Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 8 to 10 minutes or until lightly browned on bottom.
', 'Step 14: Do not brown tops of cookies!
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '67.5 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '10.9 g', 'cholesterolContent': '10.3 mg', 'fatContent': '2.2 g', 'fiberContent': '0.2 g', 'proteinContent': '1.1 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '0.6 g', 'sodiumContent': '20.2 mg', 'sugarContent': '5.6 g'}

Title: Dziriat (Algerian Almond Tarts)
Ingredients: ['1 cup white sugar', '1 cup water', '1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice', '2 tablespoons orange flower water', '2 cups all-purpose flour', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 egg', '½ teaspoon fresh lemon juice', '1 pinch salt', '1 tablespoon orange flower water', '4 cups raw almonds', '1 cup sugar', '3 eggs', '½ teaspoon baking powder', '1 teaspoon vanilla powder', '1 lemon, zested', '2 tablespoons orange flower water', 'cornstarch, for rolling out the dough', 'pine nuts, for decoration']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Prepare the almonds the day before.
', 'Step 2: Bring 6 cups of water to a boil.
', 'Step 3: Remove from heat, and add the almonds.
', 'Step 4: Let the almonds soak in water for about 5 minutes, then drain and peel.
', 'Step 5: Spread the almonds on baking sheets, and bake at 200 degrees F(95 degrees C) until completely dry and toasted.
', 'Step 6: This takes several hours, and needs to be prepared ahead.
', 'Step 7: Be careful not to burn the nuts, as this will give a bitter taste to the filling.
', 'Step 8: Combine 1 cup sugar and 1 cup water in a saucepan, and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 9: Add 1 teaspoon lemon juice, reduce heat to low, and let it simmer until syrupy, about 30 to 40 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Stir in orange blossom water, and remove from heat.
', 'Step 11: Set sugar syrup aside.
', 'Step 12: Combine flour and salt in a large mixing bowl.
', 'Step 13: Make a hole in the center, and pour oil, egg, 1/2 teaspoon lemon juice, and 1 tablespoon orange blossom water into the center.
', 'Step 14: Mix with fingers until the dough resembles coarse crumbs.
', 'Step 15: Gradually sprinkle with warm water while mixing until the dough becomes soft and pliable.
', 'Step 16: Divide into 4 equal portions.
', 'Step 17: Cover dough with a wet cloth, and set aside.
', 'Step 18: In a food processor, finely grind the almonds.
', 'Step 19: Measure 3 cups of the finely ground almonds into a mixing bowl, and stir together with 1 cup sugar, baking powder, vanilla powder, lemon zest, and 2 tablespoons orange flower water.
', 'Step 20: Mix in three eggs one at a time, stirring constantly; mix until you get a sticky, paste-like mixture.
', 'Step 21: Sprinkle cornstarch on the rolling surface to prevent sticking.
', 'Step 22: Roll each portion of dough very thinly, 1 to 2 millimeters (1/16 inch).
', 'Step 23: Cut the rolled dough into circles of about 10 centimeters (4 inches) in diameter each.
', 'Step 24: Lightly wipe the surface of each circle with cornstarch, and fit into a tart mold, cornstarch side down to prevent sticking.
', 'Step 25: Gently press the dough onto the sides and bottom of the mold, and trim extra dough from around the rim.
', 'Step 26: Fill three quarters of each mold with the almond filling.
', 'Step 27: Bake on the top shelf at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 20 to 25 minutes, or until the surface of the tart is golden and the dough is firm.
', 'Step 28: Remove the tarts from the molds as soon as they come out of the oven.
', 'Step 29: Dip each tart in the sugar syrup while still hot.
', 'Step 30: Stick a pine nut into the middle of each tart for decoration.
', 'Step 31: Place on a wire rack to drain.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '170 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '18.8 g', 'cholesterolContent': '18.6 mg', 'fatContent': '9.3 g', 'fiberContent': '1.9 g', 'proteinContent': '4.7 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '1 g', 'sodiumContent': '12.1 mg', 'sugarContent': '10.9 g'}

Title: Tunisian Kaftaji
Ingredients: ['2 zucchinis, thinly sliced', '2 yellow squash, thinly sliced', '3 tomatoes, chopped', '3 potatoes, peeled and cut into strips', '2 hot chile peppers, chopped', '5 eggs', 'salt and pepper to taste', '2 ½ tablespoons harissa', '1 tablespoon water, divided']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat a nonstick skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Cook the zucchini, yellow squash, tomatoes, potatoes, and chile peppers, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are tender, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Transfer the vegetables to a bowl and set aside.
', 'Step 4: Return the skillet to the burner over medium heat.
', 'Step 5: Crack the eggs into the skillet and fry them until the whites are set but the yolk is still runny, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Add the eggs to the bowl of vegetables and season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 7: Using two knives, cut into the eggs and vegetables, mincing the mixture up into small pieces until well blended.
', 'Step 8: It will look mushy.
', 'Step 9: In a separate bowl, mix the harissa with water, one teaspoon at a time, until the mixture is pourable but still thick.
', 'Step 10: Pour the harissa over the kaftaji and serve.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '264.9 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '41.4 g', 'cholesterolContent': '204.6 mg', 'fatContent': '6.5 g', 'fiberContent': '7.7 g', 'proteinContent': '13.2 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '1.9 g', 'sodiumContent': '151.7 mg', 'sugarContent': '6.8 g'}

Title: Bithia's Doro Wat
Ingredients: ['1 ¾ pounds chicken thighs, skin removed', '1 ¾ pounds chicken drumsticks, skin removed', '¼ cup grated fresh ginger', '2 tablespoons minced garlic', '4 tablespoons niter kibbeh (spiced clarified butter), divided', '1 cup thinly sliced red onion', '1 (15 ounce) can tomato sauce', '2 tablespoons berbere (Ethiopian spice blend)', '1 ½ teaspoons fine kosher salt', '1 teaspoon sweet paprika', '½ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '½ teaspoon ground cardamom', '½ teaspoon ground nutmeg', '2 tablespoons finely chopped cilantro leaves and stems', '6 pieces injera (Ethiopian bread)']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Pierce chicken thighs and drumsticks in a few spots with a knife; rub with ginger and garlic to coat.
', 'Step 2: Heat 2 tablespoons niter kibbeh in a deep, 12-inch skillet or Dutch oven over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 3: Arrange chicken pieces in a single layer and sear until browned, about 3 minutes per side.
', 'Step 4: Transfer to a plate.
', 'Step 5: Add remaining 2 tablespoons niter kibbeh to the skillet.
', 'Step 6: Add onion; stir-fry over medium-high heat until softened and light brown around the edges, 5 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Pour in tomato sauce and sprinkle in berbere, salt, paprika, cayenne, cardamom, and nutmeg.
', 'Step 8: Bring to a boil.
', 'Step 9: Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer, stirring occasionally, until a thin layer of oil separates from the sauce, forming a spice-colored film on its surface, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Return chicken and any pooled juices to the skillet; coat with sauce.
', 'Step 11: Cook, covered and turning pieces occasionally, until the thickest parts are no longer pink when pierced and meat begins to fall off the bone, 35 to 40 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Sprinkle with cilantro and serve with injera.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '605 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '46.9 g', 'cholesterolContent': '233.7 mg', 'fatContent': '20 g', 'fiberContent': '3.4 g', 'proteinContent': '60.6 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '8 g', 'sodiumContent': '1333.2 mg'}

Title: Cassava Couscous (Attieke)
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '¼ cup minced yellow onion', '¼ cup minced carrot', '¼ cup minced celery', '¼ cup chopped peanuts', '2 tablespoons black sesame seeds', '1 bay leaf', 'salt to taste', '1 (300 g) box attieke (cassava couscous)', '1 cup water', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Saute onion, carrot, and celery until fragrant, 3 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Add peanuts, sesame seeds, bay leaf, and salt, stirring often.
', 'Step 4: When the vegetables are tender and the seeds and peanuts have toasted, add the attieke, stirring constantly.
', 'Step 5: Pour the water over the entire pan, distributing evenly.
', 'Step 6: Cover and reduce the heat to medium, allowing the couscous to steam until it is moist and heated all the way through, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove the cover and fold the couscous with a spatula.
', 'Step 8: Do not stir, as this will mash the couscous, just use a folding maneuver to mix the ingredients from the bottom upwards and let the couscous breathe to help the water evaporate.
', 'Step 9: Top with chopped cilantro.
']

Title: Citrons Confits Express (Quick Preserved Lemons)
Ingredients: ['2 lemons, sliced into thin wedges', '¼ cup water', '2 tablespoons water', '1 lemon, juiced', '1 tablespoon salt']
Cooking Instructions:

', 'Step 2: n Cook in the microwave for 10 minutes, stirring at 2-minute intervals to prevent spills.

']

Title: Fava Beans in Tahini Sauce
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 medium onion, chopped', '1 (15 ounce) can fava beans, drained', '1 lemon, juiced', '⅓ cup tahini', '5 cloves garlic, crushed', 'salt and pepper to taste']

', 'Step 2: Cook onion in oil until softened.
', 'Step 3: Stir in the beans and lemon juice.
', 'Step 4: Next, stir in the tahini until mixture is thick.
', 'Step 5: Then, add the garlic, and cook for a few minutes more.
', 'Step 6: Season to taste with salt and pepper.
']

Title: Algerian Flafla (Bell Pepper Salad)
Ingredients: ['3 green bell peppers', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 tablespoon finely chopped red onion', '1 clove garlic, minced', 'salt and pepper to taste', '1 roma (plum) tomato, diced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat an oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Place the whole peppers on aluminum foil.
', 'Step 3: Bake until the skin is spotted black and the peppers are soft, 30 to 45 minutes, turning the peppers once if necessary.
', 'Step 4: Remove peppers from the oven and set aside to cool for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Peel off the skin and remove the stem and seeds.
', 'Step 6: Chop the roasted peppers into half-inch pieces.
', 'Step 7: Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 8: Stir in the onion and cook, stirring frequently, until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Add the garlic, salt, and pepper; stir in the chopped peppers and tomato.
', 'Step 10: Cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until the tomato is soft and the mixture is well incorporated, about 5 minutes.
']

Title: Tunisian Soup
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons butter', '1 onion, chopped', '1 cup couscous', '8 cups water', '2 zucchini, chopped', '1 potato, chopped', '20 green beans, chopped', '2 carrots, chopped', '2 tablespoons tomato puree', '½ teaspoon ground coriander', '½ teaspoon red chile powder', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon salt', '½ cup milk']

', 'Step 2: Add onion; cook and stir until translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Mix in couscous; cook and stir until browned, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Stir in water, zucchini, potato, green beans, carrots, tomato puree, coriander, chile powder, cumin, and salt; bring to a boil.

', 'Step 6: Stir in milk.
']

Title: Lablabi (Tunisian Chickpea Soup)
Ingredients: ['4 cups chicken stock', '1 ½ cups cooked chickpeas', '2 teaspoons harissa', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '1 teaspoon salt', '2 slices sourdough bread, cubed', '⅓ cup chopped fresh parsley', '⅓ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 tablespoon capers, chopped', '4 large soft-boiled eggs', '2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil for drizzling']

['Step 1: Combine stock, chickpeas, harissa, cumin, and salt in a large pot.
', 'Step 2: Bring to a boil over medium-high heat, reduce temperature, and simmer for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Taste and adjust seasoning if necessary.
', 'Step 4: Divide bread, chopped parsley, cilantro, and capers between 4 soup bowls.
', 'Step 5: Scoop an egg from the shell into each bowl, pour soup on top, and drizzle with olive oil.
']

Title: Moroccan Peach Roasted Chicken
Ingredients: ['¼ cup margarine or butter', '¼ cup honey', '1 teaspoon rose water', '1 teaspoon salt', 'ground black pepper to taste', '4 pounds bone-in chicken pieces, with skin', '1 pound fresh peaches, pitted and sliced', '1 tablespoon white sugar', '½ cup toasted slivered almonds']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: In a glass measuring cup, combine the margarine, honey, rose water, salt and pepper.
', 'Step 3: Heat in the microwave until margarine has melted, about 30 seconds.
', 'Step 4: Place chicken in a baking dish and pour the margarine mixture over it.
', 'Step 5: Stir to coat the chicken completely.
', 'Step 6: Place the dish of chicken into the oven.
', 'Step 7: Cook uncovered in the preheated oven until chicken pieces have browned, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Reduce the oven temperature to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 9: Add the peaches to the dish and sprinkle with sugar.
', 'Step 10: Continue to roast until chicken is cooked through, about 20 more minutes.
', 'Step 11: Remove chicken pieces to a serving dish and pour the juices from the pan over them.
', 'Step 12: Garnish with slivered almonds.
']

Title: Arabian Rose Water Pudding (Muhalbiyah)
Ingredients: ['3 ½ cups water', '½ cup rose water', '½ cup dry milk powder', '½ cup white sugar', '5 tablespoons cornstarch']
Cooking Instructions:

', 'Step 2: Place over medium heat, stirring with a wooden spoon, and cook until it begins to boil; cook at a boil for 2 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Remove from heat immediately; stir a few times to help it cool.
', 'Step 4: Divide the mixture between 8 small serving glasses; refrigerate until set, about 2 hours.
']

Title: South African-Inspired Butternut Soup
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon butter', '2 large onions, finely chopped', '1 large jalapeno pepper, seeded and minced', '1 clove elephant garlic, chopped', '2 cups chicken stock', '1 teaspoon lemon juice', '1 (3 1/2) pound butternut squash - peeled, seeded, and cut into 2-inch cubes', '1 cup water', '6 tablespoons cream, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:

', 'Step 2: Add onions, jalapeno, and elephant garlic and cook until onions are soft and transparent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Stir in chicken stock and lemon juice until well mixed.
', 'Step 4: Add butternut squash and water; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 5: Reduce heat and simmer until squash is tender and soup is thick, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 6: Puree with an immersion blender until smooth.
', 'Step 7: Ladle hot soup into bowls and swirl cream in the center of each bowl just before serving.
']

Title: Instant Pot® Moroccan Chicken
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon Moroccan spice rub', '1 pound chicken tenders', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 tablespoon butter', '½ small red onion, chopped', '1 carrot, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 cup pearl (Israeli) couscous', '¾ cup chicken broth', '½ cup chickpeas, rinsed and drained', '2 tablespoons toasted almonds']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Coat chicken with 1 tablespoon olive oil and Moroccan seasoning in a shallow dish.
', 'Step 2: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) and select Saute function.
', 'Step 3: Add 1 tablespoon olive oil and butter once the pot is hot.
', 'Step 4: Cook chicken until browned, 3 to 5 minutes per side.
', 'Step 5: Remove chicken and keep warm.
', 'Step 6: Add onion, carrot, and garlic and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Add pearl couscous, broth, and chickpeas; stir to combine.
', 'Step 8: Cancel Saute function.
', 'Step 9: Add chicken back to the pot.
', 'Step 10: Close and lock the lid.
', "Step 11: Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 5 minutes.
", 'Step 12: Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
', "Step 13: Release pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes.
", 'Step 14: Unlock and remove the lid.
', 'Step 15: Serve chicken with almonds sprinkled on top.
']

Title: Spicy Chickpea Tagine
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '2 onions, minced', '4 cloves garlic, minced', '2 teaspoons ground turmeric', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '½ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 ½ teaspoons agave nectar', '2 tablespoons water, or as needed', '3 carrots, cut into 1/4-inch slices', '¼ teaspoon salt', '2 (14 ounce) cans chickpeas (garbanzo beans), drained and rinsed', '4 lemon wedges', '4 sprigs fresh cilantro, or as desired']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat oil in a tagine or Dutch oven over medium heat; cook and stir onions and garlic until softened, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Add turmeric, cumin, agave nectar, cinnamon, cayenne pepper, and black pepper and stir until onion mixture is evenly coated.
', 'Step 3: Add just enough water to cover the bottom of the tagine; add carrots and salt.
', 'Step 4: Cook over medium-low for 12 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Mix chickpeas into carrot mixture, adding more water if needed to cover the bottom but keeping the sauce thick.
', 'Step 6: Cook mixture for 7 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Serve tagine with lemon wedges and cilantro.
']

Title: Moroccan-Spiced Chicken Skewers
Ingredients: ['¼ cup extra-virgin olive oil', '¼ cup chopped fresh mint leaves', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice', '2 teaspoons honey', '1 ½ teaspoons kosher salt', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 teaspoon paprika', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon ground coriander', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '¼ teaspoon ground cayenne pepper', '4 (6 ounce) skinless, boneless chicken breast halves, cut into 1 1/2 inch cubes', '2 cups whole-milk Greek yogurt', '½ cup fresh lemon juice', '¼ cup finely chopped mint leaves', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '1 teaspoon finely grated fresh lemon zest', '1 teaspoon kosher salt', '2 green bell peppers, cut into cubes', '1 small red onion, cut into 8 wedges', 'bamboo skewers, soaked in water for 30 minutes']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Whisk olive oil, 1/4 cup mint, cilantro, 2 tablespoons lemon juice, honey, 1 1/2 teaspoon salt, 2 cloves garlic, paprika, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, and cayenne in a large bowl.
', 'Step 2: Reserve 1/4 cup marinade in a separate bowl.
', 'Step 3: Place chicken in a large resealable plastic bag.
', 'Step 4: Pour marinade over chicken.
', 'Step 5: Press air out of the bag and seal tightly.
', 'Step 6: Turn the bag to distribute the marinade.
', 'Step 7: Place in a bowl and refrigerate for 5 hours.
', 'Step 8: Whisk yogurt, 1/2 cup lemon juice, 1/4 cup mint, 2 cloves garlic, lemon zest, and 1 teaspoon salt together in a bowl to make sauce.
', 'Step 9: Cover and place in the refrigerator.
', 'Step 10: Toss green bell peppers and red onion in the reserved 1/4 cup marinade.
', 'Step 11: Remove chicken from the bag and discard all marinade.
', 'Step 12: Thread chicken, peppers, and onion alternately onto skewers.
', 'Step 13: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 14: Arrange skewers on the grill.
', 'Step 15: Close lid and cook, turning once or twice, until chicken is firm to the touch, 8 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Remove from grill and let stand for 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Serve with cold sauce.
']

Title: Mombasa Pumpkin Dessert
Ingredients: ['1 medium sugar pumpkin, seeded and cubed', '2 cups white sugar', '1 cup coconut milk', '1 teaspoon ground cardamom']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Steam the pumpkin pieces for 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Scoop flesh from skins.
', 'Step 3: In a medium saucepan, combine the pumpkin flesh and sugar.
', 'Step 4: Heat over medium-low temperature until sugar dissolves into the pumpkin.
', 'Step 5: Add coconut and cardamom.

Title: Ethiopian Instant Pot® Stewed Cabbage
Ingredients: ['¼ cup olive oil, or more to taste', '4 medium carrots, thinly sliced', '1 medium onion, thinly sliced', '1 teaspoon sea salt', '½ medium head cabbage, chopped', '5 medium potatoes, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch cubes', '¼ cup beef broth', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon ground turmeric']

Title: Khobz el Dar (Algerian Semolina Bread)
Ingredients: ['½ cup semolina flour', '2 tablespoons semolina flour', '3 tablespoons sesame seeds, divided', '1 tablespoon white sugar', '1 teaspoon active dry yeast', '¾ teaspoon salt', '¼ cup vegetable oil', '1 egg', '1 egg, separated', '1 cup lukewarm milk', '2 ¾ cups all-purpose flour', '2 tablespoons all-purpose flour, or more as needed', '1 teaspoon water']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons semolina, 2 tablespoons sesame seeds, sugar, yeast, and salt together in a large bowl.
', 'Step 2: Whisk in oil, egg, and egg white.
', 'Step 3: Stir in warm milk slowly until a liquid dough forms.
', 'Step 4: Cover the bowl with a plate or plastic wrap; let stand at room temperature until frothy, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 5: Stir in 2 3/4 cups flour with a wooden spoon until a sticky dough forms.
', 'Step 6: Cover again and allow to rest for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or a baking mat.
', 'Step 8: Sprinkle 1 tablespoon flour over the dough and your hands.
', 'Step 9: Mix dough, adding flour as needed, 1 tablespoon at a time, until it pulls away from the sides of the bowl.
', 'Step 10: Shape into a round loaf and place on the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 11: Cover loosely with a towel and let rise for 1 hour in a warm place until loaf doubles in volume.
', 'Step 12: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 13: Beat egg yolk and water in a bowl with a fork; brush over the entire surface of the loaf.
', 'Step 14: Sprinkle 1 tablespoon sesame seeds on top.
', 'Step 15: Bake in the preheated oven until loaf is golden brown, about 20 to 25 minutes.
']

Title: Fried Katayef (Egyptian Dessert)
Ingredients: ['1 ½ cups water', '1 cup white sugar', '1 teaspoon fresh lemon juice', '1 (8 ounce) container ricotta cheese', '1 teaspoon cornstarch', '2 ½ cups all-purpose flour', '1 ½ (.25 ounce) envelopes active dry yeast', '3 cups water', '3 cups oil for frying']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Make a syrup by stirring the water, sugar, and lemon juice together in a saucepan over medium heat until thick; set aside to cool.
', 'Step 2: Make a filling by combining the ricotta cheese and cornstarch in a small bowl; set aside.
', 'Step 3: Make the dough by mixing together the flour and the yeast.
', 'Step 4: Stir the water into the flour mixture 1 cup at a time, whisking to remove any lumps, until the mixture reaches a pourable consistency; allow to rest 1 hour.
', 'Step 5: Heat a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 6: Ladle 2 to 3 ounces of batter at a time into the center of the skillet into a round shape.
', 'Step 7: Each katayef shell is finished when the top is dry and the bottom is slightly browned.
', 'Step 8: Fill each shell with an equal portion of the cheese mixture.
', 'Step 9: Fold one end of the shell over the cheese mixture and seal into a semi-circle shape by pinching along the edges.
', 'Step 10: Heat the frying oil in a small saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 11: Fry the katayef in the oil until crispy and lightly browned; immerse in the syrup to coat; serve immediately.
']

Title: Ghorayeba

['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: In a medium bowl, stir together the butter and sugar until smooth.
', 'Step 3: Stir in flour and cardamom until well blended.

', 'Step 5: Join the ends together in a circle, and place on a greased cookie sheet.
', 'Step 6: Place almond halves on the joints where the circles come together.
', 'Step 7: Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven.
', 'Step 8: The cookies should remain white, but may turn golden at the very edge.
']

Title: Harissa Hummus
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons harissa powder', '3 cups low-sodium chickpeas, drained and liquid reserved', '⅓ cup extra virgin olive oil, or more as needed', '2 tablespoons tahini', '1 tablespoon lemon juice, or more as needed', '2 cloves garlic', '8 Kalamata olives', '2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '⅛ teaspoon harissa powder, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine harissa powder and 1 teaspoon chickpea liquid in a bowl.
', 'Step 2: Whisk until a smooth paste forms, adding more liquid as needed.
', 'Step 3: Set aside.
', 'Step 4: Reserve about 1/2 cup of whole chickpeas for garnish.
', 'Step 5: Add remaining chickpeas to the bowl of a food processor.
', 'Step 6: Add 1/3 cup olive oil, tahini, 1 tablespoon lemon juice, and garlic; blend until smooth.
', 'Step 7: Mix in reserved harissa paste and more chickpea liquid if needed, to maintain a creamy consistency.
', 'Step 8: Taste and adjust olive oil and lemon juice amounts until flavor is smooth and nutty with a kick, and not overpowered by any one element.
', 'Step 9: Transfer hummus to a serving dish.
', 'Step 10: Top with reserved 1/2 cup chickpeas, olives, cilantro, harissa powder, and any remaining olive oil.
', 'Step 11: Serve at room temperature.
']

Title: Namoora (Basboosa)
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon tahini (sesame seed paste)', '2 cups dry farina cereal', '1 ½ cups white sugar', '2 teaspoons baking powder', '1 cup plain yogurt', '1 tablespoon butter, softened', '16 blanched almond halves', '2 cups white sugar', '2 cups water', '1 teaspoon lemon juice', '1 tablespoon butter', '1 teaspoon orange flower water']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Line a 9x13-inch glass baking dish with aluminum foil and generously butter the foil.
', 'Step 2: Spread the tahini evenly over the bottom of the prepared pan in a thin layer.
', 'Step 3: Mix together farina cereal with 1 1/2 cup of sugar and baking powder in a bowl.
', 'Step 4: Mix in the yogurt and 1 tablespoon of softened butter gently with your hands until the dough is smooth.
', 'Step 5: Spread dough out into the prepared baking dish.
', 'Step 6: Pat the surface smooth.
', 'Step 7: Cover the dish with foil, and allow to stand at room temperature for 2 hours.
', 'Step 8: With a sharp knife, cut the dough into 16 squares; push an almond half gently into the top of each square.
', 'Step 9: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 10: Bake in the preheated oven until the dessert is set and the top is lightly golden brown, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 11: While the dessert is baking, make the syrup.
', 'Step 12: Place 2 cups of sugar into a saucepan with the water, and bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly to dissolve sugar.
', 'Step 13: Stir in the lemon juice, and boil the syrup for 5 minutes; stir in butter and orange flower water until combined.
', 'Step 14: Pour the hot syrup over the dessert as soon as it comes out of the oven.
', 'Step 15: Let cool for 1 to 2 hours to let the syrup absorb before serving.
']

Title: Tastira (Tunisian Fried Peppers and Eggs)
Ingredients: ['4 cloves garlic, diced', '1 tablespoon caraway seeds', '1 pinch salt', '3 tablespoons olive oil', '⅔ cup mild chile peppers, chopped', '1 ½ cups green bell peppers, seeded and chopped', '2 cups tomatoes, seeded and chopped', '4 eggs', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mash the garlic, caraway seeds, and pinch of salt in a mortar and pestle or against the side of a mixing bowl.
', 'Step 2: Heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Stir in the chile peppers; cook and stir until the peppers have softened, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Remove them from the skillet and set aside.
', 'Step 5: Add another tablespoon of oil to the skillet and cook the bell peppers and tomatoes until the peppers are soft and the tomatoes have begun to break down, about 5 more minutes.
', 'Step 6: Add the tomato-bell pepper mixture to the hot peppers.
', 'Step 7: Stir in the mashed garlic and caraway seeds.
', 'Step 8: Spoon the vegetables onto plates or a serving platter.
', 'Step 9: Heat the remaining oil in the skillet.
', 'Step 10: Fry the eggs until the whites are set and the yolks are the desired consistency, about 2 to 3 minutes for runny yolks, 4 to 5 minutes for fully set yolks.
', 'Step 11: Place the fried eggs on the vegetable mixture and season to taste with salt and pepper.
']

Title: Mamool or Ma'amoul
Ingredients: ['2 cups semolina flour', '1 ½ cups shortening', '1 cup boiling water', '¾ cup white sugar', '2 cups ground walnuts', '1 teaspoon rose water', "¼ cup confectioners' sugar for dusting"]
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the semolina flour into a medium bowl, and cut in shortening using a pastry blender or a fork.
', 'Step 2: Pour in boiling water, and mix to form a solid dough.
', 'Step 3: Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface, and knead for a minute or two to be sure the dough is well blended.
', 'Step 4: Cover dough and let stand for at least one hour, or as long as overnight.
', 'Step 5: In a medium bowl, mix together the sugar, ground nuts, and rose water so that the mixture is uniform.
', 'Step 6: Set aside.
', 'Step 7: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 8: Grease cookie sheets, or line with parchment paper.
', 'Step 9: Knead dough again briefly, and form into walnut sized balls.
', 'Step 10: Make a hole in the center using your finger.
', 'Step 11: Fill the hole with the nut mixture, and seal the dough up over it.
', 'Step 12: Gently form into balls or crescents, or make designs into the dough using a fork.
', 'Step 13: Place cookies at least 1 inch apart onto the prepared cookie sheets.
', 'Step 14: Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven, or until lightly browned.
', 'Step 15: Dust with confectioners sugar while still warm if desired.
']

Title: Kifta
Ingredients: ['1 ½ cups vegetable oil for frying', '1 large potato, thinly sliced', '2 pounds ground beef', '½ onion, minced', '3 cloves garlic', '½ bunch fresh parsley, chopped', '1 ½ teaspoons salt', '1 ½ teaspoons ground black pepper', '1 ½ teaspoons ground allspice', '1 ½ teaspoons ground nutmeg', '1 ½ teaspoons cumin', '1 large tomato, thinly sliced', '½ onion, sliced', '2 cups long grain white rice', '4 cups water']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Heat the oil in a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 3: When the oil is hot, place potato slices in a thin layer, and fry just until golden.
', 'Step 4: Remove with a slotted spoon, and set aside on paper towels.
', 'Step 5: In a medium bowl, mix together the ground beef, minced onion, garlic, parsley, salt, pepper, allspice, nutmeg, and cumin.
', 'Step 6: Press flat into a 7x11 inch baking dish.
', 'Step 7: Arrange potato slices over the meat in an even layer.
', 'Step 8: Place tomato slices over the potato.
', 'Step 9: Top with slices of onion.
', 'Step 10: Cover with aluminum foil.
', 'Step 11: Bake for 45 minutes in the preheated oven.
', 'Step 12: Remove the aluminum foil from the top, and continue to bake for another 15 minutes, or until browned.
', 'Step 13: While the kifta is cooking, combine the rice and water in a saucepan.
', 'Step 14: Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 20 minutes or until rice is tender.
', 'Step 15: When kifta is done, cut into squares and serve over rice.
']

Title: Moroccan Shrimp Stew
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons grapeseed oil, or more as needed', '1 medium yellow onion, chopped', '2 medium carrots, sliced', '1 medium red bell pepper, cut into bite-sized pieces', '1 medium green bell pepper, cut into bite-sized pieces', '4 cloves garlic, chopped', '2 tablespoons harissa paste', '1 (14.5 ounce) can fire-roasted diced tomatoes, undrained', '1 (6 ounce) can tomato paste', '2 cups shrimp stock, or more as needed', '1 (15 ounce) can garbanzo beans, rinsed and drained', '1 pound uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined', '2 teaspoons sea salt']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat oil in a Dutch oven over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Add onion and cook, stirring, for 1 minute.
', 'Step 3: Add carrots and bell peppers; cook and stir for 1 minute.
', 'Step 4: Stir in garlic and 1 tablespoon harissa; mix well.
', 'Step 5: Pour in fire-roasted tomatoes with liquid and stir to combine.
', 'Step 6: Mix in tomato paste and remaining 1 tablespoon harissa until well combined.
', 'Step 7: Pour in stock slowly, stirring constantly, to ensure that all ingredients are well mixed together.
', 'Step 8: Add garbanzo beans.
', 'Step 9: Reduce heat and simmer, stirring occasionally, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 10: If stew appears too dry, add a few more tablespoons stock if needed.
', 'Step 11: Add shrimp and salt.
', 'Step 12: Mix well.
', 'Step 13: Cover and cook until shrimp are bright pink on the outside and the meat is opaque, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Be careful not to overcook the shrimp.
']

Title: South African Instant Milk Tart

Title: Algerian Bouzgene Berber Bread with Roasted Pepper Sauce
Ingredients: ['2 red bell peppers', '4 tomatoes', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '4 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 jalapeno pepper, chopped', 'salt to taste', '2 pounds semolina', '1 ½ teaspoons salt, or to taste', '3 cups water, or as needed', '4 tablespoons olive oil', '6 tablespoons olive oil for frying']
Cooking Instructions:
["Step 1: Preheat your oven's broiler.
", 'Step 2: Place red bell peppers and tomatoes on a baking sheet, and roast under the broiler for about 8 minutes, turning occasionally.
', 'Step 3: This should blacken the skin and help it peel off more easily.
', 'Step 4: Cool, then scrape the skins off of the tomatoes and peppers, and place them in a large bowl.
', 'Step 5: Remove cores and seeds from the bell peppers.
', 'Step 6: Heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 7: Add the jalapenos and garlic, and cook until tender, stirring frequently.
', 'Step 8: Remove from heat, and transfer the garlic and jalapeno to the bowl with the tomatoes and red peppers.
', 'Step 9: Using two sharp steak knives (one in each hand), cut up the tomatoes and peppers to a coarse and soupy consistency.
', 'Step 10: Stir, and set sauce aside.
', 'Step 11: Place the semolina in a large bowl, and stir in salt and 4 tablespoons of olive oil.
', 'Step 12: Gradually add water while mixing and squeezing with your hand until the dough holds together without being sticky or dry, and molds easily with the hand.
', 'Step 13: Divide into 6 pieces and form into balls.
', 'Step 14: For each round, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil in a large heavy skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 15: Roll out dough one round at a time, to no thicker than 1/4 inch.
', 'Step 16: Fry in the hot skillet until dark brown spots appear on the surface, and they are crispy.
', 'Step 17: Remove from the skillet, and wrap in a clean towel while preparing the remaining flat breads.
', 'Step 18: To eat the bread and sauce, break off pieces of the bread, and scoop them into the sauce.
', 'Step 19: It will slide off, but just keep reaching in!
']

Title: Couscous Royale
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '2 pounds small chicken thighs', '12 ounces Merguez or spicy Italian sausage', '1 tablespoon minced garlic', '2 onions, minced', '2 carrots, peeled and cut into 1/2-inch rounds', '½ stalk celery, cut into 1/2 inch pieces', '1 rutabaga, parsnip, or turnip - peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes', '½ green bell pepper, cut into 1/4 inch strips', '½ red bell pepper, cut into 1/4 inch strips', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '1 (15.5 ounce) can garbanzo beans', '2 cups chicken stock', '2 teaspoons chopped fresh thyme', '1 teaspoon turmeric', '1 teaspoon cayenne pepper', '¼ teaspoon harissa, or to taste', '1 bay leaf', '2 zucchini, halved lengthwise and sliced into 1-inch pieces', '2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil', '2 cups couscous', '2 cups chicken stock', '½ cup plain yogurt']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.

Title: South African Bobotie
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon oil, or as needed', '1 onion, chopped', '1 pound ground beef', '½ slice bread', '½ cup milk, divided', '1 egg, beaten, divided', '¼ cup seedless raisins', '1 tablespoon white vinegar', '2 teaspoons white sugar', '1 teaspoon ground turmeric', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon curry powder', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '2 bay leaves', '1 ½ tablespoons chutney']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat; add onion and saute until browned, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Add ground beef to onion and saute until browned, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Soak bread in 1/4 cup milk in a small bowl, mash, and add to ground beef mixture; stir in 1/2 of beaten egg, raisins, vinegar, sugar, turmeric, salt, curry powder, and ground black pepper.
', 'Step 5: Transfer beef mixture to glass baking dish; insert bay leaves.
', 'Step 6: Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes.

Title: Liberian Style Collard Greens
Ingredients: ['6 slices bacon', '1 bunch collard greens, chopped', '⅓ cup vegetable oil', '3 cups water, plus more as needed', '3 cubes chicken bouillon', '⅓ cup creamy peanut butter', '1 teaspoon liquid smoke flavoring', '1 pinch soul food seasoning, or to taste', '1 pinch cayenne pepper, or to taste', 'salt to taste', 'ground black pepper to taste', '2 (6 ounce) fillets flounder']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the bacon in a large deep skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Drain the bacon slices on a paper towel-lined plate and crumble.
', 'Step 3: Heat collard greens, vegetable oil, water, and chicken bouillon in a large pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 4: Simmer until greens are wilted, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Stir bacon, peanut butter, liquid smoke, soul food seasoning, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper into pot; cover and simmer until greens are very tender and peanut butter begins to separate, about 1 1/2 hours.
', 'Step 6: Add more water if the mixture becomes too dry.
', 'Step 7: Stir flounder fillets into greens.
', 'Step 8: Continue to cook until fish breaks down, about 30 minutes more, stirring frequently.
']

Title: Bissara

', 'Step 2: Pour in water and olive oil; stir in split peas, parsley, chili pepper, paprika, cumin, salt, and pepper.

Title: Cold Roasted Moroccan Spiced Salmon
Ingredients: ['¾ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '¾ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground ginger', '¼ teaspoon mustard powder', '¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg', '⅛ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '⅛ teaspoon ground allspice', '2 teaspoons white sugar', '2 pounds (1-inch thick) boneless, skin-on center-cut salmon fillets', '1 tablespoon fresh lime juice']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a small bowl, combine the cinnamon, cumin, salt, ginger, mustard, nutmeg, cayenne, allspice, and sugar; set aside.
', 'Step 2: Line a baking sheet with foil, then spray with nonstick cooking spray.
', 'Step 3: Rinse the salmon with cold water and pat dry.
', 'Step 4: Lightly sprinkle the skin with the spice mix, then place the salmon skin-side down on the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 5: Sprinkle the remaining spice mix evenly over the salmon.
', 'Step 6: Allow the salmon to come to room temperature, 30 to 40 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
', 'Step 8: Sprinkle the salmon with lime juice and roast in the oven for 12 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Remove from oven and allow to stand at room temperature for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 10: The salmon will still be rare when removed from the oven, but will continue to cook as it rests.
', 'Step 11: After 15 minutes, wrap the fish tightly with foil and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.
']

Title: Egyptian Koshari
Ingredients: ['¾ cup brown lentils', '4 cups water', '¾ cup uncooked long grain rice', '1 cup elbow macaroni', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '2 large onions, chopped', '4 cloves garlic, minced', '1 (15.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '¼ teaspoon red pepper flakes, or to taste', 'salt and pepper to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine the lentils and water in a large saucepan.
', 'Step 2: Bring to a boil, then simmer over medium heat for 25 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Add the rice to the lentils, and continue to simmer for an additional 20 minutes, or until rice is tender.
', 'Step 4: Fill a separate saucepan with lightly salted water and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 5: Add the macaroni and cook until tender, about 8 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Drain.
', 'Step 7: Meanwhile, heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 8: Add onion and garlic; cook and stir until onion is lightly browned.
', 'Step 9: Pour in the tomatoes and season with red pepper flakes, salt and pepper.
', 'Step 10: Simmer over medium heat for 10 to 20 minutes.

', 'Step 12: Mix in the tomato sauce until evenly coated.

Title: Moroccan Lamb Stew with Apricots
Ingredients: ['2 pounds boneless leg of lamb, cut into 1-inch cubes', '2 teaspoons ground coriander', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon sweet paprika', '½ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '½ teaspoon ground cardamom', '½ teaspoon ground turmeric', '2 teaspoons kosher salt', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '2 cups finely chopped onion', '4 cloves garlic, minced', '1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger root', '2 (3 inch) cinnamon sticks', '2 cups low-sodium chicken stock', '1 cup dried apricots, halved', '2 (3 inch) orange peel strips', '1 tablespoon honey', '¼ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '¼ cup toasted pine nuts']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine lamb, coriander, cumin, paprika, cayenne, cardamom, turmeric, and salt in a large bowl; toss together until lamb is evenly coated.
', 'Step 2: Heat oil in a large Dutch oven or tagine over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Add onions; cook, stirring occasionally until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Stir in garlic, ginger, and cinnamon; cook, stirring frequently, until fragrant, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 5: Add seasoned lamb; cook, stirring frequently until light brown, being careful not to caramelize, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Add chicken stock and bring to a gentle boil over medium heat.
', 'Step 7: Reduce heat to low and simmer, covered, until the lamb is just tender, about 1 hour and 15 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Stir in apricots, orange peels, and honey; continue to simmer over low heat, uncovered, until the liquid has thickened slightly and lamb is fork-tender, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Remove from the heat, discard cinnamon sticks and orange peels.
', 'Step 10: Divide evenly among 4 bowls.
', 'Step 11: Garnish each bowl with a tablespoon each of cilantro and pine nuts.
']

Title: 25-Minute Tunisian Vegetable Couscous
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 red onion, chopped', '1 zucchini, coarsely chopped', '1 yellow squash, coarsely chopped', '1 carrot, coarsely chopped', '1 red bell pepper, coarsely chopped', '1 yellow bell pepper, coarsely chopped', '½ cup sliced baby portabella mushrooms', '4 cups vegetable broth', '½ teaspoon smoked sweet paprika', '¼ teaspoon ground cardamom', '¼ teaspoon salt', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro', '1 (16 ounce) can chickpeas, drained', '2 Roma tomatoes, sliced', '2 cups dry couscous', '1 teaspoon grated orange zest', '1 tablespoon grated Parmesan cheese', '½ teaspoon paprika', '1 tablespoon finely chopped toasted almonds']

['Step 1: Heat oil in large pot over medium-low heat.

', 'Step 3: Stir in the red and yellow peppers and mushrooms; cook another 3 minutes.

', 'Step 11: Fluff couscous with a fork.
', 'Step 12: The couscous should have absorbed about half the cooking liquid.

Title: Algerian Carrots
Ingredients: ['1 ½ cups water', '2 pounds carrots, peeled and sliced', '5 tablespoons olive oil', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '3 cloves cloves garlic, crushed', '½ teaspoon dried thyme leaves', '1 bay leaf', '1 teaspoon lemon juice']

', 'Step 2: Cover, and bring the water to a boil over high heat.
', 'Step 3: Add the sliced carrots, reduce the heat to medium, and cover the pan again.

Title: Moroccan Chicken Tagine with Caramelized Pears
Ingredients: ['7 tablespoons olive oil, divided', '2 onions, peeled and sliced', '1 whole chicken, cut into pieces', '1 teaspoon ground turmeric', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon ground coriander', '1 teaspoon salt', '3 cinnamon sticks', '2 bay leaves, crushed', '1 bunch fresh cilantro, chopped', '2 tablespoons fresh ginger root, peeled and minced', '½ cup water', '2 tablespoons butter', '2 pears, cored and sliced', '2 tablespoons honey']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Heat 2 tablespoon olive oil in a skillet over medium heat and cook onions until softened and browned, 8 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Transfer onions into a tagine.
', 'Step 4: Layer chicken pieces on top of onions.
', 'Step 5: Combine turmeric, cumin, ground coriander, and salt in a small bowl; mix well with remaining 5 tablespoons olive oil.
', 'Step 6: Spread spice mixture onto the chicken pieces.
', 'Step 7: Add cinnamon pieces, bay leaves, ginger, and cilantro.
', 'Step 8: Pour in 1/2 cup of water and cover tagine with a lid.
', 'Step 9: Bake in the preheated oven until chicken is no longer pink at the bone and the juices run clear, about 50 minutes.
', 'Step 10: An instant-read thermometer inserted near the bone should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 11: Melt butter in a skillet over low heat while chicken is cooking.
', 'Step 12: Add sliced pears and honey and cook, while stirring, until honey has caramelized.
', 'Step 13: Remove tagine from the oven and stir in caramelized pears.
', 'Step 14: Return to the oven and cook for an additional 10 minutes.
']

Title: Moroccan Ksra
Ingredients: ['⅞ cup water', '2 ¼ cups bread flour', '¾ cup semolina flour', '1 teaspoon anise seed', '1 ½ teaspoons salt', '½ teaspoon white sugar', '2 teaspoons active dry yeast', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 tablespoon sesame seeds']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the first set of ingredients in the pan of the bread machine in the order recommended by the manufacturer.
', 'Step 2: Select DOUGH cycle; press Start.
', 'Step 3: Do not put the olive oil or sesame seeds in.
', 'Step 4: When the dough cycle signals its end, remove the dough from the machine, and punch down.
', 'Step 5: Divide the dough into two halves, and shape into balls.
', 'Step 6: Flatten the balls to a 3/4 inch thickness.
', 'Step 7: Place them on a lightly floured baking sheet.
', 'Step 8: Cover with towels, and let rise until double in size, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 10: Brush the top of each loaf with olive oil, and sprinkle with sesame seeds if you like.
', 'Step 11: Prick the tops of the loaves all over using a fork.
', 'Step 12: Bake for 20 to 25 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the loaves are golden, and sound hollow when tapped.
', 'Step 13: Serve warm or cool.
']

Title: Jollof Rice with Beef
Ingredients: ['3 tablespoons vegetable oil, divided', '1 onion, diced', '1 tablespoon minced garlic', '1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger root', '2 tablespoons tomato paste', '1 teaspoon cayenne powder', '3 large tomatoes, diced', '¾ cup water', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 pound beef stew meat, cut into bite-size chunks', '4 cups jasmine rice', 'water to cover']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat 2 tablespoons vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Add onion, garlic, and ginger; cook and stir until softened, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Add tomato paste and cayenne pepper; cook, stirring constantly, until dark and fragrant, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Stir in tomatoes, 3/4 cup water, salt, and pepper.
', 'Step 5: Cover and simmer over medium-low heat.
', 'Step 6: Heat remaining 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a separate pot.
', 'Step 7: Season stew meat with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 8: Cook in the hot oil until browned, 1 to 2 minutes per side.
', 'Step 9: Stir meat into the simmering tomato mixture.
', 'Step 10: Add jasmine rice.
', 'Step 11: Pour in enough water to cover the rice.
', 'Step 12: Cover and cook over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until stew meat and rice are tender, about 30 minutes.
']

Title: Eba
Ingredients: ['8 cups water', '4 cups gari (roasted cassava flour)']

Title: Gisela's Butternut Squash Soup
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons butter', '1 onion, finely chopped', '1 (14.5 ounce) can chicken broth', '1 (2 pound) butternut squash - peeled, seeded, and cut into 1-inch cubes', '1 orange, juiced', '1 orange, juiced and zested', '3 tablespoons sour cream', 'salt and pepper to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Melt butter in a large saucepan or soup pot over medium heat, and cook and stir the onion until translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Pour in the chicken broth, and stir in the butternut squash cubes, orange juice, and orange zest.
', 'Step 3: Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer until the squash cubes are tender, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Pour the soup into a blender, filling the pitcher no more than halfway full.
', 'Step 5: Hold down the lid of the blender with a folded kitchen towel, and carefully start the blender, using a few quick pulses to get the soup moving before leaving it on to puree.
', 'Step 6: Puree in batches until smooth and pour back into the pot.
', 'Step 7: Alternately, you can use a stick blender and puree the soup right in the cooking pot.
', 'Step 8: Whisk in sour cream until smooth, and season to taste with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 9: Heat over medium-low heat until almost simmering, and serve hot.
']

Title: Shushumow
Ingredients: ['1 ½ cups all-purpose flour', '⅓ cup canola oil', '1 large egg', '3 tablespoons white sugar', '½ teaspoon baking powder', '¼ teaspoon salt', '¼ cup warm water', '2 cups canola oil for frying', '½ cup white sugar', '¼ cup water', '¼ teaspoon ground cardamom']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix flour, 1/3 cup canola oil, egg, 3 tablespoons sugar, baking powder, and salt together in the bowl of a stand mixer with an paddle attachment.
', 'Step 2: Add 1/4 cup water slowly and mix until a soft dough is formed, 4 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Let dough rest for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Cut dough into about thirty 1-inch pieces.
', 'Step 5: Press each piece onto the back of a fork and curl it out away from you to make the shushumow.
', 'Step 6: Heat 2 cups oil in a deep-fryer or large saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 7: Fry shushumow a few at a time, stirring slowly, until golden brown, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Drain on paper towels.
', 'Step 9: Combine 1/2 cup sugar, 1/4 cup water, and cardamom in a saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 10: Bring to a boil.
', 'Step 11: Reduce heat and let simmer until sugar is dissolved, 1 to 2 minutes more.
', 'Step 12: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 13: Stir in the shushumow gently until coated in the syrup.
', 'Step 14: Transfer shushumow to a plate and let cool.
']

Title: Key Sir Alicha (Ethiopian Beets and Potatoes)
Ingredients: ['¼ cup canola oil', '1 yellow onion, diced', '½ teaspoon salt, divided, or as needed', '1 ½ teaspoons minced fresh garlic', '1 ½ teaspoons minced fresh ginger', '2 large beets, diced', '1 cup water, or more as needed', '4 large potatoes, diced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat; add onion and a pinch of salt.
', 'Step 2: Cook and stir onion until softened and translucent, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Add garlic and ginger; cook and stir until fragrant, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 4: Add beets and stir to combine.
', 'Step 5: Pour water over beet mixture and sprinkle 1/2 teaspoon salt; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 6: Cover pot and reduce heat to medium-low; simmer, stirring occasionally, until beets are easily pierced with a fork, 20 to 25 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Add potatoes and cook until potatoes are soft but not falling apart, about 15 minutes.
']

Title: Egyptian Feta Cheese Omelet Roll
Ingredients: ['4 eggs, beaten', '½ teaspoon black pepper', '3 tablespoons crumbled feta cheese', '1 teaspoon milk', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a small bowl, beat eggs and pepper together.
', 'Step 2: In another small bowl, combine crumbled cheese with milk.
', 'Step 3: Heat oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 4: Pour in eggs, and tilt pan until bottom is evenly covered.
', 'Step 5: When edges appear cooked, place feta mixture in a line in the center of eggs.
', 'Step 6: Using a spatula, fold eggs over top and bottom of cheese, then fold sides over.
']

Title: Cornes de Gazelle (Gazelle Horns)
Ingredients: ['2 ¼ cups almonds', '¾ cup white sugar', '1 tablespoon white sugar', '¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 egg', '1 tablespoon orange blossom water', '2 cups all-purpose flour', '½ cup softened, unsalted butter, diced', '1 tablespoon unsalted butter', '1 pinch salt', '1 egg, beaten', '3 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 ½ tablespoons orange blossom water', '6 tablespoons honey', '1 tablespoon orange blossom water', '3 tablespoons crushed pistachios, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
', 'Step 3: Spread almonds over the baking sheet.
', 'Step 4: Bake in the preheated oven until almonds are fragrant and roasted, 20 to 25 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Prepare pastry dough while almonds are roasting.
', 'Step 6: Combine flour, 1/2 cup plus 1 tablespoon butter, and salt in a bowl and rub together until the mixture resembles breadcrumbs.
', 'Step 7: Add egg, oil, and 1 1/2 tablespoons orange blossom water; knead everything into a smooth pastry dough.
', 'Step 8: Add a little water, 1 teaspoon at a time, if dough is too dry.
', 'Step 9: Shape pastry dough into a ball, wrap in plastic wrap, and set aside for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Remove almonds from oven and cool slightly, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Place almonds in the bowl of a food processor; process until finely and evenly ground.
', 'Step 12: Add 3/4 cup plus 1 tablespoon sugar, cinnamon, egg, and 1 tablespoon orange blossom water in that order to the food processor, pulsing after each addition until mixture is evenly combined and resembles a paste.
', 'Step 13: Remove small walnut-sized portions of filling with greased hands.
', 'Step 14: Roll them into small logs with thin ends.
', 'Step 15: Set aside.
', 'Step 16: Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
', 'Step 17: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
', 'Step 18: Roll out half of the pastry dough on a lightly floured surface until very thin.
', 'Step 19: Place one of the almond paste logs on the edge of the pastry, fold pastry over the filling, covering it completely, and seal the edges.
', 'Step 20: Mold with your fingers into a crescent shape.
', 'Step 21: Using a pastry cutter, cut around the crescent, and transfer to the prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 22: Repeat with remaining dough and filling.
', 'Step 23: Bake in the preheated oven until gazelle horns are lightly golden and baked through, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 24: They should not get too dark.
', 'Step 25: Let cool slightly, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 26: Heat honey in a small saucepan over low-medium heat.
', 'Step 27: Remove from heat and stir in 1 tablespoon orange blossom water.
', 'Step 28: Dip gazelle horns into the honey and place on a serving plate.
', 'Step 29: Sprinkle with crushed pistachios.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '106.5 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '10.6 g', 'cholesterolContent': '12.9 mg', 'fatContent': '6.6 g', 'fiberContent': '0.9 g', 'proteinContent': '2.3 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '1.8 g', 'sodiumContent': '8.5 mg', 'sugarContent': '5.7 g'}

Title: Nigerian Suya
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon finely ground roasted peanuts', '1 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper', '1 teaspoon ground paprika', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground ginger', '½ teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon onion powder', '1 ½ pounds beef tri-tip steak, cut into bite-size pieces', '1 red bell pepper, cut into bite-size pieces', '¼ onion, cut into bite-size pieces', '4 mushrooms, halved']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix ground peanuts, cayenne pepper, paprika, salt, ginger, garlic powder, and onion powder together in a bowl.
', 'Step 2: Combine spice mixture and beef in a resealable plastic bag; shake until well coated.
', 'Step 3: Marinate in the refrigerator, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium-high heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 5: Place beef, bell pepper, onion, and mushrooms in alternating order onto skewers.
', 'Step 6: Cook on the preheated grill, flipping once, until meat is browned and vegetables are soft, 10 to 15 minutes.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '357.7 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '5.4 g', 'cholesterolContent': '158.1 mg', 'fatContent': '15.4 g', 'fiberContent': '1.6 g', 'proteinContent': '47.3 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '5.3 g', 'sodiumContent': '644.3 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.5 g'}

Title: Kachumbari
Ingredients: ['1 medium red onion, diced', '2 teaspoons sea salt', '4 medium tomatoes, diced', '½ medium cucumber, peeled and diced', '¼ cup chopped cilantro', '1 jalapeno pepper, seeded and diced', '1 avocado - peeled, pitted and diced', '1 lime, juiced, or to taste', 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste']

['Step 1: Place the onion in a medium bowl, cover with water, and stir in sea salt.
', 'Step 2: Soak for 30 minutes; drain well for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Stir the drained onion, tomatoes, cucumber, cilantro, jalapeno, and avocado together in a large bowl.
', 'Step 4: Squeeze lime juice over the salad to taste and season with salt and pepper.
']

Title: Moroccan Harira (Bean Soup)
Ingredients: ['6 cups beef stock', '1 cup dry lentils', '1 tablespoon olive oil, or to taste', '1 onion, chopped', '1 cinnamon stick', '1 teaspoon minced fresh ginger root', '1 teaspoon ground turmeric', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 (15 ounce) can garbanzo beans, drained', '1 (15 ounce) can red kidney beans, rinsed and drained', '1 (14 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '1 cup cooked quinoa', '1 bunch flat-leaf parsley leaves and thinner stems, chopped', '1 bunch cilantro leaves and thinner stems, chopped', '1 lemon, or to taste, juiced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Stir beef stock and lentils together in a large pot; bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, and keep at a simmer while preparing onion.
', 'Step 2: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Cook and stir onion, cinnamon stick, ginger, turmeric, cumin, and black pepper in the hot oil until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes; add to stock mixture.
', 'Step 4: Pour garbanzo beans, kidney beans, tomatoes, and quinoa into the stock mixture; stir and bring mixture to a boil.
', 'Step 5: Stir parsley and cilantro into the stock mixture; reduce heat to low and cook mixture at a simmer until the lentils are tender, about 45 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Drizzle lemon juice over the soup before serving.
']

Title: West African Peanut Soup
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '2 medium onions, very finely diced', '2 large bell peppers, (any color) finely chopped', '6 large cloves garlic, minced', '1 (28 ounce) can chopped tomatoes with juice', '8 cups vegetable broth', '¼ teaspoon pepper', '¼ teaspoon red pepper flakes', '½ cup uncooked rice', '1 (18 ounce) jar creamy peanut butter', '½ cup chopped roasted peanuts']

', 'Step 2: Cook onion, bell pepper, and garlic until lightly browned, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Stir in tomatoes with their juice, vegetable broth, pepper, and red pepper flakes.
', 'Step 4: Simmer, uncovered, for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add rice to soup and stir.
', 'Step 6: Reduce heat, cover, and simmer 25 minutes, or until rice is tender.
', 'Step 7: When rice is cooked, whisk in peanut butter and return to a simmer, and serve.
', 'Step 8: Garnish with chopped roasted peanuts, if desired.
']

Title: Vegetarian Moroccan Harira
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 large onion, chopped', '2 pounds tomatoes, diced', '1 (15 ounce) can chickpeas, drained', '1 bunch fresh cilantro, chopped', '1 bunch fresh parsley, chopped', '20 fresh mint leaves, chopped', '1 teaspoon ground paprika', '1 teaspoon ground turmeric', '1 teaspoon ground ginger', '½ teaspoon harissa', '1 pinch saffron threads', '4 cups water, or more to taste', '1 tablespoon all-purpose flour', '1 teaspoon cornstarch', '½ cup cherry tomatoes, halved', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste']

Title: Mahalabia (Egyptian Milk Pudding)
Ingredients: ['2 cups milk', '1 cup heavy cream', '3 tablespoons white sugar', '2 teaspoons vanilla sugar', '4 teaspoons cornstarch, or more as needed', '¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine milk, cream, sugar, vanilla sugar, and cornstarch in a saucepan and whisk until well combined.
', 'Step 2: Slowly bring to a boil over medium heat and cook, stirring constantly, until thickened and mixture coats the back of a spoon, 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 4: Pour pudding into 4 dessert bowls and allow to cool to room temperature, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Refrigerate until chilled, 1 more hour.
', 'Step 6: Sprinkle with cinnamon to serve.
']

Title: Moroccan Preserved Lemons
Ingredients: ['6 organic lemons', '¼ cup kosher salt', '1 cup lukewarm water, or as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Scrub lemons thoroughly under cold running water.
', 'Step 2: Cut each lemon into quarters, but do not cut all the way through the top, so that the lemon still holds together.
', 'Step 3: n Rub lemons generously with salt inside and out and along all the cuts.
', 'Step 4: Place them in a large sterilized jar with a tight-fitting lid.
', 'Step 5: Add lukewarm water to cover; the lemons should be fully immersed.
', 'Step 6: Screw on the lid and let cure for 1 month in a dark, dry, and cool place.
']

Title: Moroccan Tagine
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '2 large onions, peeled and sliced into rings', '2 pounds lamb meat, cut into 1 1/2 inch cubes', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon ground coriander seed', '1 teaspoon ground ginger', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', 'salt to taste', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '4 pears - peeled, cored and cut into 1 1/2 inch chunks', '½ cup golden raisins', '½ cup blanched slivered almonds']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat the oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Fry the onion in the oil until soft.
', 'Step 3: Add the lamb meat to the pan, and fry until just browned on the outside.
', 'Step 4: Season with cumin, coriander, ginger, cinnamon, salt and pepper.
', 'Step 5: Pour just enough water into the pot to cover the meat.
', 'Step 6: Cover, and simmer over low heat for 1 1/2 to 2 hours, until meat is tender and the mixture is stew-like.
', 'Step 7: Displace lid a little after an hour if there appears to be too much liquid.
', 'Step 8: Add the pears, golden raisins and almonds to the stew, and cook for another 5 minutes or so, until the pears are soft.
', 'Step 9: Serve with rice.
']

Title: Stovetop Moroccan Tagine
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '2 skinless, boneless chicken breast halves - cut into chunks', '½ onion, chopped', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '1 small butternut squash, peeled and chopped', '1 (15.5 ounce) can garbanzo beans, drained and rinsed', '1 carrot, peeled and chopped', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes with juice', '1 (14 ounce) can vegetable broth', '1 tablespoon sugar', '1 tablespoon lemon juice', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon ground coriander', '1 dash cayenne pepper']

Title: Spicy African Yam Soup

Title: Hawawshi
Ingredients: ['½ pound ground beef', '2 tomatoes, diced', '1 large onion, diced', '1 green bell pepper, diced', '1 pinch paprika, or to taste', '1 pinch ground coriander, or to taste', '1 pinch ground cinnamon, or to taste', '1 pinch ground nutmeg, or to taste', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '5 pita bread rounds, split', '1 tablespoon corn oil']

['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F (165 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 3: Cook and stir ground beef in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Let cool slightly.
', 'Step 5: Mix beef, tomatoes, onion, bell pepper, paprika, coriander, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, and pepper together in a large bowl.
', 'Step 6: Stuff mixture inside of pita bread rounds.
', 'Step 7: Brush tops with corn oil and wrap each in aluminum foil.
', 'Step 8: Place on a baking sheet.
', 'Step 9: Bake in the preheated oven until toasted and vegetables are softened, about 30 minutes.

Title: Harissa
Ingredients: ['3 ½ ounces large dried red chili peppers', '5 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, or more as desired', '4 large cloves garlic, coarsely chopped', '1 teaspoon caraway seeds', '1 teaspoon cumin seeds', '½ teaspoon coriander seeds', '1 ½ teaspoons salt, or more to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Break up chili peppers, remove the stems and seeds, and discard.
', 'Step 2: Wear disposable gloves if working with medium-hot or hot peppers.
', 'Step 3: Place chili peppers in a heatproof bowl and cover with boiling water.
', 'Step 4: Let soak until softened, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Drain well, then dab dry with paper towels.
', 'Step 6: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a small skillet over very low heat and cook garlic until soft but still pale, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Let cool, then transfer to the food processor together along with the chili peppers.
', 'Step 8: Toast caraway seeds, cumin seeds, and coriander seeds in the skillet over medium-low heat until fragrant, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Crush them in a mortar and add to the food processor.
', 'Step 10: Process while slowly adding remaining olive oil, scraping down the sides of the food processor as needed.
', 'Step 11: Season with salt.
', 'Step 12: Spoon harissa into a sterilized glass jar and level the top.
', "Step 13: Add enough olive oil so the surface is covered and the harissa won't dry out.
", 'Step 14: Seal and refrigerate.
']

Title: Moroccan Potato Casserole

', 'Step 2: Combine garlic, 1/2 teaspoon salt, paprika, cumin, and cayenne in a food processor bowl.

Title: Instant Pot® Moroccan Chicken Tagine
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons minced fresh garlic', '1 ¼ teaspoons paprika', '¾ teaspoon ground ginger', '¾ teaspoon ground turmeric', '⅛ teaspoon saffron powder', '1 ½ pounds skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces', '1 preserved lemon', '2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil', '2 tablespoons butter', '2 medium red onions, sliced', '1 cinnamon stick', '1 cup pitted and halved Mediterranean olives', '1 cup chicken broth', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley', '1 tablespoon chopped fresh cilantro']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine garlic, paprika, ginger, turmeric, and saffron in a large bowl.
', 'Step 2: Add chicken pieces and mix until coated with spices.
', 'Step 3: Cover and refrigerate, 3 to 4 hours or overnight.
', 'Step 4: Cut preserved lemon into quarters.
', 'Step 5: Remove pulp from the peel and remove seeds from pulp.
', 'Step 6: Mince pulp and set aside.
', 'Step 7: Cut lemon peel into strips and set aside.
', 'Step 8: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) and select Saute function.
', 'Step 9: Heat olive oil and butter in the cooker; add chicken.
', 'Step 10: Cook chicken until browned, about 3 minutes per side.
', 'Step 11: Transfer chicken to a plate, reserving drippings in the pot.
', 'Step 12: Place onions and lemon pulp into the hot pot and cook, stirring occasionally, until onions have softened, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Add cinnamon stick, place chicken on top, and scatter olives and lemon peel over the chicken.
', 'Step 14: Pour in chicken broth.
', 'Step 15: Close and lock the lid.
', "Step 16: Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 10 minutes.
", 'Step 17: Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
', "Step 18: Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 10 minutes.
", 'Step 19: Unlock and remove the lid carefully, turning it away from you.
', 'Step 20: Transfer contents to a large serving bowl.
', 'Step 21: Sprinkle with parsley and cilantro and serve immediately.
']

Title: Harissa Paste
Ingredients: ['12 mild to medium hot red chili peppers', '1 teaspoon extra-virgin olive oil', '1 teaspoon caraway seeds', '½ teaspoon coarsely ground cumin seeds', '½ teaspoon coarsely ground coriander', '5 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, or more as desired', '3 large garlic cloves, finely chopped', 'salt to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: n Remove stems from chili peppers and cut them in half.
', 'Step 3: Remove all or some of the seeds if you want a milder harissa.
', 'Step 4: n Heat 1 teaspoon olive oil in a small frying pan over medium heat.
', 'Step 5: Add caraway, cumin, and coriander and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
', "Step 6: Stir so the spices won't burn.
", 'Step 7: n Toss chili peppers, spices, 1/4 cup olive oil, and garlic in a baking dish large enough to fit chili peppers in one layer.
', 'Step 8: n Bake in the preheated oven until chili peppers are very soft but not burned, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 9: Stir a few times to ensure even cooking.
', 'Step 10: Let cool.
', 'Step 11: n Transfer to a food processor and puree until paste-like but still a little chunky.
', 'Step 12: Season with salt.
', 'Step 13: n Spoon into a sterilized glass jar and level the top.
', "Step 14: Add enough olive oil so the surface is covered and the harissa won't dry out.
", 'Step 15: Seal and refrigerate.
']

Title: African Chicken Stew
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 (3 pound) roasting chicken, deboned and cut into bite size pieces', '2 cloves garlic, crushed', '1 onion, chopped', '1 large potato, diced', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon ground coriander seed', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 cup water', '¾ cup unsalted natural-style peanut butter', '1 (15 ounce) can garbanzo beans, drained and rinsed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a large skillet with a tight-fitting lid, heat oil over medium high heat.
', 'Step 2: Add chicken, and brown quickly.
', 'Step 3: Remove chicken from pan.
', 'Step 4: Reduce heat to medium low, and add garlic, onion and potato to the pan; saute for 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Season with cumin, coriander, black pepper, red pepper and salt.
', 'Step 6: Do not let garlic brown.
', 'Step 7: Mix in water and browned chicken, and any accumulated juices.
', 'Step 8: Place lid on skillet and simmer, stirring occasionally, for 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Remove lid, and stir in the peanut butter and garbanzo beans.
', 'Step 10: Make sure the peanut butter is blended in.
', 'Step 11: Replace lid to simmer for 10 more minutes, or until chicken is cooked through and potatoes are tender.
', 'Step 12: Remove from heat, adjust seasoning, and serve.
']

Title: Egyptian Bamia
Ingredients: ['¼ cup olive oil', '1 large onion, finely chopped', '1 pound boneless lamb shoulder, cut into 1-inch pieces', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 (8 ounce) can tomato sauce', '2 cups water, or as needed to cover', '1 (10 ounce) package frozen okra, thawed']

['Step 1: Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat; cook and stir onion until translucent, about 7 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Mix in lamb, salt, and black pepper; cook and stir until lamb is lightly browned, 5 to 10 more minutes.
', 'Step 3: Stir in tomato sauce and water; season with salt and black pepper.
', 'Step 4: Bring lamb mixture to a boil and reduce heat to low.
', 'Step 5: Simmer lamb in sauce until very tender, at least 1 hour, adding more water as needed.
', 'Step 6: Stir occasionally.
', 'Step 7: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 8: Stir okra into lamb mixture, adding more water if necessary, and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 9: Spoon the bamia into a 2-quart baking dish and adjust salt and black pepper; cover dish with foil.
', 'Step 10: Bake in the preheated oven until okra is tender, about 45 minutes; uncover for last 10 minutes of baking.
']

Title: African Cabbage Stew
Ingredients: ['1 large head cabbage, diced', '¼ cup canola oil', '1 onion, diced', '2 teaspoons minced garlic', '4 roma (plum) tomatoes, diced', '1 cup water', '1 (6 ounce) can tomato paste', '1 (15 ounce) can mackerel in tomato sauce', '1 pinch red pepper flakes, or to taste', '1 pinch seasoned salt, or to taste']

Title: Ethiopian Cabbage and Potato Dish (Atkilt)
Ingredients: ['⅓ cup olive oil', '4 carrots, sliced', '1 onion, thinly sliced', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 teaspoon ground turmeric', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '½ teaspoon ground ginger', '1 small head cabbage, sliced', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '4 small yellow potatoes, cut into bite-size cubes', '¼ cup water']

Title: Moroccan Beef and Lentil Stew
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '2 carrot, (7-1/2")s carrots, chopped', '1 celery stalk, chopped', '1 onion, chopped', '4 cloves garlic, minced', '1 ½ pounds chuck roast, cut into 1-inch cubes', '1 teaspoon salt, or to taste', '1 teaspoon ground turmeric', '1 teaspoon onion powder', '1 teaspoon garlic powder', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '½ teaspoon ground ginger', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon ground coriander', '¼ teaspoon ground allspice', '3 tablespoons tomato paste', '4 cups low-sodium beef broth', '1 tablespoon molasses', '2 leaf (blank)s bay leaves', '1 cup dried red lentils', '½ cup dried apricots, chopped', '½ lemon, juiced']

['Step 1: Heat oil over medium heat in a Dutch oven.
', 'Step 2: Add carrots, celery, and onion; cook until slightly softened, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Stir in garlic and cook for 1 minute.
', 'Step 4: Add beef.
', 'Step 5: Sprinkle salt, turmeric, onion powder, garlic powder, pepper, cinnamon, ginger, cumin, coriander, and allspice over beef and vegetables.
', 'Step 6: Stir to mix.

', 'Step 8: Stir in tomato paste until well combined and cook for 1 minute.
', 'Step 9: Add in beef broth, molasses, and bay leaves.
', 'Step 10: Bring stew to a simmer.
', 'Step 11: Reduce heat to low, cover, and cook, stirring occasionally, until beef is tender, about 50 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Mix in lentils and dried apricots.

', 'Step 14: Cover and continue to cook on low, stirring occasionally, until lentils soften, about 15 minutes.
