Title: Somali Spaghetti Sauce
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons chopped fresh cilantro', '4 cloves garlic', '1 teaspoon cumin seeds', '1 teaspoon Himalayan pink salt', '1 teaspoon ground turmeric', '1 teaspoon paprika', '1 teaspoon Italian seasoning', '1 teaspoon salt-free seasoning blend (such as Mrs. Dash®)', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '¼ cup olive oil', '1 pound lean ground beef', '1 onion, diced', '1 large potato, peeled and cubed', '2 carrots, diced', '2 (14 ounce) cans diced tomatoes', '2 tablespoons water, or to taste', '1 (16 ounce) package angel hair pasta']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place cilantro and garlic in a food processor; pulse until finely chopped.
', 'Step 2: Toast cumin seeds in a small pot over low heat until fragrant, 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Allow to cool, 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Grind into a powder.
', 'Step 5: Transfer ground cumin to a small bowl.
', 'Step 6: Add Himalayan pink salt, turmeric, paprika, Italian seasoning, seasoning blend, and black pepper to make seasoning mix.

', 'Step 8: Add ground beef; cook and stir until browned, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Stir in 1/2 of the seasoning mix.
', 'Step 10: Add onion; cook and stir until softened, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Add potato and carrots.
', 'Step 12: Cook, covered, stirring occasionally, until slightly softened, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Stir tomatoes into the pot and bring sauce to a boil.
', 'Step 14: Reduce heat to medium-low; stir in cilantro-garlic mixture and remaining 1/2 of the seasoning mix.
', 'Step 15: Simmer, stirring occasionally, until flavors combine, 30 to 40 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Thin sauce with water if it seems too thick.
', 'Step 17: Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil.
', 'Step 18: Cook angel hair in the boiling water, stirring occasionally until tender yet firm to the bite, 4 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 19: Drain.
', 'Step 20: Serve sauce over pasta.
']

Title: Ginger Malva Pudding

Title: Upside Down (Maqluba)
Ingredients: ['7 cups water', '2 onions, chopped', '1 tablespoon chopped garlic', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 teaspoon ground turmeric', '2 teaspoons garam masala', '1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste', '2 cups cooking oil', '2 cups lamb meat, cut into small pieces', '1 large eggplant, cut into 3/4-inch slices', '2 zucchini, cut into 1/4-inch slices', '1 cup broccoli', '1 cup cauliflower', '1 ½ cups jasmine rice', '1 (16 ounce) container plain yogurt']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Bring to a boil the water, onion, garlic, cinnamon, turmeric, garam masala, salt, and pepper in a large pot.
', 'Step 2: Add the lamb; reduce the heat to low and simmer 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Separate the lamb from the liquid and set aside.
', 'Step 4: Transfer the liquid to a bowl.
', 'Step 5: While the lamb mixture simmers, heat the oil in a large, deep skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 6: Fry the eggplant slices in the hot oil, assuring the pieces do not touch, until brown on both sides; remove to a plate lined with paper towels to drain.
', 'Step 7: Use the same procedure to fry the zucchini and the cauliflower.
', 'Step 8: Cook the broccoli in the oil until hot and remove to a paper towel-lined plate to drain.
', 'Step 9: Layer the lamb into the bottom of the large pot.
', 'Step 10: Arrange the eggplant, zucchini, broccoli, and cauliflower on top of the lamb in layers.
', 'Step 11: Pour the rice over the meat and vegetables, shaking the pot gently to allow the rice to settle into the dish.
', 'Step 12: Pour the reserved cooking liquid from the lamb over the mixture until it is completely covered.
', 'Step 13: Add water if needed.
', 'Step 14: Cover the pot and simmer over low heat until the rice is soft and the liquid is absorbed, 30 to 45 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Remove the lid from the pot.
', 'Step 16: Place a large platter over the pot and flip the pot so the dish is "upside down" on the platter.
', 'Step 17: Serve with yogurt on the side.
']

Title: Moroccan Chicken Tagine
Ingredients: ['¼ cup ground cinnamon', '¼ cup ground cumin', '2 tablespoons ground turmeric', '2 tablespoons ground coriander', '2 tablespoons ground ginger', '2 tablespoons crushed dried mint', '1 tablespoon salt', '2 teaspoons ground black pepper', '½ cup chopped dried apricots', '¼ cup raisins', '¼ cup olive oil, or as needed', '4 bone-in chicken thighs', '½ small onion, minced', '2 teaspoons chopped garlic', '1 cup chicken broth', '¼ cup honey', '½ bunch fresh cilantro, chopped', '¼ cup toasted sliced almonds']

['Step 1: Mix cinnamon, cumin, turmeric, coriander, ginger, mint, salt, and pepper together in a bowl.

', 'Step 3: Bring a small pot of water to a boil; add apricots and raisins.
', 'Step 4: Cook until fruit is soft, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Drain, reserving 1/2 cup of cooking water.
', 'Step 6: Pour enough olive oil into a large skillet or Dutch oven to coat the bottom; turn heat to medium.

Title: Vegan African Peanut Stew in the Instant Pot®
Ingredients: ['1 ½ teaspoons ground cumin', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '¼ teaspoon dried red chile flakes', '⅛ teaspoon ground cloves', '1 teaspoon salt', '2 medium sweet potato, cut into 1/2-inch pieces', '1 cup diced yellow onion', '½ cup diced red bell pepper', '4 garlic cloves, minced', '1 (3 inch) piece ginger root, peeled and minced', '1 (28 ounce) can crushed tomatoes', '½ cup peanut butter', '2 cups water', '3 cups chopped collard greens', 'chopped cilantro, or to taste', 'chopped peanuts, or to taste']

Title: African Sweet Potato Stew

Title: Koshary
Ingredients: ['1 (14.5 ounce) can chickpeas (garbanzo beans), drained and rinsed', '¼ cup red wine vinegar', '1 teaspoon ground coriander', '1 teaspoon ground cayenne pepper', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '½ (16 ounce) package ditalini pasta', '1 ½ cups short-grain rice, rinsed', 'cold water, to cover', '1 ½ cups dark brown lentils', 'water to cover', '1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 yellow onion, minced', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '1 (14 ounce) can crushed tomatoes', '1 tablespoon butter', '3 cups chicken stock', '1 (3 ounce) can French-fried onions']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine the chickpeas, vinegar, coriander, cayenne pepper, and cumin in a resealable bag or container with a tight-fitting lid.
', 'Step 2: Store in refrigerator while prepping remainder of dish, shaking occasionally.
', 'Step 3: Bring a pot of lightly salted water to a rolling boil.
', 'Step 4: Cook the ditalani pasta in the boiling water until cooked through yet firm to the bite, about 8 minutes; drain and set aside.
', 'Step 5: Combine the rice with enough cold water to cover; allow to soak for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Drain.
', 'Step 7: Meanwhile, combine the lentils with enough water to cover in a pot; season with salt and pepper.
', 'Step 8: Bring the lentils to a boil and cook at a boil until tender, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Drain.
', 'Step 10: Heat the olive oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat; cook and stir the onion and garlic in the hot oil until translucent, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Add the crushed tomatoes, season with salt and pepper, reduce heat to medium-low, and maintain at a simmer while preparing remainder of dish.
', 'Step 12: Melt the butter in a pot over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 13: Add the rice to the butter, increase heat to high, and fry for 4 to 5 minutes, stirring constantly.
', 'Step 14: Pour the chicken stock over the rice; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 15: Season the rice mixture with salt and pepper, reduce heat to low, cover the pot, and cook until rice is tender, and the liquid has been absorbed, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Mix the rice and lentils together on a large serving platter.
', 'Step 17: Spread the cooked ditalani over the rice and lentil mixture.
', 'Step 18: Serve with the marinated chickpeas, the tomato sauce, and the French-fried onions as condiments.
']

Title: West African-Style Peanut Stew with Chicken
Ingredients: ['1 ½ pounds boneless, skinless chicken breasts, cut into 1-inch pieces', '1 teaspoon salt, divided', '¼ teaspoon ground black pepper', '3 tablespoons peanut oil, divided', '2 cups diced onion', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '2 tablespoons minced fresh ginger root', '1 teaspoon ground coriander', '½ teaspoon ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon ground turmeric', '¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '4 cups low-sodium chicken broth', '1 (14.5 ounce) can no-salt-added diced tomatoes with juices', '1 large sweet potato, peeled and cut into 1-inch cubes', '½ bunch collard greens, tough ribs removed and leaves chopped', '2 red bell peppers, seeded and chopped', '⅓ cup natural peanut butter', '6 tablespoons chopped peanuts']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Season chicken with 1/2 teaspoon salt and the black pepper.
', 'Step 2: Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 3: Add half the chicken; cook until no longer pink, 2 to 3 minutes, then transfer to a plate.
', 'Step 4: Repeat with 1 tablespoon oil and remaining chicken.
', 'Step 5: Add remaining 1 tablespoon oil to the pot and reduce heat to medium.
', 'Step 6: Add onion; cook until softened, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Add garlic, ginger, coriander, cumin, turmeric, cinnamon, and remaining 1/2 teaspoon salt; cook, stirring, 30 seconds.
', 'Step 8: Stir in broth, tomatoes, sweet potato, collard greens, and red bell peppers; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 9: Reduce heat to medium-low; simmer, partially covered, until vegetables are tender, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Return chicken and accumulated juices to the pot.
', 'Step 11: Return to a boil, then stir in peanut butter; simmer until incorporated and chicken is cooked through, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Garnish with chopped peanuts.
']

Title: Injera
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon active dry yeast', '1 teaspoon honey', '5 cups warm water (110 degrees F/45 degrees C)', '3 cups finely ground millet flour', '¼ teaspoon baking soda']

['Step 1: Dissolve yeast and honey in 1/4 cup of the water.
', 'Step 2: Allow to proof and add the remainder of the water and the millet flour.
', 'Step 3: Stir until smooth and then cover.
', 'Step 4: Allow to stand at room temperature for 24 hours.
', 'Step 5: Stir the batter well and mix in the baking soda.
', 'Step 6: Heat a large non-stick skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 7: Pour about 1/3 cup of the batter into the pan in a spiral pattern to cover the bottom of the pan evenly.
', 'Step 8: Tilt the pan to quickly even out the batter.
', 'Step 9: Cover the pan and allow to cook for about 1 minute.
', 'Step 10: The bread should not brown but rather rise slightly and very easy to remove.
', 'Step 11: It is cooked only on one side.
', 'Step 12: This top should be slightly moist.
', 'Step 13: Remove to a platter and cool.
', 'Step 14: Stack the cooked breads on a plate.
']

Title: Moroccan Meat Cigars
Ingredients: ['1 teaspoon olive oil', '½ pound lean ground beef', '½ cup canned crushed tomatoes, drained', '¼ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '¼ teaspoon ground cumin', '⅛ teaspoon paprika', '⅛ teaspoon ground allspice', '1 (16 ounce) package phyllo dough', 'cooking oil spray']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Lightly grease a baking sheet.
', 'Step 3: Heat olive oil in skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 4: Cook ground beef until it loses its pink color and begins to brown.
', 'Step 5: Drain fat from skillet.
', 'Step 6: Add tomatoes, cinnamon, cumin, paprika and allspice.
', 'Step 7: Reduce heat to medium and simmer until mixture reduces slightly, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Remove one phyllo sheet from package and keep the rest covered with a clean cloth until ready to use.
', 'Step 9: On a flat work surface, cut the phyllo sheet into 2 14x9-inch rectangles.
', 'Step 10: Spray the first half-sheet with cooking spray, place the 2nd half on top of it and spray again with oil.
', 'Step 11: Place a generous teaspoon of the meat mixture near the narrow end of the dough.
', 'Step 12: Fold dough over the top of the meat, fold in the sides of the dough, and roll into a narrow tube (cigar) shape.
', 'Step 13: Repeat until all the meat has been rolled up.
', 'Step 14: Arrange cigars on prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 15: Bake in preheated oven until lightly browned, about 25 minutes.
']

Title: Ethiopian Firfir with Dried Beef (Quanta Firfir)

Title: Moroccan Lentil Soup with Veggies

Title: Instant Pot® Chicken Tagine with Butternut Squash and Spinach
Ingredients: ['4 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided', '3 ½ teaspoons kosher salt, divided', '2 teaspoons ground cinnamon', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '2 teaspoons sweet paprika', '1 teaspoon ground coriander', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 ½ pounds skinless, boneless chicken thighs, trimmed and cut into 1 1/2-inch pieces', '1 large yellow onion, thinly sliced lengthwise', '4 cloves garlic, smashed', '4 teaspoons finely grated fresh ginger', '2 ½ cups water', '2 cups peeled and cubed (3/4-inch) butternut squash', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes in juice', '1 (5 ounce) package baby spinach leaves', '3 tablespoons lemon juice', '2 teaspoons lemon zest', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Stir 2 tablespoons oil, 2 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt, cinnamon, cumin, paprika, coriander, and 1/2 teaspoon black pepper together in a small bowl to form a paste.
', 'Step 2: Toss 1 tablespoon paste with chicken in a medium bowl.
', 'Step 3: Turn on a multi-functional pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot®) and select Saute function.
', 'Step 4: Heat remaining oil until shimmering, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 5: Add onion and 1 teaspoon kosher salt; cook, stirring occasionally, until softened, about 6 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Stir in remaining spice paste, garlic, and ginger.
', 'Step 7: Cook, stirring constantly, until fragrant, 30 seconds to 1 minute.
', 'Step 8: Stir in water, scraping up any browned bits from the bottom using a wooden spoon.
', 'Step 9: Add butternut squash, tomatoes with their juices, and chicken; stir to combine, then distribute mixture in an even layer.
', 'Step 10: Close and lock the lid and move the pressure valve to sealing.
', "Step 11: Select high pressure according to manufacturer's instructions; set timer for 3 minutes.
", 'Step 12: Allow 10 to 15 minutes for pressure to build.
', "Step 13: Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions for 10 minutes.
", "Step 14: Release remaining pressure carefully using the quick-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 5 minutes.
", 'Step 15: Unlock and remove the lid.
', 'Step 16: Stir spinach into the pot and cover without locking the lid into place.
', 'Step 17: Let stand until spinach wilts, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 18: Stir in lemon juice and zest; taste, and season with salt and pepper.
']

Title: Doro Wat: Ethiopian Chicken Dish
Ingredients: ['1 cup butter, divided', '1 onion, chopped', '2 ½ cups water, divided', '1 (6 ounce) can tomato paste', '¾ cup berbere seasoning', '1 teaspoon chopped garlic', '½ teaspoon ground ginger', '4 skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cubed', '⅓ cup sweet white wine', '½ teaspoon ground cardamom', '½ teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '4 hard-boiled eggs']

Title: Milk Tart
Ingredients: ['½ cup butter, softened', '1 cup white sugar', '1 egg', '2 cups all-purpose flour', '2 teaspoons baking powder', '1 pinch salt', '4 cups milk', '1 teaspoon vanilla extract', '1 tablespoon butter', '2 ½ tablespoons all-purpose flour', '2 ½ tablespoons cornstarch', '½ cup white sugar', '2 eggs, beaten', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: In a medium mixing bowl, cream together 1/2 cup butter or margarine and 1 cup sugar.

', 'Step 5: Stir flour mixture into sugar mixture just until ingredients are thoroughly combined.
', 'Step 6: Press mixture into bottom and sides of two 9-inch pie pans.

', 'Step 15: Pour half of mixture into each pastry shell.
', 'Step 16: Sprinkle with cinnamon.
', 'Step 17: Chill before serving.
']

Title: Middle Eastern White Beans
Ingredients: ['1 ½ cups dried white kidney beans, soaked overnight', '3 tablespoons tomato paste', '1 tablespoon red pimento sauce', '3 cloves garlic, chopped', '3 medium onions, chopped', '1 tablespoon lemon juice', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '2 tablespoons olive oil', 'salt and pepper to taste', '1 (14.5 ounce) can beef broth']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a slow cooker combine the beans, tomato paste, pimento sauce, garlic, onions, cumin, lemon juice, olive oil, salt and pepper.
', 'Step 2: Mix until the beans are coated.
', 'Step 3: Pour in beef broth, and top off with enough water to completely cover the beans.
', 'Step 4: Cover, and cook on High for 6 hours, or until the beans are tender and the liquid is thickened.
', 'Step 5: It should not be soupy.
']

Title: Injera (Ethiopian Teff Bread)
Ingredients: ['½ cup white teff flour', '¼ cup brown teff flour', '3 tablespoons white teff flour, divided, or as needed', '1 cup water', '3 tablespoons water, divided, or as needed', '1 teaspoon vegetable oil']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix 1/2 cup white teff flour and brown teff flour together in a bowl.
', 'Step 2: Add 1 cup water and whisk well.
', 'Step 3: Pour mixture into a glass container large enough to hold 3 times the original volume.
', 'Step 4: Cover with cheesecloth or other breathable fabric to keep out dust; do not seal with plastic wrap as air circulation is vital.
', 'Step 5: Leave covered container in a draft-free environment; the mixture needs air to be circulated in order to ferment.
', 'Step 6: Stir batter 2 times over 24 hours.
', 'Step 7: Check for bubbles and possibly an increase in volume after 24 hours; there may also be a slightly tangy and sour smell.
', 'Step 8: When you notice these things, add 1 tablespoon white teff flour and 1 tablespoon water to the batter and whisk well.
', 'Step 9: Check in a few hours to see if bubbles have again formed, mixture has increased in volume, and the pungent smell is still evident; if so, the batter is ready and you can skip to the cooking process (step 5).
', 'Step 10: Leave batter to rest another 12 hours if the mixture has not begun to form or smell sour after the first 24 hours; stir once during this time.
', 'Step 11: Check to see if bubbles have formed, mixture has increased in volume, and a pungent smell is evident; if so, proceed with step 4.
', 'Step 12: Mix together 2 tablespoons white teff flour and 2 tablespoons water in a bowl, making sure there are no lumps.
', 'Step 13: Add mixture to the batter, whisking well.
', 'Step 14: Wait a few hours; batter should be bubbly with a noticeable increase in volume and a pungent but fragrant smell, indicating it is ready to be cooked.
', 'Step 15: Heat an 8-inch crepe pan or nonstick skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 16: Add oil.
', 'Step 17: Pour a scant 1/2 cup batter slowly and steadily into the hot pan in a circular motion from outside to inside.
', 'Step 18: Cover the pan completely in a spiral without swirling.
', 'Step 19: Cover, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook, allowing steam to cook the top of the bread, 1 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 20: Remove from pan with spatula and transfer to a plate; cover to keep warm.
', 'Step 21: Repeat with remaining batter.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '225.3 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '41.1 g', 'fatContent': '3.8 g', 'fiberContent': '7.7 g', 'proteinContent': '6.9 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '0.4 g', 'sodiumContent': '13.9 mg'}

Title: Egyptian Lentil Soup
Ingredients: ['3 cups water', '1 cup red lentils', '1 roma tomato, quartered', '1 carrot, quartered', '1 small onion, quartered', '4 cloves garlic, quartered', '¼ cube chicken bouillon (such as Maggi®)', '1 cup water', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '½ teaspoon sea salt', '½ teaspoon cracked black pepper', '¼ teaspoon ground coriander']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place 3 cups water, lentils, tomato, carrot, onion, garlic, and chicken bouillon in a stockpot over medium heat; cook until vegetables and lentils are softened, 20 to 25 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Remove from heat and cool to lukewarm.
', 'Step 3: Blend vegetable and lentil mixture with an immersion blender until smooth.
', 'Step 4: Stir 1 cup water, cumin, sea salt, pepper, and coriander into soup; heat over medium heat until warmed.
']

Title: Chapati (East African Bread)
Ingredients: ['2 cups all-purpose flour, sifted', '1 teaspoon salt', '¾ cup warm water, or as needed', '1 teaspoon vegetable oil', '2 teaspoons all-purpose flour, or as needed', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Mix 2 cups flour and salt together in a bowl.
', 'Step 2: Slowly mix in enough water to make a thick dough.
', 'Step 3: Mix in oil until combined.
', 'Step 4: Knead dough on a cool surface for a few minutes, adding a few spoonfuls of flour.
', 'Step 5: Return dough to the bowl, cover with a clean cloth, and let rest for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Preheat the oven to 200 degrees F (95 degrees C).
', 'Step 7: Heat a skillet or griddle over medium heat.
', 'Step 8: Divide dough into orange-sized balls.
', 'Step 9: Flatten into 6-inch circles.
', 'Step 10: Fry in batches in the hot skillet, turning once, until golden brown and spotted, 6 to 8 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Repeat with remaining dough.
', 'Step 12: Keep chapatis warm in the oven.
']

Title: South African Yellow Rice
Ingredients: ['1 cup long grain white rice', '½ teaspoon salt', '1 ½ teaspoons ground turmeric', '3 tablespoons white sugar', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '½ cup black raisins', '1 tablespoon butter', '2 ½ cups water']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In a saucepan, combine the rice, salt, turmeric, sugar, cinnamon, raisins, butter and water.
', 'Step 2: Bring to a boil uncovered.
', 'Step 3: When it comes to a boil, reduce the heat to low, cover and let it simmer for 20 to 30 minutes, or until rice is fluffy and water has been absorbed.
', 'Step 4: Remove from the heat and fluff with a fork.
', 'Step 5: Keep warm until serving time.
']

Title: African Sweet Potato and Peanut Soup
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 large onion, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '2 teaspoons minced fresh ginger root', '1 ½ teaspoons ground cumin', '1 ½ teaspoons ground coriander', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 pinch ground cloves', '3 medium tomatoes, chopped', '1 ½ pounds sweet potatoes, peeled and chopped', '1 carrot, peeled and chopped', '4 ½ cups water', '1 teaspoon salt', '¼ cup chopped, unsalted dry-roasted peanuts', '1 pinch cayenne pepper', '2 tablespoons creamy peanut butter', '1 bunch chopped fresh cilantro']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat the oil in a large saucepan over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Saute the onion 10 minutes, until lightly browned.
', 'Step 3: Mix in the garlic, ginger, cumin, coriander, cinnamon, and cloves.
', 'Step 4: Stir in the tomatoes, sweet potatoes, and carrot, and continue to cook and stir about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Pour water into the saucepan, and season the mixture with salt.
', 'Step 6: Bring to a boil, reduce heat, and simmer 30 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Remove the soup mixture from heat.
', 'Step 8: In a food processor or blender, blend the soup and peanuts until almost smooth.
', 'Step 9: Season with cayenne pepper.
', 'Step 10: Return to the saucepan.
', 'Step 11: Whisk in the peanut butter, and cook until heated through.
', 'Step 12: Serve warm topped with fresh cilantro.
']

Title: South African Sugar Bean Soup
Ingredients: ['2 ½ cups speckled sugar beans', 'water to cover', '2 pounds bone-in beef chuck, cut into chunks', '4 large onions, thickly sliced', '1 cube beef bouillon', '2 ½ tablespoons hot water', '¾ cup red wine', '¼ cup tomato paste', '1 packet dry oxtail soup mix', '3 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce', '2 tablespoons soy sauce', '1 pinch cayenne pepper']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place sugar beans into a large container and cover with several inches of cool water; let soak, 8 hours to overnight.
', 'Step 2: Combine beef chuck and onions in a large pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Cook until beef is tender and falling off the bone, about 1 1/2 hour.
', 'Step 4: Transfer beef to a cutting board; discard bones and cut beef into bite-size pieces.
', 'Step 5: Place onions in a bowl.
', 'Step 6: Pour sugar beans and their soaking water into the pot.
', 'Step 7: Bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer, adding more water if needed, until beans are tender, about 1 hour.
', 'Step 8: Stir in beef pieces and onions; bring soup to a boil.
', 'Step 9: Dissolve beef bouillon cube in 2 1/2 tablespoons hot water in a bowl.
', 'Step 10: Stir in wine, tomato paste, dry soup mix, Worcestershire sauce, soy sauce, and cayenne pepper.
', 'Step 11: Gradually mix into the boiling soup.
', 'Step 12: Reduce heat and simmer until flavors combine, about 10 minutes.
']

Title: Malian Ginger Juice
Ingredients: ['⅓ pound fresh unpeeled ginger root, cut into 1/2-inch chunks', '1 ½ cups water, or as needed to cover', '4 large lemons, juiced', '1 cup white sugar', '7 cups water, or as needed', '16 leaves fresh mint, crushed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place ginger into a blender, cover with 1 1/2 cup water, and blend until ginger is thick and pasty.
', 'Step 2: Strain and squeeze juice from ginger pulp into a 2-quart pitcher, squeezing ginger mixture as dry as possible.
', 'Step 3: n Stir lemon juice and sugar into ginger juice until sugar has dissolved.
', 'Step 4: Pour 7 cups water into mixture, stir to combine, and serve garnished with crushed mint leaves.
']

Title: Make-Ahead Moroccan Lamb Stew
Ingredients: ['1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '½ teaspoon ground ginger', '¼ teaspoon ground cloves', '¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg', '¼ teaspoon ground turmeric', '⅛ teaspoon curry powder', '1 teaspoon kosher salt', '1 pound ground lamb', '1 tablespoon butter', '1 sweet onion, chopped', '1 (14.5 ounce) can organic beef broth', '1 (14.5 ounce) can organic chicken broth', '2 (14.5 ounce) cans beef consomme', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes, undrained', '1 tablespoon honey', '3 large carrots, chopped', '2 sweet potatoes, peeled and diced', '1 (15 ounce) can garbanzo beans, drained and rinsed', '½ cup chopped dried apricots', '1 cup dried lentils, rinsed', 'ground black pepper, to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine cinnamon, cumin, ginger, cloves, nutmeg, turmeric, curry powder, and salt in a large bowl.
', 'Step 2: Mix in the ground lamb.
', 'Step 3: For most flavorful results, allow mixture to rest, refrigerated, overnight.
', 'Step 4: Melt butter in a large pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 5: Cook the onion in the butter until soft and just beginning to brown, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Mix the spiced lamb mixture to the onions.
', 'Step 7: Cook and stir until meat is browned, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Pour the beef broth, chicken broth, and consomme into the pot.
', 'Step 9: Stir in the tomatoes, honey, carrots, sweet potatoes, garbanzo beans, dried apricots and lentils.
', 'Step 10: Bring to boil; reduce heat to low.
', 'Step 11: Simmer stew for 30 minutes or until the vegetables and lentils are cooked and tender.
', 'Step 12: Season with black pepper to taste.
']

Title: Moroccan Shabbat Fish
Ingredients: ['1 red bell pepper, cut into thin strips', '3 tomatoes, sliced', '6 (6 ounce) tilapia fillets', '2 tablespoons paprika', '1 tablespoon chicken bouillon granules', '1 teaspoon cayenne pepper', 'salt and pepper to taste', '¼ cup olive oil', '1 cup water', '¼ cup chopped fresh parsley']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat an oven to 200 degrees F (95 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Layer the sliced red peppers and sliced tomatoes in the bottom of a baking dish.
', 'Step 3: Arrange the tilapia fillets on top of the vegetables.
', 'Step 4: Combine the paprika, chicken bouillon, cayenne, salt, pepper, olive oil, and water and mix well.
', 'Step 5: Pour the seasoning mixture over the fish.
', 'Step 6: Sprinkle with parsley.
', 'Step 7: Cover the baking dish with aluminum foil and bake in the preheated oven until the fish flakes easily with a fork and the vegetables are tender, about 1 hour.
']

Title: Sweet and Nutty Moroccan Couscous
Ingredients: ['2 cups vegetable broth', '5 tablespoons unsalted butter', '⅓ cup chopped dates', '⅓ cup chopped dried apricots', '⅓ cup golden raisins', '2 cups dry couscous', '3 teaspoons ground cinnamon', '½ cup slivered almonds, toasted']

', 'Step 2: Add the butter, apricots, dates and raisins.
', 'Step 3: Boil for 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Remove from the heat, and stir in the couscous.
', 'Step 5: Cover, and let stand for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Stir in the cinnamon and toasted almonds, and serve.
']

Title: Moroccan Chicken with Saffron and Preserved Lemon
Ingredients: ['¼ cup olive oil, or to taste', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '1 teaspoon ground turmeric', '1 teaspoon cumin seeds', 'salt and ground black pepper to taste', '4 large chicken thighs', '2 tablespoons olive oil, or as needed', '1 white onion, chopped', '2 cups water, or as needed', '16 saffron threads', '½ preserved lemon, pulp discarded and thinly sliced', '¼ cup olives, or to taste', '2 artichoke bottoms, chopped', '¼ cup coarsely chopped parsley']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Whisk 1/4 cup olive oil, garlic, turmeric, cumin seeds, salt, and pepper together in a bowl and pour into a resealable plastic bag or container.
', 'Step 2: Add chicken, coat with the paste and seal bag or container.
', 'Step 3: Marinate in the refrigerator, 4 hours to overnight.
', 'Step 4: Heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large stockpot over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 5: Add onion; cook and stir until soft and translucent, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Remove chicken from marinade, discarding marinade.
', 'Step 7: Add chicken thighs skin-side down to stockpot and cook until browned, about 4 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Flip chicken thighs and cook until browned on second side, about 3 minutes more.
', 'Step 9: Lower heat to medium and add water to cover chicken halfway, cover stockpot, and cook for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Uncover stockpot, sprinkle saffron threads onto chicken, and top with preserved lemon slices.
', 'Step 11: Replace cover and cook until chicken is no longer pink at the bone and juices run clear, about 5 minutes more.
', 'Step 12: An instant-read thermometer inserted near the bone should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 13: Uncover stockpot and transfer chicken to a serving platter.
', 'Step 14: Continue simmering liquid in stockpot until thickened to sauce consistency, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Spoon sauce over chicken; top with olives, artichokes, and parsley.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '481.6 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '7.2 g', 'cholesterolContent': '95.6 mg', 'fatContent': '38.2 g', 'fiberContent': '1.7 g', 'proteinContent': '27.5 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '7.6 g', 'sodiumContent': '1787 mg', 'sugarContent': '1.6 g'}

Title: African-Style Oxtail Stew
Ingredients: ['1 cup chopped celery', '1 teaspoon minced garlic', '1 (6 ounce) can tomato paste', '2 cubes beef bouillon', '10 cups water', '6 whole black peppercorns', '2 bay leaves', '¼ cup canola oil', '3 pounds beef oxtail, cut into pieces', '1 large onion, chopped', 'salt and pepper to taste', '1 (12 ounce) can kidney beans, drained', '¼ cup cornstarch dissolved in', '½ cup water']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place celery, garlic, tomato paste, bouillon cubes, and water into a large Dutch oven; stir until the tomato paste has dissolved.
', 'Step 2: Add peppercorns and bay leaves, place over medium heat and bring to a simmer.
', 'Step 3: Meanwhile, heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 4: Add oxtail and cook until browned on all sides, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Remove oxtail from hot oil and place into Dutch oven.
', 'Step 6: Pour out all but 1 tablespoon of oil from the skillet, reduce heat to medium, and cook the onion until softened and translucent, about 5 minutes; add to oxtail.
', 'Step 7: Reduce heat to medium-low, cover, and simmer for 2 1/2 hours.
', 'Step 8: Season with salt and pepper, recover, and continue to cook until the oxtail is tender, but not falling off of the bone, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Remove oxtail pieces and place into a serving dish.
', 'Step 10: Add kidney beans to Dutch oven and return to a simmer.
', 'Step 11: Thicken with cornstarch dissolved in water, simmer for 1 minute until thickened and clear.
', 'Step 12: Pour sauce over the oxtail.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '669 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '22.7 g', 'cholesterolContent': '249.7 mg', 'fatContent': '31.8 g', 'fiberContent': '5.6 g', 'proteinContent': '74.2 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '12.9 g', 'sodiumContent': '1091.6 mg', 'sugarContent': '5 g'}

Title: Beghrir (Moroccan Pancakes)
Ingredients: ['1 cup warm water (115 degrees F/46 degrees C)', '½ teaspoon active dry yeast', '½ teaspoon white sugar', '1 cup milk', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '1 cup semolina flour', '2 eggs', '2 teaspoons baking powder', '1 teaspoon salt', '6 tablespoons butter', '¾ cup honey', '1 teaspoon orange-flower water, or to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the water, yeast, and sugar in a blender, and let stand without blending for 5 minutes, until the yeast softens and begins to form a creamy foam.
', 'Step 2: Add the milk, flour, semolina flour, eggs, baking powder, and salt.
', 'Step 3: Blend until the mixture is smooth, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 4: Leave the mixture in the blender to rest for about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Heat a 5-inch nonstick skillet over medium-low heat.
', 'Step 6: Blend the pancake mixture for about 10 seconds, to remix, and scoop 1/4 to 1/3 cup of batter into the heated skillet.
', 'Step 7: Cook the beghrir until bubbles have formed and popped, and the top of the pancake is no longer shiny, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Do not flip.
', 'Step 9: Adjust the heat as necessary so that the bottoms of the pancakes are just starting to brown when the tops are dry.
', 'Step 10: Blend the batter for 10 seconds or so after cooking 3 or 4 pancakes, to keep the batter fluffy.
', 'Step 11: To make the sauce, place the butter, honey, and flower-water flavoring in a microwave-safe bowl, and microwave on High setting until the butter is melted and the honey is hot, about 1 1/2 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Stir the sauce, and drizzle about 1 tablespoon over each warm pancake to serve.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '353.8 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '53.8 g', 'cholesterolContent': '95.8 mg', 'fatContent': '14.2 g', 'fiberContent': '0.7 g', 'proteinContent': '6 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '8.4 g', 'sodiumContent': '675.4 mg', 'sugarContent': '37.2 g'}

Title: Saboob (Egyptian Flatbread)
Ingredients: ['2 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for work surface', '1 teaspoon salt', '¾ cup milk', '1 tablespoon olive oil']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
', 'Step 3: Whisk flour and salt together in a bowl; form a well in the center.
', 'Step 4: Add milk and oil; mix until smooth dough forms.
', 'Step 5: Turn dough out onto a lightly-floured work surface; knead until smooth and pliable, 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Set dough aside to rest for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Divide dough into 4 equal pieces; roll out each piece with a rolling pin to 1/4-inch thickness.
', 'Step 8: Arrange on prepared baking sheet.
', 'Step 9: Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned, 8 to 10 minutes.
']

Title: Chutney Chicken

', 'Step 2: In a medium bowl, combine chutney and dry soup mix.
', 'Step 3: Mix together.
', 'Step 4: Season chicken pieces with salt and pepper to taste.
', 'Step 5: Place seasoned chicken pieces in a 9x13 inch baking dish and pour chutney mixture over chicken.

Title: Algerian Couscous
Ingredients: ['¼ cup olive oil, or more as needed, divided', '8 mutton chops, fat removed', '4 chicken drumsticks', '1 pinch salt and ground black pepper to taste', '3 onions, quartered', 'water to cover', '2 tablespoons ground turmeric', '2 tablespoons ground cumin', '2 tablespoons ground coriander', '3 potatoes, cut into chunks', '3 turnips, cut into chunks', '3 carrots, sliced lengthwise and cut into chunks', '1 (6 ounce) can tomato paste', '2 tablespoons ras el hanout', '1 (7 ounce) can chickpeas, drained', '2 zucchini, sliced lengthwise and cut into chunks', '5 sprigs cilantro, chopped', '3 cups water', '2 cups couscous', '1 tablespoon butter', '3 tablespoons harissa']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat 3 tablespoons olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Season mutton chops and chicken drumsticks with salt and pepper; cook in batches with onions in the hot oil until browned, about 2 minutes per side.
', 'Step 3: Transfer to a large plate.
', 'Step 4: Scrape the bottom of the pot with a wooden spoon to release browned bits.
', 'Step 5: Return mutton chops and chicken to the pot.
', 'Step 6: Pour in enough water to cover; add turmeric, cumin, and coriander.
', 'Step 7: Cover and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 8: Reduce heat to medium; simmer for 20 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Stir potatoes, turnips, and carrots into the pot.
', 'Step 10: Simmer, covered, until vegetables start to soften, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Mix in tomato paste and ras el hanout; cook for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Stir in chickpeas, zucchini, and cilantro; continue cooking, covered, until zucchini is tender, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Bring 3 cups water to a boil in a saucepan; remove from heat and stir in couscous and butter.
', 'Step 14: Cover saucepan and let stand until water is absorbed completely, 5 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Fluff couscous with a fork and stir in 1 tablespoon olive oil.
', 'Step 16: Transfer to a serving dish.
', 'Step 17: Ladle 2 scoops of cooking liquid into a bowl; mix in harissa until smooth.
', 'Step 18: Scoop vegetables onto a serving plate.
', 'Step 19: Scoop mutton and chicken onto a separate plate.
', 'Step 20: Serve alongside couscous, harissa sauce, and remaining cooking liquid in the pot.
']

Title: The Perfect Egyptian Rice with Vermicelli
Ingredients: ['1 ½ tablespoons olive oil', '¼ cup 1/2-inch long vermicelli', '1 cup Egyptian rice (short-grain rice)', 'salt to taste', '1 ¾ cups water']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat oil in a saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Add vermicelli; cook, stirring constantly, until golden brown, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 4: Pour in rice and salt; stir until coated with oil.
', 'Step 5: Reduce heat to low.
', 'Step 6: Cook the rice mixture, stirring constantly, until rice turns pasty white, 3 to 5 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Bring water to a boil in a saucepan.
', 'Step 8: Stir water into the rice mixture.
', 'Step 9: Cover; cook until most of the water is absorbed, 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Turn off heat; let sit until remaining water is absorbed, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Fluff rice with a fork.
']

Title: Gomen Wat
Ingredients: ['1 pound collard greens - rinsed, trimmed and chopped', '2 cups water', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '¾ cup chopped onions', '8 cloves garlic, chopped', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 ½ cups sliced green bell pepper', '1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice', '1 teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground turmeric', '½ teaspoon paprika', '½ teaspoon ground allspice', '2 tablespoons minced fresh ginger root']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place chopped collard greens in a pot with 2 cups of water.
', 'Step 2: Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low.
', 'Step 3: Cover, and simmer until collards are tender, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Drain, but reserve the cooking water.
', 'Step 5: Set aside.
', 'Step 6: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 7: Stir in onions and cook until just beginning to brown, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Stir in garlic and cook for 1 minute.
', 'Step 9: Add the cooked collards, 1 tablespoon olive oil, and the reserved cooking water.
', 'Step 10: Simmer, uncovered, over medium-high heat until liquid is nearly evaporated, 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Add the green pepper slices, lemon juice, salt, turmeric, paprika, allspice, and ginger root.
', 'Step 12: Cook until peppers are soft, about 5 minutes.
']

Title: Balah el Sham (Egyptian Choux Pastry)
Ingredients: ['3 cups water, divided', '2 cups white sugar, divided', '1 lime, juiced', '2 teaspoons vanilla extract, divided', '2 ½ cups vegetable oil', '½ teaspoon salt', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '4 eggs', '2 cups corn oil']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine 1 cup water and 1 cup sugar in a saucepan over high heat.
', 'Step 2: Bring to a boil; stir until sugar dissolves.
', 'Step 3: Reduce heat to medium; add lime juice.
', 'Step 4: Simmer until flavors combine, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 6: Stir 1 teaspoon vanilla extract into the syrup; let cool.
', 'Step 7: Stir 2 cups water, 1 cup sugar, vegetable oil, and salt together in a pot over medium-high heat; bring to a boil.
', 'Step 8: Reduce heat to medium.
', 'Step 9: Add flour; stir vigorously with a wooden spoon until batter forms into a ball.
', 'Step 10: Cook until batter is shiny, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 11: Transfer to a bowl; allow to cool, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 12: Flatten batter into the bottom of the bowl.
', 'Step 13: Add eggs, 1 at a time, mixing well after each addition.
', 'Step 14: Stir in remaining 1 teaspoon vanilla extract; mix until batter is creamy.
', 'Step 15: Pour into a cloth piping bag fitted with a large star tip.
', 'Step 16: Heat corn oil in a deep saucepan over medium heat until bubbly; reduce heat to medium-low.
', 'Step 17: Squeeze 2 inches of batter onto an oiled spatula and lower into the hot oil; repeat until saucepan is full.
', 'Step 18: Cook, turning occasionally, until golden brown, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 19: Transfer pastries to a paper bag to drain, about 30 seconds.
', 'Step 20: Soak hot pastries in syrup; transfer to a plate to cool, about 5 minutes.
']

Title: Jollof Rice
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 large onion, sliced', '2 (14.5 ounce) cans stewed tomatoes', '½ (6 ounce) can tomato paste', '1 teaspoon salt', '¼ teaspoon black pepper', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '½ teaspoon red pepper flakes', '1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce', '1 teaspoon chopped fresh rosemary', '2 cups water', '1 (3 pound) whole chicken, cut into 8 pieces', '1 cup uncooked white rice', '1 cup diced carrots', '½ pound fresh green beans, trimmed and snapped into 1 to 2 inch pieces', '¼ teaspoon ground nutmeg']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Pour oil into large saucepan.
', 'Step 2: Cook onion in oil over medium-low heat until translucent.
', 'Step 3: Stir in stewed tomatoes and tomato paste, and season with salt, black pepper, cayenne pepper, red pepper flakes, Worcestershire sauce and rosemary.
', 'Step 4: Cover, and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 5: Reduce heat, stir in water, and add chicken pieces.
', 'Step 6: Simmer for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Stir in rice, carrots, and green beans, and season with nutmeg.
', 'Step 8: Bring to a boil, then reduce heat to low.
', 'Step 9: Cover, and simmer until the chicken is fork-tender and the rice is cooked, 25 to 30 minutes.
']

Title: Peri Peri African Chicken
Ingredients: ['¼ cup paprika', '2 tablespoons hot chili powder', '1 cup fresh lemon juice', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '1 ½ teaspoons chopped fresh ginger', '1 ½ teaspoons salt', '4 bone-in chicken breast halves']

', 'Step 2: Rub chicken with the mixture, place in a dish, and marinate for 3 hours.
', 'Step 3: Preheat a grill for medium heat.
', 'Step 4: Place chicken onto the grill and discard the marinade.
', 'Step 5: Cook for about 30 minutes, turning occasionally, until the skin is slightly charred and juices run clear.
']

Title: Marrakesh Vegetable Curry
Ingredients: ['1 sweet potato, peeled and cubed', '1 medium eggplant, cubed', '1 green bell pepper, chopped', '1 red bell pepper, chopped', '2 carrots, chopped', '1 onion, chopped', '6 tablespoons olive oil', '3 cloves garlic, minced', '1 teaspoon ground turmeric', '1 tablespoon curry powder', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '¾ tablespoon sea salt', '¾ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '1 (15 ounce) can garbanzo beans, drained', '¼ cup blanched almonds', '1 zucchini, sliced', '2 tablespoons raisins', '1 cup orange juice', '10 ounces spinach']

['Step 1: In a large Dutch oven place sweet potato, eggplant, peppers, carrots, onion, and three tablespoons oil.
', 'Step 2: Saute over medium heat for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: In a medium saucepan place 3 tablespoons olive oil, garlic, turmeric, curry powder, cinnamon, salt and pepper and saute over medium heat for 3 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Pour garlic and spice mixture into the Dutch oven with vegetables in it.
', 'Step 5: Add the garbanzo beans, almonds, zucchini, raisins, and orange juice.
', 'Step 6: Simmer 20 minutes, covered.
', 'Step 7: Add spinach to pot and cook for 5 more minutes.
', 'Step 8: Serve!
']

Title: Green Banana Fries

', 'Step 2: Slice into long thin wedges or strings to make fries.
', 'Step 3: Heat the oil in a heavy deep skillet over medium-high heat.

Title: Harira
Ingredients: ['1 pound cubed lamb meat', '1 teaspoon ground turmeric', '1 ½ teaspoons ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', '¼ teaspoon ground ginger', '¼ teaspoon ground cayenne pepper', '2 tablespoons margarine', '¾ cup chopped celery', '1 onion, chopped', '1 red onion, chopped', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro', '1 (29 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '7 cups water', '¾ cup green lentils', '1 (15 ounce) can garbanzo beans, drained', '4 ounces vermicelli pasta', '2 eggs, beaten', '1 lemon, juiced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place the lamb, turmeric, black pepper, cinnamon, ginger, cayenne, butter, celery, onion, and cilantro into a large soup pot over a low heat.
', 'Step 2: Stir frequently for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Pour tomatoes (reserve juice) into the mixture and let simmer for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Pour tomato juice, 7 cups water, and the lentils into the pot.
', 'Step 5: Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to simmer.
', 'Step 6: Let soup simmer, covered, for 2 hours.
', 'Step 7: About 10 minutes before serving turn the heat to medium-high, place chickpeas and noodles into the soup, let cook about 10 minutes (until noodles are al dente).
', 'Step 8: Stir in lemon and eggs, let eggs cook 1 minute.
']

Title: Egyptian Koshary
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '2 cups uncooked white rice', '3 cups water', '1 teaspoon salt', '1 (16 ounce) package uncooked elbow macaroni', '1 cup beluga lentils, soaked in water', '½ teaspoon salt', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '5 onions, minced', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '3 tablespoons distilled white vinegar', '4 ripe tomatoes, diced', '½ cup tomato paste', '1 ½ teaspoons salt', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '2 ½ teaspoons ground cumin', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 2: Stir in rice; continue stirring until rice is coated with oil, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Add 3 cups water and 1 teaspoon of salt.
', 'Step 4: Bring to a boil; reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer until the rice is tender and liquid has been absorbed, 20 to 25 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil over high heat.
', 'Step 6: Stir in the macaroni, and return to a boil.
', 'Step 7: Cook the macaroni uncovered, stirring occasionally, until the it has cooked through, but is still firm to the bite, about 8 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Drain well in a colander.
', 'Step 9: Return macaroni to cooking pot, cover and keep warm.
', 'Step 10: Soak lentils for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Drain and rinse; drain again.
', 'Step 12: Bring 2 cups water to a boil in a pot and stir in lentils.
', 'Step 13: Bring to a boil; cover and reduce heat to low.
', 'Step 14: Simmer until lentils are tender 15 or 20 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Stir in 1/2 teaspoon salt.
', 'Step 16: Heat 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 17: Cook the onions in the oil, stirring often, until they begin to brown, 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 18: Onions should be a nice caramelized brown color.
', 'Step 19: Add garlic and cook another minute.
', 'Step 20: Remove from pan, drain on a paper towel-lined plate.
', 'Step 21: Place half of the onion mixture into a saucepan.
', 'Step 22: Mix in the vinegar.
', 'Step 23: Add the chopped tomatoes and tomato paste, black pepper, 2 1/2 teaspoons salt, cumin, and cayenne (if using).
', 'Step 24: Bring to a boil then reduce heat to medium-low and simmer about 12 minutes.
', 'Step 25: Serve by placing a spoonful of rice, then macaroni, and then the lentils on serving plates.
', 'Step 26: Sprinkle with some of the browned onions, then top with tomato sauce.
']

Title: Moroccan Couscous
Ingredients: ['1 ¼ teaspoons ground cumin', '½ teaspoon ground ginger', '¼ teaspoon ground cloves', '⅛ teaspoon ground cayenne pepper', '½ teaspoon ground cardamom', '¼ teaspoon ground coriander', '¼ teaspoon ground allspice', '1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 red onion, cut in half and thinly sliced', '1 red, green, or yellow bell pepper, cut into 1" pieces', '2 zucchinis, halved lengthwise and cut into 3/4 inch pieces', '½ cup golden raisins', '1 teaspoon kosher salt', 'grated zest of one orange', '1 (14.5 ounce) can low sodium garbanzo beans, rinsed and drained', '1 ½ cups chicken broth', '½ cup orange juice', '1 ½ cups couscous', '3 tablespoons chopped fresh mint']

['Step 1: Place a large, heavy bottomed pot over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Stir in the cumin, ginger, cloves, cayenne, cardamom, coriander, and allspice; gently toast until fragrant, about 2 to 3 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Stir in oil and onion, cook until softened.
', 'Step 4: Stir in the bell pepper, and zucchini; cook for 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Stir in the raisins, salt, zest, and garbanzos.
', 'Step 6: Pour in the chicken broth and orange juice; turn heat to high and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 7: When the mixture is boiling, stir in the couscous and remove from heat; cover, and let stand 5 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Fluff with a fork, and fold in chopped mint.
']

Title: Sabaayad (Somali Flatbread)
Ingredients: ['4 cups all-purpose flour', '1 teaspoon salt', '3 tablespoons olive oil', '2 tablespoons honey', '1 ½ cups lukewarm water', '2 tablespoons canola oil, divided, or more as needed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine flour and salt in a large bowl.
', 'Step 2: Stir in olive oil and honey.
', 'Step 3: Mix in water gradually until dough comes together and is the consistency of pizza dough.
', 'Step 4: Knead by hand until soft and very smooth, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Brush top of dough with a little bit of canola oil.
', 'Step 6: Cover with plastic wrap and set aside to rest, at least 30 minutes and up to 2 hours.
', 'Step 7: Divide dough into 10 equal pieces.
', 'Step 8: Roll out 1 piece into a circle on a lightly floured work surface.
', 'Step 9: Brush the top of the dough evenly with canola oil.
', 'Step 10: Fold sides in to meet in the center.
', 'Step 11: Fold top and bottom edges to meet in the center to make a square shape.
', 'Step 12: Repeat with remaining pieces.
', 'Step 13: Preheat a large skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 14: Roll 1 square of dough into a circle again on a lightly floured work surface.
', 'Step 15: Place in the skillet and cook until slightly puffed, 1 to 2 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Drizzle a little bit of oil on top and flip; continue cooking until golden brown and crispy, 1 to 2 minutes more.
', 'Step 17: Transfer to a plate and cover with a clean kitchen towel to keep sabaayad warm and soft.
', 'Step 18: Repeat with remaining pieces.
']

Title: African Peanut Soup
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons olive oil', '2 medium onions, chopped', '2 large red bell peppers, chopped', '4 cloves garlic, minced', '1 (28 ounce) can crushed tomatoes, with liquid', '8 cups vegetable broth or stock', '¼ teaspoon pepper', '¼ teaspoon chili powder', '⅔ cup extra crunchy peanut butter', '½ cup uncooked brown rice']

['Step 1: Heat oil in a large stock pot over medium high heat.
', 'Step 2: Cook onions and bell peppers until lightly browned and tender, stirring in garlic when almost done to prevent burning.
', 'Step 3: Stir in tomatoes, vegetable stock, pepper, and chili powder.
', 'Step 4: Reduce heat to low and simmer, uncovered, for 30 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Stir in rice, cover, and simmer another fifteen minutes or until rice is tender.
', 'Step 6: Stir in peanut butter until well blended, and serve.

Title: South African Brown Pudding
Ingredients: ['2 cups white sugar', '4 eggs', '2 cups flour', '2 teaspoons baking powder', '2 teaspoons baking soda', '½ teaspoon salt', '3 tablespoons distilled white vinegar', '2 tablespoons apricot jam', '2 cups milk', '1 cup sugar', '1 cup water', '1 cup milk', '½ cup butter or margarine', '2 teaspoons vanilla']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat an oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Beat 2 cups sugar and eggs with an electric mixer in a large bowl until light and fluffy.
', 'Step 3: Stir in the flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, vinegar, and apricot jam.
', 'Step 4: Pour in 2 cups of milk and stir until well combined.
', 'Step 5: Spoon the batter into a greased, 2 quart oven-proof baking dish.
', 'Step 6: Bake in the preheated oven for 60 to 70 minutes, or until a knife inserted into the center comes out clean.
', 'Step 7: Pierce the baked pudding several times with a skewer or fork.
', 'Step 8: Place 1 cup sugar, water, 1 cup milk, butter, and vanilla in a saucepan and stir over medium heat.

', 'Step 10: Serve warm.

Title: Om Ali
Ingredients: ['1 (17.5 ounce) package frozen puff pastry sheets, thawed', '½ cup chopped walnuts', '1 cup chopped pecans', '1 cup chopped hazelnuts', '1 cup raisins', '1 cup flaked coconut', '1 ¼ cups white sugar, divided', '4 cups milk', '½ cup heavy cream']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Butter a 9x13-inch baking dish.
', 'Step 3: Place the pastry sheets in the baking dish and place the dish in the oven.
', 'Step 4: Watch it closely.
', 'Step 5: When the top layer turns crunchy and golden, remove it from the oven.
', 'Step 6: Continue until all the sheets are cooked.
', "Step 7: Preheat the oven's broiler.
", 'Step 8: In a bowl, combine walnuts, pecans, hazelnuts, raisins, coconut and 1/4 cup sugar.
', 'Step 9: Break cooked pastry into pieces and stir into nut mixture.
', 'Step 10: Spread mixture evenly in 9x13-inch dish.
', 'Step 11: Bring milk and 1/2 cup sugar to a boil in a medium saucepan over medium heat.
', 'Step 12: Pour over nut mixture.
', 'Step 13: Beat the heavy cream with the remaining 1/2 cup sugar until stiff peaks form.

', 'Step 15: Place dessert under oven broiler until top is golden brown, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Serve hot.
']

Title: Tunisian Harissa

', 'Step 2: Soak in cold water for 20 minutes, then drain.

', 'Step 5: Store in the refrigerator.
']

Title: Spanish Moroccan Fish
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 onion, chopped', '1 clove garlic, finely chopped', '1 (15 ounce) can garbanzo beans, drained and rinsed', '2 red bell peppers, seeded and sliced into strips', '1 large carrot, thinly sliced', '3 tomatoes, chopped', '4 olives, chopped', '¼ cup chopped fresh parsley', '¼ cup ground cumin', '3 tablespoons paprika', '2 tablespoons chicken bouillon granules', '1 teaspoon cayenne pepper', 'salt to taste', '5 pounds tilapia fillets']

['Step 1: Heat vegetable oil in a skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Stir in onion and garlic; cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Add garbanzo beans, bell peppers, carrots, tomatoes, and olives; continue to cook until the peppers are slightly tender, about 5 minutes more.
', 'Step 4: Sprinkle parsley, cumin, paprika, chicken bouillon, and cayenne over the vegetables.
', 'Step 5: Season with salt.
', 'Step 6: Stir to incorporate.
', 'Step 7: Place tilapia on top of the vegetables and add enough water to cover the vegetables.
', 'Step 8: Reduce heat to low, cover, and cook until fish flakes easily with a fork and juices run clear, about 40 minutes.
']

Title: South African Malvapoeding (Marshmallow Pudding)
Ingredients: ['2 tablespoons butter', '1 teaspoon white vinegar', '½ cup milk', '1 cup superfine sugar', '2 eggs', '1 tablespoon apricot jelly', '1 ⅓ cups cake flour', '1 teaspoon baking soda', '1 pinch salt', '1 cup heavy cream', '½ cup butter', '½ cup white sugar', '½ cup water, orange juice, or sherry']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: In a small saucepan over low heat, melt 2 tablespoons butter or margarine together with vinegar and milk.
', 'Step 3: Remove from heat, and set aside.
', 'Step 4: Meanwhile, sift flour, baking soda, and salt together into a separate bowl.
', 'Step 5: Beat 1 cup sugar and eggs with an electric mixer on high speed until fluffy and light colored, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Gradually mix in the apricot jam.
', 'Step 7: Fold the dry ingredients into the egg mixture alternately with warmed milk mixture using a spatula.
', 'Step 8: Pour batter into a greased, 1 quart oven-proof baking dish.
', 'Step 9: Bake approximately 45 minutes, or until a knife inserted into the center comes out clean.
', 'Step 10: Place cream, butter, 1/2 cup sugar, and water in a saucepan and stir over moderate heat until the butter has melted and sugar is dissolved.
', 'Step 11: Do not allow the mixture to boil.
', 'Step 12: Remove pudding from the oven, pierce several times with a skewer or fork, and pour the hot cream mixture immediately over the pudding.
', 'Step 13: Serve hot or cold.
']

Title: Nigerian Jollof Rice with Chicken and Fried Plantains
Ingredients: ['2 pounds chicken drumsticks', '½ large onion, diced', '1 (2 inch) piece fresh ginger root, peeled and thinly sliced', '2 cubes chicken bouillon, crushed', '2 cloves garlic, diced', '1 tablespoon curry powder, or more to taste', '1 teaspoon herbes de Provence', 'freshly ground black pepper', '1 pinch cayenne pepper', '1 cup water', '3 tablespoons vegetable oil', '½ large onion, diced', '1 (14 ounce) can tomato sauce', '1 (14 ounce) can coconut milk', '1 teaspoon herbes de Provence', '1 teaspoon salt, or to taste', '½ teaspoon ground black pepper, or to taste', "3 cups parboiled rice (such as Uncle Ben's®)", '1 (10 ounce) package frozen mixed vegetables (carrots, corn, peas)', '4 ripe plantains, peeled and cut diagonally into 1/2-inch slices', '½ cup canola oil for frying']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place chicken drumsticks in a large Dutch oven over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Add 1/2 onion, ginger, crushed bouillon cubes, garlic, curry powder, 1 teaspoon herbes de Provence, black pepper, and cayenne pepper.
', 'Step 3: Mix well.
', 'Step 4: Cook until chicken starts sticking to the bottom, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Pour in water, mix, cover the pot, and bring to a gentle simmer; cook for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 7: Transfer chicken to a baking dish using a slotted spoon.
', 'Step 8: Strain cooking liquid through a fine-mesh sieve.
', 'Step 9: Reserve 1 1/2 cups liquid.
', 'Step 10: Discard solids.
', 'Step 11: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
', 'Step 12: Bake chicken in the preheated oven until no longer pink in the middle and the juices run clear, about 30 minutes.
', 'Step 13: An instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part should read 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
', 'Step 14: Heat 3 tablespoons vegetable oil in a large pot over medium-low heat and cook 1/2 onion until soft and translucent but not browned, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 15: Add tomato sauce; cook and stir until slightly thickened and infused into the oil, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Stir reserved chicken broth, coconut milk, 1 teaspoon herbes de Provence, salt, and pepper into the pot.
', 'Step 17: Bring to a simmer; add rice.
', 'Step 18: Cook, stirring often, until rice is almost tender, 15 to 20 minutes.
', 'Step 19: Add frozen vegetables and continue cooking until rice is tender and creamy, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 20: Heat 1/2 cup of canola oil in a nonstick pan over medium heat.
', 'Step 21: Add plantains and fry on both sides until golden and crispy, about 2 to 3 minutes per side.
', 'Step 22: Drain on paper towels.
', 'Step 23: Garnish jollof rice with friend plantains and serve with chicken.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '703.2 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '96.3 g', 'cholesterolContent': '70.8 mg', 'fatContent': '22.8 g', 'fiberContent': '6.9 g', 'proteinContent': '31.7 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '11.7 g', 'sodiumContent': '942 mg', 'sugarContent': '16.5 g'}

Title: Couscous with Olives and Sun-Dried Tomato
Ingredients: ['1 ¼ cups vegetable broth', '1 ¼ cups water', '2 cups pearl (Israeli) couscous', '1 pinch salt', '1 pinch ground black pepper', '5 tablespoons olive oil, divided', '½ cup pine nuts', '4 cloves garlic, minced', '1 shallot, minced', '½ cup sliced black olives', '⅓ cup sun-dried tomatoes packed in oil, drained and chopped', '1 cup vegetable broth', '¼ cup chopped fresh flat-leaf parsley']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Bring 1 1/4 cup vegetable broth and water to a boil in a saucepan, stir in couscous, and mix in salt and black pepper.
', 'Step 2: Reduce heat to low and simmer until liquid is absorbed, about 8 minutes.
', 'Step 3: Heat 3 tablespoons olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat; stir in pine nuts and cook, stirring frequently, until pine nuts smell toasted and are golden brown, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 4: Remove from heat.
', 'Step 5: Heat remaining 2 tablespoons olive oil in a saucepan; cook and stir garlic and shallot in the hot oil until softened, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Stir black olives and sun-dried tomatoes into garlic mixture and cook until heated through, 2 to 3 minutes, stirring often.
', 'Step 7: Slowly pour in 1 cup vegetable broth and bring mixture to a boil.
', 'Step 8: Reduce heat to low and simmer until sauce has reduced, 8 to 10 minutes.
', 'Step 9: Transfer couscous to a large serving bowl, mix with sauce, and serve topped with parsley and pine nuts.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '527.7 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '55.5 g', 'fatContent': '29.3 g', 'fiberContent': '5.4 g', 'proteinContent': '13 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '4.1 g', 'sodiumContent': '455.1 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.9 g'}

Title: African Curry
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 onion, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, peeled and chopped', '1 bay leaf', '1 (14.5 ounce) can whole peeled tomatoes, drained', '2 teaspoons curry powder', '⅛ teaspoon salt', '1 (2 to 3 pound) whole chicken, bones and skin removed, cut into pieces', '1 (14 ounce) can unsweetened coconut milk', '1 lemon, juiced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat olive oil in a large, heavy skillet over medium heat.
', 'Step 2: Stir in the onion, garlic, and bay leaf, and saute until onion is lightly browned.
', 'Step 3: Mix tomatoes, curry powder, and salt into the skillet, and continue cooking about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Mix in the chicken, and cook 15 to 20 minutes, until no longer pink and juices run clear.
', 'Step 5: Reduce skillet heat to low.
', 'Step 6: Stirring constantly, gradually blend in the coconut milk over a period of about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 7: Mix in lemon juice just before serving.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '600.1 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '13.4 g', 'cholesterolContent': '198.8 mg', 'fatContent': '33.4 g', 'fiberContent': '4.2 g', 'proteinContent': '64.4 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '21.3 g', 'sodiumContent': '452 mg', 'sugarContent': '3.6 g'}

Title: Moroccan-Spiced Pork Roast
Ingredients: ['1 (3 pound) boneless pork loin roast', '5 teaspoons kosher salt', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '1 teaspoon ground coriander', '1 teaspoon ground ginger', '1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon smoked paprika', '¼ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '½ teaspoon ground cinnamon', '¼ teaspoon ground cloves', '¼ teaspoon ground allspice', '3 tablespoons honey, or as needed', '8 baby potatoes', '2 carrots, cut into 2-inch chunks', '2 Anaheim chile peppers, halved and seeded', '1 red onion, roughly chopped', '2 tablespoons olive oil', 'salt to taste', '½ cup plain Greek yogurt', '2 tablespoons thinly sliced fresh mint', '1 clove garlic, finely crushed']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Butterfly the pork loin by cutting almost all the way through, starting on the thinnest side, keeping your knife flat and parallel to the cutting board.
', 'Step 2: Stop about 1 inch from the opposite edge you started, so that the meat opens up like a book.
', "Step 3: A few more shallow cuts can be made if the pork is not opening up enough to flatten out, but do not cut all the way through, otherwise you'll end up with two pieces.
", 'Step 4: Season the butterflied pork on both sides with kosher salt and let sit out at room temperature for 30 to 45 minutes, or 2 to 3 hours in the fridge.
', 'Step 5: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 6: Grease a roasting pan with 2 tablespoons olive oil.
', 'Step 7: Pat the tenderloin dry with a paper towel.
', 'Step 8: Mix cumin, coriander, ginger, black pepper, smoked paprika,cayenne, cinnamon, cloves, allspice, and honey together in a bowl with a spoon.
', 'Step 9: Spread about half of the spice mixture inside the butterflied pork, fold it back together, and spread the remaining mixture all over the surface.
', 'Step 10: Use 3 or 4 pieces of kitchen string to tie the loin up every few inches, cutting off extra string.
', 'Step 11: Toss potatoes, carrots, chile peppers, and onion with olive oil and salt in a bowl.
', 'Step 12: Place the pork into the prepared roasting pan and surround with vegetable mixture.
', 'Step 13: Roast in the preheated oven until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of the loin reads at least 140 to 145 degrees F (60 to 63 degrees C), about 1 hour and 15 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Remove from the oven and turn roast over with tongs in pan drippings.
', 'Step 15: Transfer to a plate, cover loosely with foil, and let rest for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Increase oven temperature to 425 degrees F. Toss vegetable mixture in pan drippings and return to the oven to crisp up, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 17: Combine yogurt, mint, and garlic in a small bowl for sauce.
', 'Step 18: Remove strings on roast.
', 'Step 19: Slice, spoon pan drippings over, and serve with vegetables and yogurt sauce.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '332.5 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '32.9 g', 'cholesterolContent': '56.4 mg', 'fatContent': '12.2 g', 'fiberContent': '4.1 g', 'proteinContent': '23.2 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '3.5 g', 'sodiumContent': '876.6 mg', 'sugarContent': '7.2 g'}

Title: Vegan Chickpea Curry without Coconut Milk
Ingredients: ['2 (15 ounce) cans chickpeas', '1 tablespoon baking soda', '1 tablespoon vegetable oil', '1 onion, finely chopped', '1 teaspoon ginger-garlic paste', '½ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '½ teaspoon salt', '½ teaspoon ground turmeric', '½ teaspoon garam masala', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes', '2 (10 ounce) packages frozen chopped spinach, thawed and drained']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Drain and rinse chickpeas under cold running water.
', 'Step 2: Place in a bowl, cover with cold water, and stir in baking soda.
', 'Step 3: Soak for 10 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Drain and rinse thoroughly.
', 'Step 5: Heat oil in a pot and cook onion until soft and translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Stir in garlic-ginger paste, cayenne, salt, turmeric, and garam masala.
', 'Step 7: Cook and stir until spices are well absorbed by the onion, about 2 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Add tomatoes and frozen spinach; stir to combine.
', 'Step 9: Add chickpeas and stir gently.
', 'Step 10: Simmer until flavors are well combined, about 20 minutes.
', 'Step 11: Add a little water if sauce is too thick.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '285.6 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '46.6 g', 'fatContent': '6 g', 'fiberContent': '12.2 g', 'proteinContent': '13.6 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '0.8 g', 'sodiumContent': '1970.3 mg', 'sugarContent': '5.8 g'}

Title: Chorba Hamra bel Frik (Algerian Lamb, Tomato, and Freekeh Soup)
Ingredients: ['1 cup freekeh', 'water to cover', '¾ pound lamb meat, cut into 1 1/2-inch cubes', '1 onion, grated', '1 teaspoon ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon paprika', '1 teaspoon ground cinnamon', 'salt to taste', '3 tablespoons vegetable oil', '1 bunch fresh cilantro, finely chopped, divided', '1 bunch fresh mint, finely chopped, divided', '1 stalk celery', '½ (14 ounce) can chickpeas, drained', '1 tablespoon tomato paste', '1 zucchini, diced', '1 carrot, diced', '3 medium ripe tomatoes', '1 potato, diced']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Place freekeh in a bowl and cover with cold water.
', 'Step 2: Set aside.
', 'Step 3: Combine lamb, onion, pepper, paprika, cinnamon, and salt in a pot.
', 'Step 4: Add oil, 1/2 of the cilantro, 1/2 of the mint, and celery and simmer over low heat for 15 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Stir in chickpeas and cover with a little water.
', 'Step 6: Bring to a gentle simmer.
', 'Step 7: Add tomato paste, zucchini, and carrot and mix well.
', 'Step 8: Set a steamer over the pot and add tomatoes.
', 'Step 9: Cover and steam tomatoes until soft, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Crush tomatoes using a wooden spoon so pulp drips into the soup.
', 'Step 11: Discard leftover tomato peels.
', 'Step 12: Add potato and enough water to cover.
', 'Step 13: Simmer until potato is soft, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 14: Drain freekeh and add to the soup.
', 'Step 15: Simmer until soft, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 16: Remove celery stalk.
', 'Step 17: Sprinkle soup with remaining cilantro and mint before serving.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '277 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '33.5 g', 'cholesterolContent': '24.1 mg', 'fatContent': '11.1 g', 'fiberContent': '6.9 g', 'proteinContent': '13 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '2.7 g', 'sodiumContent': '148.3 mg', 'sugarContent': '3 g'}

Title: Moroccan Chickpea Stew
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon olive oil', '1 small onion, chopped', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '2 teaspoons ground cumin', '2 teaspoons ground coriander', '½ teaspoon cayenne pepper, or to taste', '1 teaspoon garam masala', '½ teaspoon curry powder', '1 pinch salt', '3 potatoes, cut into 1/2-inch cubes', '1 (14.5 ounce) can diced tomatoes, undrained', '1 cup tomato sauce', '1 cup golden raisins', 'water, or enough to cover', '1 (14.5 ounce) can chickpeas, drained and rinsed', '1 bunch kale, ribs removed, chopped', '½ cup chopped fresh cilantro']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat; cook the onion and garlic in the hot oil until the onions are translucent, 5 to 7 minutes.
', 'Step 2: Stir the cumin, coriander, cayenne pepper, garam masala, curry powder, and salt into the onion and garlic; cook together until fragrant, about 1 minute.
', 'Step 3: Add the potatoes, diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, and raisins to the pot.
', 'Step 4: Pour enough water over the mixture to cover; bring to a simmer and cook until the potatoes are soft, 10 to 15 minutes.
', 'Step 5: Add the chickpeas and kale to the pot; simmer until the kale wilts, about 3 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Sprinkle the cilantro over the stew and immediately remove the pot from the heat.
']

Title: Stuffed Dates for Ramadan
Ingredients: ['20 pitted dates', '20 blanched almonds, toasted', '1 (8 ounce) container creme fraiche', '2 tablespoons chopped toasted almonds, or to taste']

Title: Piri Piri Chicken
Ingredients: ["10 African bird's eye chile peppers", '1 bunch cilantro', '2 cloves garlic, minced', '2 tablespoons vegetable oil', '2 teaspoons white vinegar', '2 limes, juiced', '1 teaspoon salt, or to taste', '1 teaspoon fresh ground black pepper, or to taste', '1 chicken breast, cut in half', '2 chicken leg quarters with skin']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Use rubber gloves to mince the chiles and place into a mixing bowl.
', 'Step 2: Add cilantro, garlic, vegetable oil, vinegar, lime juice, salt, and black pepper.
', 'Step 3: Mix piri piri sauce well.
', 'Step 4: Place chicken breasts and legs into a resealable plastic bag.
', 'Step 5: Pour in piri piri sauce, seal the bag, and shake gently to completely cover chicken.
', 'Step 6: Put the bag in the refrigerator to marinate at least 4 hours.
', 'Step 7: Remove bag from the refrigerator about 30 minutes before cooking to allow chicken to come to room temperature.
', 'Step 8: Preheat an outdoor grill for medium heat and lightly oil the grate.
', 'Step 9: Remove chicken from the bag; discard bag and cilantro.
', 'Step 10: Cook chicken on the preheated grill, rotating as necessary to cook evenly, until juices run clear and an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C), about 25 minutes.
']

Title: Algerian Kefta (Meatballs)
Ingredients: ['1 pound lean ground beef', '4 cloves garlic, minced, divided', '¼ cup finely chopped onion, divided', 'salt and pepper to taste', '3 roma (plum) tomatoes, diced', '1 teaspoon dried parsley', '½ teaspoon ras el hanout', '½ cup water']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine the ground beef with half of the minced garlic and a tablespoon of chopped onion.
', 'Step 2: Mix with your hands until fully incorporated.
', 'Step 3: Shape the meat mixture into 1 1/2-inch oblong patties; you should have 12 to 14 meatballs.
', 'Step 4: Heat a skillet over medium-high heat.
', 'Step 5: Brown the patties in batches until they are crispy on both sides and are no longer pink in the center, about 10 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Set the meatballs aside in a rimmed serving dish and repeat with the remaining patties.
', 'Step 7: Reduce the heat to medium and stir in the remaining chopped onion.
', 'Step 8: Add salt and pepper.
', 'Step 9: Cook the onions in the drippings, stirring constantly, until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 10: Stir in the remaining half of the garlic and cook for 30 seconds.
', 'Step 11: Stir in the roma tomatoes, dried parsley, ras el hanout, and water.
', 'Step 12: Cook until the tomatoes are soft, about 5 minutes.
', 'Step 13: Pour the tomato sauce over the meatballs and serve.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '423.7 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '5.3 g', 'cholesterolContent': '113.5 mg', 'fatContent': '31.5 g', 'fiberContent': '1.2 g', 'proteinContent': '27.8 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '12.6 g', 'sodiumContent': '110.8 mg', 'sugarContent': '2.3 g'}

Title: Dukkah
Ingredients: ['⅔ cup hazelnuts', '½ cup sesame seeds', '2 tablespoons coriander seeds', '2 tablespoons cumin seeds', '2 tablespoons freshly ground black pepper', '1 teaspoon flaked sea salt']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
', 'Step 2: Place the hazelnuts on a baking sheet, and bake for about 5 minutes, or until fragrant.
', 'Step 3: While the nuts are still hot, pour them onto a tea towel.
', 'Step 4: Fold the towel over them to cover, and rub vigorously to remove the skins.
', 'Step 5: Set aside to cool.
', 'Step 6: In a dry skillet over medium heat, toast the sesame seeds until light golden brown.
', 'Step 7: Pour into a medium bowl as soon as they are done so they will not continue toasting.
', 'Step 8: In the same skillet, toast the coriander and cumin seeds while shaking the pan or stirring occasionally until they begin to pop.
', 'Step 9: Transfer to a food processor.
', 'Step 10: Process until finely ground, then pour into the bowl with the sesame seeds.
', 'Step 11: Place the cooled hazelnuts into the food processor, and process until finely ground.
', 'Step 12: Stir into the bowl with the spices.
', 'Step 13: Season with salt and pepper, and mix well.
']
Nutrition Label: {'calories': '45.3 calories', 'carbohydrateContent': '2.1 g', 'fatContent': '4 g', 'fiberContent': '1.1 g', 'proteinContent': '1.3 g', 'saturatedFatContent': '0.4 g', 'sodiumContent': '74.9 mg', 'sugarContent': '0.2 g'}

Title: Dessert Crepes
Ingredients: ['4 eggs, lightly beaten', '1 ⅓ cups milk', '2 tablespoons butter, melted', '1 cup all-purpose flour', '2 tablespoons white sugar', '½ teaspoon salt']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: In large bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, melted butter, flour sugar and salt until smooth.
', 'Step 2: Heat a medium-sized skillet or crepe pan over medium heat.
', 'Step 3: Grease pan with a small amount of butter or oil applied with a brush or paper towel.
', 'Step 4: Using a serving spoon or small ladle, spoon about 3 tablespoons crepe batter into hot pan, tilting the pan so that bottom surface is evenly coated.
', 'Step 5: Cook over medium heat, 1 to 2 minutes on a side, or until golden brown.
', 'Step 6: Serve immediately.
']

Title: Egyptian Okra
Ingredients: ['1 tablespoon butter', '1 medium onion, chopped', '1 green bell pepper, chopped', '5 cloves clove garlic, minced', '2 ½ cups chicken stock', '3 tablespoons tomato paste', '1 pound frozen okra', 'lemon, juiced', 'salt and pepper to taste']

', 'Step 2: Add chicken stock and tomato paste.
', 'Step 3: Stir to combine.
', 'Step 4: Reduce heat to medium.
', 'Step 5: Add okra and lemon juice and cook until okra is soft, about 15 minutes.
', 'Step 6: Season with salt and pepper.
']

Title: Chtitha Batata (Algerian Potato Stew)
Ingredients: ['4 cloves garlic, peeled and halved', '1 small fresh red chile pepper, seeded and chopped', '1 teaspoon ground cumin', '1 teaspoon paprika', '½ teaspoon black pepper', '½ teaspoon cayenne pepper', '½ teaspoon salt', '2 tablespoons olive oil', '1 ½ pounds new potatoes, halved', '1 tablespoon tomato paste', 'water to cover', 'salt to taste']
Cooking Instructions:
['Step 1: Combine garlic, chile pepper, cumin, paprika, black pepper, cayenne, and salt in a mortar; grind with a pestle until it forms a paste.
', 'Step 2: Add olive oil and mix dersa well.
', 'Step 3: Heat a large saucepan over medium heat and stir-fry dersa until fragrant, 2 to 4 minutes.
', 'Step 4: Add potato halves and stir to combine with the dersa.
', 'Step 5: Stir in tomato paste.
', 'Step 6: Pour in enough water to just cover the potatoes and bring to a boil.
', 'Step 7: Reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are tender, about 40 minutes.
', 'Step 8: Ladle potatoes into a serving bowl.
', 'Step 9: Spoon any remaining sauce over the potatoes.
']
